loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Stella has a business of stone quarrying, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more stones.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Stella hopes to generate greater profits and buy clothes for herself.  In the future, Stella hopes to own a house and have a good life. 

Stella is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more stones

loans.name: Champs De Victoire Plus Group

texts.en:
Norbert is the leader of the Community Bank named “Champs de Victoire Plus” which is composed of 26 members, united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Norbert, 27, married, has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2008. He operates a general store to the west of Kinshasa. He has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening two large stores in Kinshasa. He would also like to achieve financial independence through his business that earns him US$ 120 per week. He works to the best of his abilities and uses his contacts so that he might achieve his goals. 

Norbert is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having two times obtained and correctly repaid loans. He will increase his stock of merchandise with his next loan by buying canned goods, sacks of sugar and milk and reselling them at a profit. Norbert has two children, aged 8 months and 3 years old.

loans.use: to increase the store’s stock by buying biscuits, sugar and milk

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Baker's Group

texts.en:
David K. is the leader of the Baker's Group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. The members are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each member. With the help of this loan, group members will expand their businesses, increase sales, and consequently improve their living conditions.

David is 44 years old and pictured second from the right. He is married and has four children, one in primary school and three who are in secondary school. David has been working as a baker and bread seller for a very long time. He will use his share of the loan to buy additional supplies, such as bags of flour and yeast, to produce greater quantities of bread.

loans.use: To buy materials such as flour and yeast to produce bread

loans.name: United Pettie Traders Group

texts.en:
Taywa M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'United Pettie Traders'.  She is 30 years old, married, and has two children,  9 and 12 years old. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. 

For 10 years, she has been selling electrical materials in Clara Town Market, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 15,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 75,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more electrical materials. 

She describes herself as a determined woman whose dream is to improve her business and continue her education.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Isaac is inset at lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more electrical materials

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a widow. Her children have grown up and moved out. Valentina sells clothing at an open market in Kherson town. The very good location of her kiosk brings many clients her way. Her business does well. Valentina has been in this business for nine years, ever since she saw that women's clothing was one of the few products that sells well and produces a stable income. 

Valentina has used microloans before and found them very helpful for her business development. This time Valentina is requesting a loan of 12,200 Grivnas to add to the assortment of clothing she sells. She will spend the additional income to help her children.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is currently in the business of selling rice, beans and alcohol and is requesting a loan to stock more rice and beans to sell.  Esther is 30 years old married to a business man. She has one child and her child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a big shop.

loans.use: To stock more rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce A. is currently in the business of selling beans, simsim (sesame), etc. and is requesting a loan to stock bags of maize flour to sell.  Joyce is 29 years old and married to a farmer. She has three children. One of her children does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: To stock bags of maize flour to sell

loans.name: Blessing Of God Group

texts.en:
Aletha H., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Blessing Of God.  She is 38 years old and married with three children whose ages are between 16 and 21 years. She was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For 16 years, she has been selling palm oil, tomatoes, onions, rice, pepper and seasoning in Freeport Market Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 25,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 75,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of rice, gallons of oil and more dozens of tomatoes, onions and seasoning. She describes herself as a kind woman whose goals are to improve her business and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Fanta is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, gallons of oil, tomatoes, onions and seasonings

loans.name: Abekundire Women's, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
In Ibanda town there is a determined lady named K. Betty aged 32 years. She belongs to Abekundire women's group. She is a go-getter businesswoman who has a general merchandise retail shop. This stickler of hard work and married mother of three children has basked in the career graces of her business for over 12 years. With this experience behind her, she has managed to subdue most of the uncertain adversities that have threatened to play havoc with her business.
 
In a month, her business generates a profit of 480,000 Ugandan shillings. This to all intents and purposes is a low figure. What has played into her hands as she operates her business has been her exceptional customer relationship skills. Now she is taking a long view with an aim of maximizing her small profits. She figures this loan will come in significantly handy in helping her buy more stock and get into full control over her business. Currently she sells small household items.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is currently in the business of selling rice and beans and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans to sell.  Rose is 26 years old and is married to a peasant. She has five children and two of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: To stock more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en: Ganna is a widow. She works at two jobs: a salesperson at a store during the day and a sweeper at one of the local colleges in the evenings. She is requesting a loan of 6,500 Grivnas to paint the outside walls of her house.

loans.use: To fix her house

loans.name: Dinanga Plus Group

texts.en:
“Dinanga Plus” is a group of 24 owners of small businesses chaired by Rodrigues. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Rodrigues has been selling second hand clothing since 2004. She started her business selling tea and coffee. Over the years, her business prospered through determination and hard work, and she has been able to build a loyal customer base that has stabilized her business. With good management and savings, Rodrigues has been able to increase her working capital today. She sells at the market located in the eastern area of Kinshasa and her business makes $50 per week. She is confident with her business and she is determined to someday be a second hand clothing importer and provider in DRC in general and Kinshasa in particular. Rodrigues is 35 years old, married, and has three children between the ages 2 and 8. Two of them go to school.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of second hand clothing to resell at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Madelina

texts.en: Madelina M. is currently in the business of selling wax, shoes and saddles and is requesting a loan to stock dresses and trousers to sell.  Madelina is 35 years old and married to a driver. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock dresses and trousers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary S. is currently in the business of selling rice, beans and simsim and is requesting a loan to stock more of these goods to sell.  Mary is 35 years old and married to a farmer. She has four children and three of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop.

loans.use: To stock more goods to sell

loans.name: Hariet

texts.en: Hariet D. is currently in the business of selling rice, beans and 'simsim' (sesame seeds) and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell.  Hariet is 23 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

loans.use: Stock tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Epmcc Plus Group

texts.en:
“EPMCC Plus” is a group of 18 owners of small businesses chaired by Jean Claude. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Jean Claude, single, sells soap, sugar, salt, toilet paper, candles, matches, and so on. He has been in business since 1992. He began his business selling bags with the beginning capital of 20 USD. With hard work, good management and determination, his business has prospered. 

Jean Claude decided to join one of MFI Hope’s groups in October 2009. He has already received two loans from Hope that he repaid correctly. With his next loan he plans to reinforce the inventory of his business by buying items such as bags, matches, canned goods etc… in order to increase his income.  Jean Claude is 39 years old. He runs his business in the Western area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: to reinforce the inventory of his business by buying items such as bags, matches, toilet paper, cans, etc…

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Katende Development Group-Mpigi

texts.en:
It goes without saying and without any shadow of a doubt that the bedrock that will help any business grow and prosper is hard work and determination to succeed. M. Moses, who belongs to Katende Development group-Mpigi, knows this very well as he has experienced it first-hand in his commercial motorcycle business that he has operated for the last 4 years in Kasanje stage- Mpigi town. 

This business is one he began soon after he dropped out of school. He also does small-scale commercial farming. In a week he makes profits that add up to 50,000 shillings and with this loan he wants to pay the repair costs on his motorcycle.

loans.use: The repair costs on his motorcycle

loans.name: Kaja

texts.en: Kaja A. is currently in the business of selling beans, groundnuts and 'simsim' (sesame seeds)  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans to sell.  Kaja is 30 years old and is widowed.   She has four children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy chickens to be reared at home.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Nanziga Kwagalana Group-Mpigi

texts.en:
42-year-old K. Patrick of Nanziga Kwagalana group goes about his business excitedly and with enthusiasm. That has, for the past 7 years, been the trademark he has employed to obtain a dependable footing for his agro cash crop sales business in Mpigi. He mostly sells coffee.  

With this line of business combined with his mondus operandi, he has  made progress by leaps and bounds.  A business that started off small is now grown, principally due to the stable and reliable price of coffee on the local market. 

Patrick also does farming and animal husbandry. In a month, he makes 450,000 shillings. This married father of eight likes to describe himself as God-fearing and diligent. With this loan, he wants to purchase more coffee for resale and also pay his farm laborers.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of coffee for resale and pay  farm laborers

loans.name: Antasyo

texts.en: Antasyo P. is currently in the business of selling clothes  and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell.  Antasyo is 29 years old and is married to a husband who is a tailor. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a concrete house.

loans.use: Stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Zibula Atudde Lungala-Mpigi Group

texts.en: 36-year-old N. Agnes who belongs to Zibula Atudde group-Mpigi is a go-getter by nature. With steadfast and hard-working principle, she has for the last 13 years managed to make ends meet  with her fruit and vegetable sales business in Kibuye market-Mpigi. This mother of four who is also happily married began this business at the urging of her close pal. In a week she makes 120,000 shillings and with this loan she wants to buy more bags of fruit and vegetables that she will resell. She also says she will use some of the loan money to pay school fees for her kids.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of fruit and vegetables for resale and paying school fees

loans.name: Enedina Yolanda

texts.es:
Enedina es socia del Banco Comunal Chacco.
Enedina es viuda, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 1 vive con ella y estudia en el colegio, Enedina viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende verduras y de las compra cereales que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, también compra maíz, tara que luego vende a los intermediarios.
Enedina solicita un préstamo de 900 soles para la compra de tara.
Los sueños de Enedina son tener una casa propia pues ahora vive con sus padres y que su ultima hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
Enedina is a member of the Chacco Communal Bank. She is a widow with three children, one of whom still lives with her and is in high school. Enedina goes to the various regional markets to sell vegetable and to buy cereals that she sells in the Ayacucho wholesale foodstuffs market. She also buys corn and tara (Caesalpinia spinosa, a Peruvian plant rich in tannins) that she then sells to middlemen. Enedina is requesting a 900 sol loan to buy tara. Enedina’s dreams are to have a house of her own because she currently lives with her parents and that her daughter becomes a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tara (Caesalpinia spinosa, a Peruvian plant rich in tannins) and cereals

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor es casada, tiene 7 hijos D. los cuales 2 hijos estudian, Flor viaja a las ferias D. la región en donD. venD. verduras, frutas, además Flor se dedica a la agricultura D. verduras en sus terrenos, también se dedica a la crianza D. animales como gallinas y vacas.
Flor es socia del Banco Comunal Chacco y necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. semilla y abono.
Los sueños D. Flor son que sus hijos salgan adelante y continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Flor is married and has 7 children two of whom are students. Flor travels to the various regional markets to sell vegetables and fruits. In addition, Flor farms vegetables on her fields and raises animals like chickens and cows. Flor is a member of the Chacco Communal Bank and needs a 900 sol loan to buy seed and manure. Flor’s dreams are that her children succeed and to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed and manure.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Chacco.
Carmen es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo de 4 meses, Carmen con la ayuda de su papa se dedica a la agricultura de verduras como apio, coliflor, sus productos los comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de semilla y abono.
Los sueños de Carmen son tener una tienda de abarrotes y casa propia porque ahora vive en casa alquilada.
texts.en:
Carmen, 26, is a member of the Chacco communal bank. She has a live-in partner and a four month old son. With help from her father, Carmen farms vegetables like celery and cauliflower that she sells in her city’s wholesale foodstuffs market. Carmen needs a 900 sol loan to buy seed and manure. Carmen’s dreams are to have a grocery store and her own home because she currently lives in a rented house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed and manure.

loans.name: Dembe Development Group-Mpigi

texts.en: Out of the increasingly lucrative poultry business, 30-year-old M. Pauline who belongs to Dembe development Group-Mpigi, has been making shillings 450,000 monthly. This mother of fire has worked vigorously to get her business into a reliable stride. She began this business with the help of her husband. Before all this she was, like any other village housewife, subsisting on her small income from small-scale farming. With this loan, she wants to buy more feed for her chicken and pigs. She is also looking at completing her kraal.

loans.use: The purchase of more feed for her chicken and pigs and to pay for the completion of her kraal

loans.name: Dionisia Marina

texts.es:
Dionisia es casada, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 3 estudian, Dionisia se dedica a la agricultura de verduras y también compra de los productores de su zona, sus productos los vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. También viaja a las ferias de donde compra cereales que luego comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Dionisia es socia del Banco Comunal Chacco y solicita un préstamo de 900 soles para la compra de semilla.
Los sueños de Dionisia son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Dionisia is married and has six children. Three of them go to school. Dionisia grows vegetables, and she also buys from producers in the area. She sells her agricultural products at Ayacucho’s wholesale foodstuffs market. She also travels to the fairs where she buys grains that she later sells in the city of Ayacucho. Dionisia is a member of the Chacco Communal Bank. She is requesting a loan for 900 soles to buy seeds. Dionisia’s dreams are for her children to become professionals and to have a store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita es casada, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 7 estudian, Juanita se dedica a la agricultura de verduras, productos que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, además viaja a la feria los días sanados en donde vende verduras y de allá compra cereales que luego comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Juanita pertenece al Banco Comunal Chacco y solicita un crédito de 900 soles para la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Juanita son hacer una casa en la ciudad de ayacucho y tener una restaurante.
texts.en:
Juanita is married and has eight children. Seven of them go to school. Juanita grows vegetables, and she sells them at the wholesale foodstuffs market in the city of Ayacucho. Also, on her free days she travels to the fair where vegetables are sold, and she buys grains to later sell at the market in Ayacucho. Juanita belongs to the Chacco Communal Bank. She is requesting a loan for 900 soles to buy grains. Juanita’s dreams are to build a house in the city of Ayacucho and to have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains

loans.name: Marilia

texts.es:
Marilia pertenece al Banco Comunal Chacco.
Marilia es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo de 1 año, Marilia  se dedica a la agricultura de verduras, productos que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, la llegada de su bebe le limito mucho sus actividades.
Marilia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles para la compra de semilla, abono.
Los sueños de Marilia son tener casa propia pues vive en casa de sus suegros.
texts.en:
Marilia belongs to the Chacco Communal Bank. Marilia is in a common-law marriage, and she has a one year old child. Marilia grows vegetables, and she sells them at the wholesale foodstuffs market in the city of Ayacucho. The arrival of her baby greatly limited her activities. Marilia needs a loan for 900 soles to buy seeds and fertilizer Marilia lives in her mother and father in-law’s house, and her dream is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Iragi Group

texts.fr: Kabira K.  est  présidente  groupe Iragi, âgée de 39 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants, son mari est  chauffeur. Son fils ainé a 22 ans et le cadet a 3 ans et tous étudient, sauf le cadet.  Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette petite activité de production de boisson locale Mandrakwa. Elle a commence avec ses fonds propre. Avant d’embrasser cette activité, elle vendait les pommes de terre, la braise, etc. Elle vend ses marchandises à son  domicile. Ce crédit va lui permettre d’augmenter  son chiffre d’affaire en achetant  les 3 sacs des intrants (maïs, sorgho) pour la production Madrakwa. Le grand obstacle est  qu’elle vend en monnaie nationale (franc congolais). Cependant cette monnaie congolaise n’est pas stable, elle subit de plus à plus l’inflation, ce qui entraine de perte de change avec la devise (les dollars), comme tous les congolais craignent le franc congolais, pour garder leurs économies en dollars. En outre, ce travail de production boisson madrakwa est trop fatiguant étant donné qu’elle utilise encore la technologie rudimentaire, ainsi donc, elle souhaiterait changer le secteur d’activité dans le futur. Elle souhaite voir  ses enfants finir les études. Kabira K. a déjà réalisé plus de gain d’impact visible avec  le crédit de Hekima, elle a déjà construit une maison de 2 chambres et salon, qu’elle met à la disposition des locateurs pour accroitre ses revenus. La cliente Kabira K. remercie  Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres citoyens exclus de banque classique.  Il sied de signaler que ce groupe Iragi est composé de 14 membres.
texts.en:
Kabira K., the leader of the Iragi group, is 39 years old and married with seven children. Her husband is a driver. Her oldest son is 22 years old and the youngest is only 3; all, except the youngest, are in school. Since about ten years ago, she has been making a traditional local drink called “Mandrakwa” for sale. She started with her own funds. Before launching into this business, she used to sell potatoes, charcoal etc. She sells out of her home. This loan will allow her to increase her working capital and purchase three bags of ingredients (corn, sorghum). Her big challenge is that her receipts are in local currency, the Congolese Franc. However, this is not a stable currency and the inflation is growing, which results in losses when Congolese Francs are exchanged into hard currency (US dollars). Like all locals, distrusting the Congolese currency, Kabira keeps her savings in US dollars. In addition, the production of “Madrakwa” is very labor-intensive, given that she is still using a very rudimentary technology, and thus she would like to change her type of business in the future. She would like to see her children finish their studies. Thanks to the loans from Hekima, Kabira K. already has made visible progress: her earnings have allowed her to build a house with two bedrooms and a living room; she rents out the house to increase her income. Kabira Kalondera thanks Hekima for assisting impoverished citizens who do not have access to the traditional banking system. It should also be mentioned that the Iraqi group consists of 14 members.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 3 bags of ingredients (corn, sorghum)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna tiene 40 años D. edad y vive junto a sus seis hijos en el municipio D. Corinto en Morazán; ella al igual que todas las personas del área rural se dedica a las actividades agropecuarias criando cerdos, ganado, gallinas y además siembra granos básicos como maíz y maicillo, con la ayuda D. sus hijos mayores quienes se encargar del trabajo más pesado, ellos dependen D. estos ingresos que les genera el trabajo agropecuario.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. cerdos pequeños para aumentar su granja y poder comercializarlos cuando estos ya estén gordos y grandes, esta inversión ayudara a mejorar la comercialización D. Reyna y incrementaran las ganancias para su familia, el único riesgo con el negocio es que sus animales se enfermen o que al momento D. la venta los precios sean muy bajos.
Las aspiraciones D. Reyna son contar con una granja más granD., ayudar a sus seis hijos y que estos se superen para que puedan tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Reyna, 40, lives with her six children in Corinto, Morazán. She, like most of the area residents, is in farming and raises farm animals like pigs, cattle and chickens. She also farms basic grains like corn and sorghum with help from her older children who do the heavier tasks. They depend on the income these labors generate. She is asking for funds to buy small pigs to increase her farm and to sell them when they get big and fat. The investment will help her sales and increase profits for her family. The only risk her business faces is if the animals get sick or if prices drop when it’s time to sell them. Reyna’s hopes for the future is to have a larger farm and to help her six children better themselves so that they can have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials - maize and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: mulch and manure

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: If there is an individual who has taken pride in her teaching profession despite the low remuneration that teachers get, it has to be 46-year-old Bamuloho Grace. She has been a teacher for only three years.  Grace is married with three kids and teaches mostly in Bweyogerere which is a fast-paced suburban area. In a month she says earns about 145,000 shillings and with this loan, she wants to be empowered to comfortably pay up her kids' school fees on time.

loans.use: paying school fees for her kids on time

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy coffee husks for mulching the plantation

loans.name: La Ilucion Group

texts.es:
La Presidenta la Sra.  Gabina D. 48 años D. edad, vive en la comunidad del Torno barrio Miraflores  su negocio es la venta y elaboración D. Helado hace 19 años. Estado civil, casada con el señor Emilio su  actividad profesor en la zona D. villa San Carlos hace 6 años, los señores tienen  3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar,  con el dinero del crédito compraran leche, azúcar por cantidad para la elaboración D. los helados.

Secretaria : Arnilda D. edad 21 años vive en la zona del torno barrio Bolivia, su negocio es la venta D. pescado y Papa en la comunidad D. el Torno  esta actividad la realiza desD. hace 2 años, con el dinero del crédito comprara Papa por cantidad. Estado civil: concubina  con el señor Marco Antonio su  actividad profesor en una unidad educativa hace 2 años, los señores cuentan con 2 hijos que se  encuentran en edad escolar.

Tesorera : Vania  cuenta con el negocio D. venta D. ropa en la comunidad D. el Torno afuera del mercado central D. el Torno y como segunda actividad venta D. refrescos en el mismo lugar D. venta .Estado civil: soltera y vive en el barrio Paraíso, no tiene hijos y el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra D. ropa delgada como sudaderas, cortos, etc.
                                                                                                              Los clientes se sienten muy agradecidos con la entidad financiera por depositarles la confianza a su personas y haberles abierto las puertas cuando ellos mas lo necesitaban.
texts.en:
President Gabina is 48 years old and lives in the community of El Torno, Miraflores barrio. Her business for 19 years had been making and selling ice cream. She is married to Emilio and for 6 years her occupation has been teacher in the zone of Villa San Carlos. The couple has 3 children of school age. With the loan they will buy milk and sugar in bulk for making ice cream. Secretary Arnilda is 21 years old and lives in El Torno, Bolivia barrio. Her business is selling fish and potatoes in El Torno community. She has been doing this for 2 years. With the loan she will buy potatoes in bulk. She is living with Marco Antonio. Her profession is teacher, for 2 years, in an educational unit. They have 2 children of school age. Treasurer Vania has a clothing business in El Torno, outsiD. the central market of El Torno. As a 2nd activity, she sells soft drinks in the same stall. She is single and lives in Paraiso barrio. Vania has no children and her loan will be used to buy casual clothes, such as sweat shirts, shorts, etc. The clients are very grateful to the financing organization for granting confidence in them personally and for having opened the doors when they most needed it.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE FOR THEIR STORES

loans.name: Kakajjo Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: Her 10-year-old boutique or clothing business began with a combination of variables: her savings from her fried food sales and then persuasion from her mum. This is the story of a certain 33-year-old enterprising businesswoman who goes by the name of Ziwa Roy N.. Roy describes herself as friendly and hard working and in a sense, that is what has been working in her favor. In her boutique, she sells a variety of designer clothes and pairs of shoes. In a week, she makes profits that are equal to 100,000 shillings. With this loan that she is requesting, she wants to buy more clothes and pairs of shoes to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to resell

loans.name: Rwakirungura People's Assn, Rukungiri Group

texts.en: Hard-working M. Oliver of Rwakirungura People's Assn, Rukungiri, 50 years old, has been operating a livestock business that deals in goat rearing from Nyabicence, Rukungiri after being encouraged by other dealers in the same business. The married mother of five children engages in the purchase of goats that she grazes and sells later for a higher price and she does this along with her business selling bananas and ghee. This has seen her earn 300,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis that has helped her with the family responsibilities like paying for her children’s fees. She is into restocking more livestock on the farm and needs this loan to help her achieve her motive since it will increase her sales revenue in the near future and improve the family income.

loans.use: To purchase more goats

loans.name: New Africa Group

texts.en:
Salmin M. is in his late fifties and is married with six children. He runs a food stall where he sells basic groceries as well as tea. Salmin has been operating this stall between 6 am and 9 pm for 17 years. The stall earns him a good monthly profit.

This will be Salmin's 6th loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. His previous loans were used to repair his stall and to increase his stock, loans which he has successfully repaid. Salmin aims to use this loan to increase his stock in rice and in powdered milk, which he sells with his tea.

Salmin will share this loan with his loan group, New Africa, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

In the picture, Salmin can be seen in the last row, wearing a white cap.

loans.use: Increase stock of rice and powdered milk

loans.name: Ilsy Estela

texts.es:
Para Ilsy T., la venta de alimentos pasteles y fritos es su trabajo y lo realiza con alegría desde hace ya diez años  porque le trae muchas satisfacciones. Ella inició vendiendo fritos diariamente cuando en una época su esposo quedó sin trabajo y debió resolver las necesidades de sostenimiento de su hogar.

Ilsy  ha visto crecer poco a poco su microempresa, ella gradualmente ha ido agregándole otras comidas como pasteles y hoy quiere incursionar en la venta de comidas rápidas, como perros calientes, sánduches, chuzos y arepas asadas, por lo cual solicita su credikiva, que es su sexto crédito, para comprar un carro de perros y materias primas para su nuevos productos como embutidos, salsas, harina y hasta refrescos. 

Ilsy distribuye bien su tiempo para el desarrollo de cada actividad, así  todos los días, se dedica a la fritangueria de arepas, empanadas caribañolas como una opción de desayuno, los pasteles los elabora los fines de semanas para que las familias descansen y no cocinen y muy pronto diversificará su oferta,   adicionándole  comidas rápidas, que tienen su mayor repunte de ventas   en las noches de los fines de semanas desde los viernes a domingos y los días feriados. Desde que Ilsy T.  inició como cliente de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, ha mejorado sus ingresos, su negocio ha crecido lo que le ha permitido que sus hijos de 7 y 12 años  estudien con un mejor nivel de calidad. Por eso sus sueños están enfocados en el crecimiento aun mas de él,   especialmente tener un local con las condiciones de infraestructura que amerita para el desarrollo de su actividad productiva de alimentos, porque respecto a su ubicación es muy propicia, pues vive en el barrio las Nieves, comunidad que tradicionalmente  conserva el perfil de alegría de la gente Barranquillera y esto hace que su clientela se potencialice mediante fiestas y eventos recreativos que fortalecen su negocio.
texts.en:
For Ilsy T. the sale of food, cakes and fried dishes is her work and she has been happily doing it for 10 years because it gives her a lot of satisfaction. She started selling fried foods during a period when her husband lost his job and she needed to cover the household expenses. Ilsy has seen her micro-business grow little by little. She has gradually added other food items such as cakes and now she wants to include fast food items such as hot dogs, sandwiches, chuzos (meat on a stick), grilled arepas (a type of flatbread). The reason for her kiva loan request, her sixth loan, is the desire to purchase a hot dog cart and supplies for her new products such as sausages, sauces, flour and also soft drinks. Ilsy allocates her time well to each activity. Every day she fries the arepas, empanadas and caribañolas (yucca stuffed with meat) which are her breakfast options. She makes the cakes on the weekends allowing the families to rest and not cook and soon she will diversify her offerings by adding fast foods which have a higher sales level on the weekend evenings from Friday to Sunday and on holidays. Since Ilsy T. started as a client of the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, she has improved her income, her business has grown which has allowed her to improve the quality of education of her two children, 7 and 12 years of age. Her goals are focused on further growing her business, especially having a space with a structure that befits her activity of making food. She is very fortunate in terms of her location as she lives in the Las Nieves neighborhood, a community that maintains the happy profile of the people of Barranquillera which attracts customers during festivities and recreational events and strengthens her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hot dog cart and raw materials for her new products such as sausages,sauces, flour and refreshments.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 52 años, vive en su casa que es propia a lado de su esposo Artemio de 59 años y de sus 3 hijos, de los cuales los 2 son mayores y trabajan de manera independiente, mientras ella se hace cargo de la menor de sus hijos. Cuando esta emprendedora mujer elabora sus postres, como tortas y kekes, sus vecinos la buscan para degustar las delicias que prepara, además que los ofrece a precios muy cómodos. Por tal motivo se esmera en trabajar durante 3 veces a la semana, siendo muy organizada al momento de seleccionar los ingredientes que dispondrá para los dulces y postres. De esta manera ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio, además se siente muy contenta de trabajar con su hija mayor y juntas tienen muchos planes para el futuro, como el de instalar una panadería en una parte de su inmueble. Nos cuenta que ella aprendió la repostería desde  muy joven y con el tiempo se ha vuelto toda una experta, ahora sus ganancias le permiten ayudar a su esposo en las labores del hogar. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente pues no quiere decepcionar a las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor que necesita para continuar preparando su  postres y tortas, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María, who is 52 years old, lives with her husband Artemio (age 59) and 3 children, in their own house. Two of their children are grown up, and working for themselves, while the youngest is still in her care. When this enterprising woman makes her desserts, such as cakes and gateaus, her neighbours come looking for her to enjoy the delicacies she prepares - and which she sells at such reasonable prices. Knowing this, she takes great care in her work 3 times a week, and is highly organised from the moment she weighs out the ingredients for her sweets and desserts. In this way she has succeeded in growing her business. She is also very pleased to be working with her eldest daughter, and together they have great plans for the future, such as turning part of their home into a bakery. María learned to bake at a very young age, and over time has become an expert cake-maker, so that her earnings now enable her to help her husband with household expenses. This is María's second loan from [field partner] MFP. She promises to make her repayments on time so as not to disappoint those who provide the funds to make it possible for her to continue working and progressing. María has plans to invest the loan in ingredients she needs to continue making her cakes and desserts, and in this way she hopes to increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk, to make it easier to prepare her desserts.

loans.name: Liverpool Group

texts.en:
Habiba S. is in her early thirties and is married with five children. She owns a food stall which she has been operating for one year. The stall is open from 5 am to 10 pm daily, and earns Habiba a good monthly profit.

This will be Habiba's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She aims to use this loan on improving the condition of her food stall, as well as decorating it. Habiba's dream is to increase her profit so that she can improve and expand her house.

Habiba will share the loan with her loan group, Liverpool, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other responsible for paying back the loans.

In the picture, Habiba is seen in the front row, 1st on the left, wearing light blue.

loans.use: The improvement of her stall

loans.name: Glory Group

texts.en:
Hadija S. is in her early thirties and is married with three children. She has been operating her own clothing business for 7 years now. Her shop is open from 7 am to 7:30 pm every day, and she makes a good monthly profit.
 
This will be Hadija's 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Her previous loans were primarily used for travelling to trade exhibitions in neighbouring countries, exchanging products to and from Kampala.  She has paid back the loans successfully. She hopes for another loan to increase her capital and develop her building in the Kigamboni area.

She will share this loan with her loan group 'Glory', which totals 15 members.  The members of the group hold each other responsible in paying back the loan.

In the picture Hadija is in front in an orange dress.

loans.use: to develop her building and as working capital

loans.name: Stephen Manyenze

texts.en:
Stephen Manyenze M. is thirty years old, single, and does not have any children yet. His business is located at Bar-Sheba, Bamburi estate, in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. He owns a general store in which he sells such items as milk, detergent, sugar, flour and others. He has been in this business for two years now. 

He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are so many other people in the area doing the same kind of business as his, therefore customers are not loyal as they are spoilt of choice. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more general items to expand his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to be a wholesaler in future. He also hopes to really grow his business so that when he gets married, he will be able to support his family. He describes himself as polite.

loans.use: Maize flour, milk, detergent, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Milca

texts.es: La Señora  Milca vive en casa de sus padres es soltera no tiene ni un hijo como todos los microempresarios ella comenzó a trabajar con caramelos de una marca muy conocida, como promotora, conoció al dueño y tiene buena amistad con el,  la señora saca dulces al por mayor de  menor precio y ella lo vende un poco mas caro, tiene bastantes proveedores especialmente de tiendas de barrio ya que fue conocida cuando era promotora de el trabajo que tenia ahora saco el crédito para poder comprar mas caramelos ya que tiene bastantes pedidos y tiene mucha clientela es mas conocida en el mercado del lugar donde ella vive, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Milca lives with her parents, is single with no children. As many other micro-business owners, she started working with a well know brand of candies as a promoter. She got to know the owner and has a good relationship with him. She gets the candy at wholesale prices and sells it at higher retail prices. She has many dealers in neighborhood stores that know her from the times that she was a promoter. She is requesting the loan to purchase more candy since she has many orders and many customers. She is well know in the area where she lives. She is very grateful to the institution for their support in granting her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools to do his work, and bricks

loans.name: Eudomilia

texts.es: Eudomilia tiene 48 años, su actividad es una abarrotería. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy satisfactorio para ella por lo que se relaciona con diferentes clientes, ella es una persona muy tranquila. Cuando inicio este negocio fue porque no había tanta demanda de este tipo de negocios, así ella no tendría mucha competencia, ella ofrece una gran variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos básicos y detergentes. Sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su vivienda y establecer su pulpería en su casa. Solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Eudomilia, 48, has had a grocery store for over 5 years. It has been very satisfactory for her because it allows her to relate to a variety of customers. She is a very calm person. She started the business because back then there wasn’t much demand for it so she didn’t have much competition. She offers a wide variety of products like sweets, beverages, bread, basic grains and detergents. She dreams with buying a lot to build a house and set up her grocery store in her home. She is asking for this loan to buy raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana es cliente antigua D. emprender desD. el año 2002,ella trabajo con el grupo solidario wilacota en 9 secuencias ,posteriormente se individualizó siendo esta su 6ta secuencia la Sra. tiene un negocio D. venta D. verduras  por mayor  y menor, ella es productora, tiene tierras D. cultivo  en su pueblo  Cohoni por el lado D. Palca y con los créditos  que solicito en emprender logro construir su casa, también  se debe señalar que  la Sra.  Mantiene  a su  nieta la misma que quedo huérfana  a la  cual hace estudiar, su esposo es jardinero en una casa D. Achumani, la Sra. Necesita el crédito para comprar verduras por cantidad y así poder  incrementar su capital, razón por la cual  solicita este financiamiento kiva.
texts.en:
Juana is a former Emprender client. Since 2002, she worked with the Grupo Solidario Wilacota through 9 loan cycles. Later, she became independent and this is now her 6th loan cycle. Juana sells vegetables, both wholesale and retail. She is a producer and she has her own farming lands in her town, Cohoni, located in the municipality of Palca. With the loans requested at Emprender, she was able to build her house. It should also be noted that Juana is responsible for her granddaughter who became an orphan. Her granddaughter currently studies. Her husband is a gardener at a house in Achumani. Juana needs this loan to purchase vegetables by quantity so that she can increase her capital, which is why she is requesting this funding through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Bismarck Antonio

texts.es: Bismarck Antonio tiene 35 años, es un joven con todo el espíritu de salir adelante pues no ha sido fácil ya que no tenía muchas herramientas necesarias para la elaboración de sus piezas. El se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de carpintería. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, cuando inicio fue porque su Papa le enseño este oficio y quería que su hijo lo aprendiera para que lo utilizara como medio de vida para mantener a su familia, con mucho sacrificio Bismarck se hizo cargo del negocio. Actualmente solicita este crédito para la compra de madera, martillos, pega, clavos, barniz entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Bismarck Antonio is 35 years old. He is young with all the desire to get ahead. He works in carpentry and it has not been easy since he did not have many of the necessary tools to make his pieces. He has been in the business for 10 years and he started because his father taught him the trade and wanted him to learn it so that he could use it as a means of supporting his family. Bismarck became responsible for the business with much sacrifice. He is currently requesting this loan for the purchase of wood, hammers, glue, nails, and varnish, among other items.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: La señora Viviana  de 24 años de edad casada hace 9 años, tiene  dos  hijos de siete  y seis años  que se encuentran en edad escolar, viven el Barrio Toborochi zona parque Industrial, la Sra. Viviana Viviana se dedica hace  cinco años a la elaboración de pan, la Sra. Viviana  cuenta con un ingreso  como  profesora interina,  es clienta antigua  de Emprender ya que  por su buena conducta de pago se accedió a otorgarle el  crédito kiva. El crédito que se le aprobó al cliente es para la compra de mercadería (compra de harina, levadura, huevos ,manteca ,aceite queso, latas para hornear garrafas u otros) nos manifestó que esta muy agradecida con nuestra institución por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito
texts.en:
Viviana is 24 years old and has been married for 9 years. She has two school-aged children who are 7 and 6 years old. They live in the Toborochi neighborhood of the Parque Industrial zone. Viviana has been making bread for a living for the past 5 years. She also has income as an interim teacher. She is a former Emprender client and through her good loan repayment, they are able to provide her with a loan from Kiva. The loan approved for Viviana is for the purchase of merchandise (flour, yeast, eggs, butter, oil, cheese, tins for the over, gas cylinders, and others). She expressed to us that she is very appreciative of our institution for the confidence provided in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies at wholesale price

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin O. O. is a single young man. He does not have any children yet but he is determined to make money so that when he gets a family, he will be able to take care of them. He runs a business known by the name 'Designers and Dressmaking'. He makes clothes which include trouser suits, ladies' dresses and skirts. 

His business is located at the busy Haile Selaisie street in Mombasa, Kenya. He has been in this business for the last two years and he says that the business is very profitable and the only major challenge is lack of enough funds on his side and delayed payments by customers. 

He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more materials to make more clothes as per the customers' demand. He sees himself owning a chain of tailoring shops in future. He describes himself as honest, committed to his work, and trustworthy.

loans.use: Materials to make clothing

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Juan Alberto L. F., tiene 55 años es casado y con la felicidad de tener  4 hijos en las edades de 26 a 32 años, dos de ellos gemelos. Es un hombre que desde hace 20 años aprendió el ofcio de confeccionar ropa para caballeros, como pantalones de hombres, camisas y blusas, en un taller familiar y gradualmente se ha ido dedicando a ello de manera independiente de la mano de sus hermana que ha sido un muy buen apoyo.

En la actualidad Juan Alberto es muy reconocido en el sector de la Playa, donde vive con su cónyuge y tiene un buen número de clientes y contratos por su excelente calidad en las prendas que fabrica. Como Juan Alberto es un hombre de muchas idas desde hace un año adquirió 3 lavadoras producto de las utilidades generadas por su confección, pues observó una nueva oportunidad de ingreso para su familia si respondía a  la necesidad de facilitarle el trabajo doméstico de las amas de casa, mediante el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras. Con este nuevo negocio le ha ido muy bien porque el sector es de poca competencia. En la actualidad requiere su credikiva, tercer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo pues ya vienen las fiestas de fin de año y debe preparase para elaborar la mas elegante ropa para las familias clientes, comprando telas e insumos de confección y también va a comprar 3 lavadoras mas para aumentar la efectividad de su otra idea de negocio.

Juan Alberto ha manifestado cambios en su negocio desde que se vinculó como cliente de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace algo mas de   2 años, ha logrado por ejemplo aumentar sus utilidades y con ellas comprar una motocicleta que le genera otro ingreso pues ofrece el servicio de transporte, crear otro negocio como el de alquiler de lavadoras y también ha podido comprar en un mayor volumen las materias primas e insumos que no hubiera podido lograr él solo. Su sueño ahora se centra en tener una boutique donde su propia ropa se encuentre en exhibición.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto L. F., 55, is married and joyful to have four children between the ages of 26 and 32 years, two of them twins. He is a man who 20 years ago learned how to make men’s clothing like pants, shirts and blouses, in a family workshop. Gradually he has moved into working independently with help from his sister who has been a very good collaborator. Currently he is very well known in his area, La Playa, where he lives with his wife. He has a good number of customers and contracts thanks to the excellent quality of the clothing items he manufactures. Because Juan Alberto is a man with many ideas a year ago he acquired three washing machines with profits from his sewing because he recognized a new way to earn income for his family by providing a service that would make housewives’ work easier: washing machine rentals. He has done quite well with this new business because he has little competition in this area. He needs a Kiva loan, his third loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, because the end of year festivities are approaching and he must be prepared to make the more elegant items his customer families will require. He needs to buy fabric and sewing supplies as well as to buy three more washing machines for his other business. Juan Alberto has noticed changes in his business since becoming affiliated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo a little more than two years ago. For example, his profits have increased and with them he was able to buy a motorcycle that generates still more income because he offers transportation services. He created another business: the washing machine rental services and he has also been able to buy larger amounts of raw materials and supplies he would not have been able to do on his own. His dream now is to have a boutique where his own clothing creations may be displayed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For fabric and sewing supplies.  He will also buy three washing machines to increase efficiency in his other business.

loans.name: Fioklou Alex

texts.fr: en 2000, ce monsieur a ouvert son propre bar qu'il a appelé " BAR ASTORIA", son bar se situe à proximité de sa maison. les weekend, le bar est très animé ce qui lui permet de réaliser de bons chiffre d'affaire. il doit s'approvisionner pour satisfaire ses clients, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 24 bouteilles de flag, 17 bouteilles de guiness, 24 bouteilles de castel, 20 bouteilles de sucrerie.
texts.en:
In 2000, this gentleman opened his own bar that he called "BAR ASTORIA". It is located near his house. On weekends, the bar is very busy, and this enables him to have good sales. He must stock up again on supplies in order to satisfy his customers. He is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying 24 bottles of Flag, 17 bottles of Guinness, 24 bottles of Castel, and 20 bottles of soft-drinks.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beverages

loans.name: Loretta

texts.es: Loretta, de 37 años, vive en la casa de su abuela, en compañía de ella y de su pequeño hijo, que estudia en el colegio, juntos y con muchas ganas de salir adelante habitan en un barrio populoso ubicado al norte de la ciudad. Cada día empieza desde muy temprano para esta empeñosa mujer, pues se despierta en la madrugada para dejar todos los desayunos que ofrece listos para servir a sus asiduos compradores. Desde entonces a partir de las 5 de la mañana se dirige a su puesto de venta, ubicado en un paradero, cerca de la carretera norte de la ciudad, en ése lugar la esperan los transportistas ansiosos de empezar su jornada laborar pero con el estómago lleno. Su labor culmina  a las 10 de la mañana, cuando ya no tiene alimento que ofrecer, además esta muy satisfecha,  pues de las ventas que tiene recibe ganancias considerables que le permiten ofrecer a su familia una buena calidad de vida; y aunque a veces se siente cansada sabe que la recompensa a su sacrificada labor es ofrecerle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora, para el futuro ya tiene planeado instalar un puesto de venta de comida en algún lugar comercial más estable. Es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues quiere continuar sacando más créditos ya que tiene muchos planes por concretar. Loretta tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de gaseosas para surtir su negocio y también en ingredientes que necesita para continuar preparando sus desayunos, por lo que espera mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Loretta, age 37, lives in her grandmother's house with her grandmother and her little child who is in school. They have a great desire to get ahead and live together in a densely populated neighbourhood in the north of the city. Every day starts very early for this hard-working woman. She gets up at dawn to get all of the breakfasts ready to serve to her devoted customers. After 5 am she goes to her stall, located at a bus stop near the highway north of the city. This is where the transportation workers go, anxious to start their work days with full stomachs. Her work ends at 10 am, when she has no more food to offer. She is very satisfied; from her sales, she makes a considerable income that allows her to offer her family a good quality of life. Even though she feels tired at times, she knows that the reward of her sacrifice is being able to offer the best to her little child. Since she is an enterprising woman, she plans to open a food sales store in a more stable commercial area in the future. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she promises to pay her quotas punctually. She wants to continue taking out more loans since she has many plans to see through. Loretta plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of some pop to stock her business, and ingredients that she needs in order to continue preparing her breakfasts. She hopes to improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of pop and ingredients to continue offering breakfasts.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 35 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de sus padres, hermanos y sus 2 hijos menores, que estudian en el colegio. Desde hace 6 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica en la venta de comida, gaseosa y dulces, cerca de un paradero de la carretera norte de la ciudad. Con los primeros rayos de luz empieza su labor, pues a las 9 de la mañana la esperan  sus clientes ansiosos por disfrutar de sus platillos, que no solo son muy buscados por su buen sabor, si no también por los precios cómodos que ofrece. Dice que la labor le gusta mucho, además cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana y su hijo mayor, para que puedan atender sin problemas a sus clientes. Luego, al mediodía se le acaban sus platillos, y solo se dedica a cobrar porque algunos clientes le pagan semanalmente o diario, dependiendo del trato. Como es una mujer emprendedora, en adelante tiene planeado instalar un restaurante en algún mercado de su zona pues anhela trabajar de manera estable. Es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Luz tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de gaseosa para surtir mejor su negocio, además comprará ingredientes al por mayor que necesita para continuar cocinando y así espera ofrecerles mejor variedad de platillos a sus comensales.
texts.en:
Luz, age 35, lives in her own home with to her parents, brothers and 2 young children who are in school. For 6 years, this enterprising woman has sold food, pop and candy near a bus stop on the highway north of her city. She starts work with the first rays of morning light, and at 9 in the morning she waits for her customers who are anxious to enjoy her dishes. Her food is not only highly sought after for its good flavour, but also for the good prices that she offers. She says that she likes this work a lot, and she counts on the support of her sister and her oldest child so that they can tend to the customers without problems. Later, at noon, she runs out of her dishes, and she works on collecting her money because some of her customers pay her weekly or daily, depending on their deal. Since she is an enterprising woman, in the future she plans to open a restaurant in a market in her area. She wants to have a stable job. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she promises to pay her quotas punctually since she does not want to look bad in front of the people who are making this loan possible. This loan will allow her to keep working in search of improvement. Luz plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of pop to better stock her business. She will also purchase ingredients wholesale that she needs to continue cooking. This way, she hopes to offer a better variety of dishes to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase ingredients wholesale to continue preparing her food.

loans.name: Yawoa

texts.fr: S. est une dame  de 34 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de bè klouvé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu  le commerce de céréales. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des céréales. elle  a commencé ce commerce depuis 2005.
texts.en:
Mrs. S. is a 34-year-old married woman. The mother of three children, she lives with her family in the Bè Klouvé neighborhood. She makes money selling cereals, and her customer base includes everyone. She is seeking a loan from WAGES to buy cereals. She has been in this business since 2005.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Rosario Del Socorro

texts.es: Rosario Del Socorro tiene 58 años, su actividad es ofrecer el servicio de costura y golosinas. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, sus inicios fueron muy difíciles porque no tenía capital suficiente y fue por medio de su Mama que ella aprendió este medio de vida. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de botones, tela, hilo, tijeras entre otras cosas. Siempre trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano porque tiene pedidos que entregar.
texts.en:
Rosario del Socorro, 58, is a seamstress and she sells sweets. She has been in this business for over 6 years. At first it was very difficult because she lacked sufficient capital. Her mother taught her this way of life. She is asking for funds to buy buttons, fabric, thread and scissors among other things. She works very day from very early in the morning because she has orders to fill.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy buttons, fabric, thread and scissors among other things.

loans.name: Concepción Valerio

texts.es:
Concepción Valerio B. F. vive en el municipio de Malambo y se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas desde hace mas de veinte años, cuando adquirió su experiencia en un restaurante en el que trabajó durante 5 años y cuando se retiró, con su liquidación emprendió su sueño de ser independiente en un sitio estratégico de Barranquilla. Concepción tiene 25 financiamientos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con esta organización inició en la modalidad de grupos solidarios y después de su crédito número 22 se independizó. En la actualidad requiere su credikiva para comprar materias primas e insumos para sus comidas corrientes especialmente salsas y para adicionar mas sillas y herramientas porque tiene muchos mas clientes.

Desde que está vinculado a la Fundación ha tenido un buen comportamiento de crédito, su desafió mayor lo vivió con la construcción del transmetro, momento en el cual las ventas disminuyeron pero con la terminación de la obra logró recuperarse y aprovechó para experimentar en otro punto de ventas que en la actualidad como le ha dado buenos resultados se agrega a su crecimiento y quiere seguir fortaleciéndolo.

Porque este es su sueño para mejorar su vivienda, estar más cómodo con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 23 a 30 años, por eso se dispone a seguir persistiendo en el trabajo y continuar buscando bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Concepción Valerio B. F. lives in Malambo and has sold prepared meals for over twenty years. He worked in a restaurant for five years and this is where he got the experience. When he retired he used his severance pay to follow his dream of being independent in some strategic location in Barranquilla. Concepción has had 25 loans with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He started out with the organization participating in group loans but after his 22nd loan he became independent. He needs a Kiva loan to buy raw materials and ingredients for his meal preparations, especially sauces. He also wants to add more chairs and work tools because he has many more customers. Since becoming associated with the Foundation he has had a very good credit history. His greatest challenge happened when the Metro Bus System was being built because sales dropped. Once construction was completed, though, he recovered and experimented with opening a second sales point which to date has had good results so he’d like to keep it and strengthen it. His dream is to continue improving his home so that he, his wife and three children, who are between the ages of 23 and 30, can be more comfortable. Therefore, he proposes to continue to persevere in his work and to continue to seek his family’s welfare.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials and ingredients for his daily meals especially sauces and to add more chairs and work tools because he has many more customers.

loans.name: Affi Akofa

texts.fr: Affi Akoda T. est une femme mariée, elle est très dynamique, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce  des articles de mercerie. elle a commencé ce commerce en 2008, elle fait son commerce dans sa propre boutique et s'approvisionne à lomé; en ce début de rentrée scolaire où elle réalise de grosses recettes. elle voudrait s'approvisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour pouvoir acheter divers articles. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes.
texts.en:
Ms Affi Akofa T. is a dynamic, married woman who has been selling fabric, yarn, needles, etc, since 2008. She stocks up on products in Lomé and sells them from her own boutique to a variety of customers. She is asking for a loan from WAGES in order to increase her stock of products, especially for the back to school period which generally garners much interest from customers.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing clothing supplies

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Lucila S. Ortiz vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 26 años, es casada con 2 hijos menores.
La señora Lucila S. montó una despensa  la cual tiene una antigüedad de 6 años; ubicada en el barrio San Vicente de la misma ciudad;  cuenta con casa propia.
Su cónyuge se dedica a la reparación de embarcación, y apoya con sus ingresos a la canasta familiar.
El crédito otorgado será de gran ayuda para acrecentar su despensa teniendo en cuenta la demanda existente en los meses venideros. El crédito destinrá a la compra de productos empaquetados, enlatados, verduras, carnes, aceites y articulos de limpieza, bazar, bebidas, etc. al por mayor 
Agradece a Fundación Paraguaya por el préstamo otorgado y afirma tener muchos emprendimientos para más adelante y seguir trabajando con nosotros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucila S. Ortiz, 26, lives in the city of Carapeguá. She’s married and has two minor children. She set up grocery store six years ago in Carapeguá’s San Vicente neighborhood. She owns her house. Her spouse is a boat repairman and his earnings help meet household expenses. The loan will be of great use to increase stock keeping in mind the increased demand that will occur in the coming months. The loan will be used to buy packaged items, canned goods, vegetables, meats, cooking oil, cleaning supplies, kitchenware, beverages, etc. at wholesale. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the loan granted and states that she has several enterprises planned for the future and intends to continue collaborating with us.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy packaged products, canned goods, vegetables, meats, cooking oil, cleaning supplies, kitchenware, beverages, etc. at wholesale.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
El Sr. Luciano es de la ciudad de Roque González, actualmente por motivos de trabajos está viviendo en la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad.
Hace varios años que trabaja como albañil, comenta que es un oficio que adquirió de su familia, ya que su padre y sus hermanos también tienen ese trabajo, luego poco a poco Luciano fue independizándose y hoy en día trabaja por cuenta propia y gracias a su esfuerzo, él es un profesional independiente.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas que el mismo usa en su trabajo como: mezcladora,valdes, cucharas para albañilerias y otros.
Agradece a  Fundación Paraguaya por brindarle la oportunidad de adquirir un préstamo y así ir completando sus herramientas de trabajo.
texts.en:
Sr. Luciano is from the town of Roque González, but he currently lives in Carapeguá because of work. He has a 3-year old son. He has worked as a bricklayer for several years, a job that his father and brothers also have. Gradually Luciano became more independent and nowadays, through hard work, he has his own business. He is seeking a loan to buy tools to use in his work such as a cement mixer, buckets, special bricklayers’ trowels etc. Luciano is grateful to Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya for providing him with this opportunity to obtain a loan so he can obtain all the tools he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane A, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bricklayers' tools

loans.name: Everth Omar

texts.es: Everth Omar tiene 41 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería y servicios de fotos. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que se levanta temprano todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche pues la mayoría de clientes son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, por lo que se encarga de ofrecer un excelente servicio. El sueña con obtener más ganancias para mantener a su negocio que es muy importante. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de  golosinas, refrescos, galletas, pan, detergentes y granos básicos.
texts.en:
41-year old Everth Omar earns his living running a grocery and photography store. He’s had the business for more than ten years. Every morning he gets up early and works from 7 am to 9 pm. As the majority of his customers are neighbours, friends, and relatives, he wants to provide them with excellent service. Everth’s dream is to make more money so he can continue in his business which is very important to him. The loan he is seeking will be used to buy candies, soft drinks, cookies, bread, detergent, and beans etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jane A, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Komlan Bony

texts.fr: komlan bony M. est un homme marié et père de famille, il a ouvert une boutique dans laquelle il fait comme activité la vente de fournitures scolaires. en ce début de rentrée scolaires, il souhaiterai maximiser son profit raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour s'approvisionner en divers articles scolaires à savoir des règles, cahiers, stylos, crayon, livres, ensemble géométrique etc...
texts.en:
Mr Komlan Bony M. is a married man and a father who owns a store to sell various school supplies. At this busy back-to-school time, he is asking for a loan from WAGES in order to increase his stocks of various school materials such as rulers, notebooks, pens, pencils, books, geometry tools, etc, and maximize his profits.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing school supplies

loans.name: Camilo Jose

texts.es: Camilo José de 26 años, vende plata tiene 1 hijo menor de 7 años que está a su cargo. Comenzó a vender porque su esposa se hacía cargo del negocio luego ella consiguió un trabajo y juntos deciden que Camilo se haga cargo del negocio invirtiendo sus ahorros. El es un hombre muy trabajador y que disfruta de su trabajo, por la buena clientela continua con su negocio hasta ahora trabaja. Para mejorar sus ventas él quiere con el financiamiento comprar pulseras, cadenas, aretes, anillos entre otras cosas. En el futuro quiere que su negocio crezca y que su hijo termine los estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
26-year old Camilo José sells silver jewelry. He provides for his young son aged seven. Originally his wife was in charge of the business, but when she found other work, they decided that Camilo would take over and invest his savings. He is a very hardworking man who enjoys his work because of the good customers that he has. In order to improve sales, he wishes to use the loan to buy bracelets, chains, ear-rings, rings etc. He would like to see his business expand in the future, and he hopes that his son will complete his education successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Jane A, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sebastiana; ella tiene 40  años de edad y es casada  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos y verduras, ella tiene una pequeño terreno donde cultiva papa, maíz y verduras y los vende en la ciudad de Cusco en los diferentes mercados, su esposo también se dedica a cultivar productos y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener un puesto donde pueda vende los productos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar abonos, fertilizantes y semilla para su terreno de cultivo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata" community bank; the bank is located in the Yuncaypata community, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco. This member is Sebastiana; she is 40, married and has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her vegetable and dry goods sales business. She has a small plot of land where she grows potato, corn and vegetables. She sells them in Cusco city in the different markets. Her husband also cultivates products and together they are getting their children ahead. She wants to have a store to sell her products. She is requesting this loan to purchase manure, fertilizer and seeds for her field. She thanks those who are part of this dream through this means, and she promises to repay her quotas on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She is requesting this loan to purchase manure, fertilizer and seeds for her field.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, de 36 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Para ella el trabajo es importante y en lo posible fomenta a su madre y hermanas. Es así que todos los días, desde muy temprano trabaja confeccionando mandiles o delantales de uso para  la cocina o diversos trabajos del hogar. Esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre cuando era un niño, desde entonces su casa se ha convertido en su taller y su centro de trabajo. A la semana produce de 200 a 300 mandiles y los distribuye al mercado más grande de su distrito, donde tiene muchos clientes que reconocen su trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de la confección de mandiles; es que no es muy trabajoso, ni requiere realizar muchos trazos, pero si es muy rentable. Es por ello que en adelante piensa asegurar las puertas y ventanas de su casa; con rejas, para asegurar sus  maquinas de coser. Este es su onceavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, considerando éste crédito muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de otra maquina de coser, para remallar telas más delgadas, de ese modo espera que su hermana se especialice en esta actividad.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 36, is a very hard-working man. He lives in his parents' home and he most desires to improve his quality of life. Thus, work is important and where possible he supports his mother and sisters. So, every day, he starts working very early in the morning making leather aprons or pinafores for kitchen use or various household uses. He learned this work from his father when he was a child, and since then his home has become his studio and his workplace. In one week he produces 200 to 300 aprons and sells them in the largest marked in the district, where he has many customers who recognize his work. He most enjoys making the aprons; since it is not very arduous work, nor does it require much designing, but it is very profitable. Thus, in the future he wants to secure the doors and windows of his house; with bars, to secure his sewing machines. This is his eleventh loan with MFP, and he promises to pay all of the quotas punctually, since this loan will be very useful in the progress of his business. With this loan, he will invest in the purchase of another sewing machine, in order to work with thinner materials. He hopes that his sister will be able to specialize in this activity.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine, to make thinner stitches

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: kayi H. est une dame de 62 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 5 enfants, l'activité qu'elle exerce pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille est le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois. elle a commencé ce commerce en 2001. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays ce qui lui permet de bénéficier d'une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ces ventes. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle a constaté une baisse de son stock de marchandises. elle souhaiterai par conséquent  se réapprovisionner et sollicite donc de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat d'une vingtaine de sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
Ms Kayi H. is a 62 year old woman, a widow, and a mother of 5 children. She has been selling bags of charcoal to a variety of customers since 2001 in order to provide for her family's needs.
