She stocks up in the middle of the country, which allows her to re-sell the charcoal with a larger profit margin. She is asking for a loan from WAGES in order to purchase 20 more bags of charcoal.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Yuri Antonio

texts.es: Yuri Antonio tiene 28 años, hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio que es brindar el servicio de tricitaxi. Pues él es un padre responsable tiene 1 hijo menor de 5 años a su cargo, anteriormente el alquilaba un triciclo pues con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio fue así que con los financiamientos ha logrado obtener uno propio para ponerlo a la disposición de los diferentes clientes que en su mayoría son vecinos entre otros. Este financiamiento es para la compra de llantas, asientos, pedales, forros de asientos, cadena entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Yuri Antonio, 28, has provided Tricitaxi (pedicab) services for over five years because he is a responsible father; he has a five year old son in his care. He used to lease the pedicab but after much effort and sacrifice with help from the loans he was able to acquire his own to put at his customers disposal. Most of them are his neighbors, among others. The financing is to buy tires, seats, pedals, seat covers and a chain, among other things. He dreams with improving his family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires, seats, pedals, seat covers and a chain, among other things.

loans.name: Anani

texts.fr: M. anani est un jeune homme de 39 ans, il est célibataire, il exerce comme activité la vente de produits alimentaires, il fait ce commerce depuis 2002 et s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour l'achat de 5 cartons de canettes, 10 cartons de spaghetti, 6 cartons de lait et divers.
texts.en:
Anani M. is a single, 39 year old man. He sells food products. He started this business in 2002 and stocks up at the main market in Lomé. His clientele includes people of all walks of life. He is requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy 5 boxes of canned goods, 10 boxes of spaghetti, 6 cartons of milk and other products.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of food products

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene 45 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y noble, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. El negocio al que Teodora se dedica, es la venta de pescados, es así que desde muy temprano por la mañana y durante los fines de semana venden ceviche con la ayuda de su esposo, negocio que hasta el momento les va muy bien. Como su hijo mayor labora en el centro de acopio de pescados, al salir de su trabajo, compra pescados frescos y los lleva a su casa, donde Teodora empieza con la elaboración de este platillo muy típico del Perú. De esta manera ha logrado captar mucha clientela que la prefieren por el servicio que brinda. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes; lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más doloroso como madre, es no poder rehabilitar a su hijo de parálisis de medio cuerpo que padece. Por tal motivo espera en adelante terminar de construir su casa para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida. Este es el treceavo crédito con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta dispuesta hacerlo. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará materiales de construcción como: cemento y arena fina, ya que quiere tener el piso de su casa en buen estado.
texts.en:
Teodora, 45, is a hard working, noble mother. She lives in her own house with her husband and two children. Her business is selling fish. Very early in the morning every day and on weekends she and her husband sell ceviche (marinated fish). They do quite well with the business. Since her son works at the municipal fish gathering center when he gets off work he buys fresh fish and takes it home where Teodora prepares this very typical Peruvian dish. She has managed to win over many customers who prefer her due to the service she provides. What she enjoys most about her work is chatting with her customers. She has been in business for 15 years and considers the most painful thing to face as a mother is being unable to rehabilitate her son from a paralysis he has in half his body. For this reason she hopes to soon finish building her house to offer him a better quality of life. This is her 13th loan with MFP; she’s aware that she has to repay punctually and is willing to do so; she is a very cheerful, responsible member of her communal bank. She wants the loan to buy building materials and supplies like: cement and fine sand because she wants to have the floor in the house in very good condition.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Kafui Yolande

texts.fr: kafui a ouvert en 2000 sa propre boutique dans laquelle elle vend des fournitures de bureau, elle s'approvisionne à Lomé et exerce son commerce dans son quartier de résidence "ablogamé" qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle  sollicite son deuxième crédit de WAGES pour s'acheter 100 cartons  de papiers rame, des sous mains et des chemises et divers autres fournitures. c'est avec le revenu de ce commerce qu'elle subvient à ses propres charges.
texts.en:
In 2000, Kafui opened a shop where she sells office supplies. Her business is located in her home district of Ablogamé, a suburb of the city of Lomé. Her clientele includes people of all walks of life. She buys her supplies in Lomé. She is requesting her second loan from WAGES to buy 100 boxes of paper reams, desk blotters, folders and other supplies. She has been able to support herself with the income from her business.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of office supplies

loans.name: Jose Rolando

texts.es: José Rolando tiene su negocio que es brindar el servicio de transporte y vive en una zona caracterizada por comerciantes informales. Inicio su negocio con muy poca experiencia pero con la ayuda de una amigo que le enseño a manejar decide hacerse cargo pues siempre ha sido un padre muy responsable tiene 8 hijos y poco a poco fue logro obtener este medio de vida. Con este crédito quiere mejorar las condiciones de su automóvil. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José Rolando’s business is providing public transportation services. He lives in an area noted for its informal merchants. He started his business with very little experience but when a friend taught him to drive he decided to take charge because he has always been a very responsible father. He has 8 children. Gradually he attained this way to earn a living. He will use the loan to improve the condition of his car. In the future he’d like to improve the conditions of his house in order to provide his family with a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle repair.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 40 años, es una madre de familia muy jovial, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo, su hija y su nieta Fernanda de 3 años. El trabajo al que se dedica Gloria, es la venta de comida en su casa, que luego del desayuno, con mucha  prisa adereza los diversos platillos para el menú del día. Sus comensales asiduos, son los mecánicos que trabaja al costado de su casa, quienes gustan de su buena sazón y la diversidad de platos que ofrece a diario. En la hora del almuerzo, su hija la ayuda en la atención, ya que son muchos quienes acuden a su establecimiento y sola no se da abasto. Lo que más le gusta de su labor, es que termina de vender todo, aunque le parece muy cansado tener que abastecerse de productos para preparar sus platillos pero sabe que todo sacrificio tiene su esfuerzo. Lleva  4 años realizando esta actividad, por lo que espera continuar trabajan a fin de que pueda mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP y se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas como hasta ahora, ya que le ha permitido ir progresando de a poco. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará cemento y arena fina, para que haga revestir las paredes de su cocina y el local, donde almuerzan sus comensales.
texts.en:
Gloria is 40 years old and she is a very happy mother. She lives in her own house together with her husband, their daughter and their 3-year old granddaughter, Fernanda. Gloria sells prepared foods from her home. Soon after breakfast she starts preparing the dishes on the menu for the day. Her regular customers are the mechanics that work near her house. They all enjoy her cooking and the variety of the foods she serves every day. For the lunch hour her daughter helps her with the customers to keep up with the rush that visit her restaurant. By herself she would not be able to keep up. What she most likes about her work is that she always sells out. Even though it's hard work to shop for the ingredients to prepare her foods she knows that every job has its sacrifices. She has had this business for the past 4 years and she hopes to continue working to improve their home. This is her thirteenth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to making payments on time. These loans have helped her progress in her business. This loan that she requests will be used to purchase cement and sand to refinish the walls of her kitchen and her restaurant where her customers dine.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to refinish her kitchen and restaurant.

loans.name: Hera Devi

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Hera Devi M..  She is married and has one child who is 30 years old.  In 2009, she established her poultry farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, she supports her family.  She wants to purchase more chicks with this new loan from BPW Patan.  In the future, Hera Devi plans to expand the business.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business.  Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy.  Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open-air markets throughout the valley.  This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: To buying new chicks

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
Monsieur cheikh D. habite a Bambilor.il est âgé de 29 ans.il est marie sans enfant.
Il  s’active dans le secteur de la mécanique. C’est après avoir interrompu ses études qu’il a commencé  l’apprentissage de la mécanique. Ici ses principales activités sont la réparation et l’installation de moteurs. Parallèlement il exerce l’activité d’agriculteur en pratiquant le maraichage c’est à dire la culture de poivron de concombre etc.Il  a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans ce métier. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son métier c’est l’aspect lucratif qui lui donne l’opportunité de satisfaire ses besoins. Monsieur D. est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis décembre   2009.Il  sollicite un prêt de 400 000fcfa .Le but du prêt est l’achat d’un moteur pour réfectionner  sa voiture. Le crédit lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et de disposer d’une certaine  stabilité financière
texts.en:
Cheikh D. lives in Bambilor. He is 29 years, married and without children. He is a car mechanic. After having stopped his schooling, he started learning how to repair cars. His main activities are the repair and installation of engines. In parallel, he also does small scale truck farming, where he grows peppers, cucumbers, etc. He has been doing this for more than 5 years. What he likes about his trade is the opportunity to make money to meet his needs. Mr. D. has been a member of the Bambilor fund since December 2009. He is requesting a loan of 400,000 CFA. The loan will be used to purchase a motor to repair his vehicle. The loan will help him increase his revenues and gain some financial stability.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: car repair

loans.name: Lidia Marina

texts.es: Lidia Marina se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de costura. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio. Por lo que ha buscado la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, ella inicio con fondos propios pues ella siempre ha sido una mujer que le ha gustado sacar a sus hijos y proporcionarles todo lo necesario. Es por medio de su Mama que ella logro aprender este negocio y fuera un medio de vida para ella y su familia. Este crédito es para la compra de   materia prima como agujas, telas, hilos, tijera pues tiene pedidos que cumplir.
texts.en:
Lidia Marina is a seamstress. She has had her business for over 11 years. Seeking ways to improve her income, she used her own resources to start out because she’s always been a woman who wants to see her children get ahead and provide them with everything they need. She learned this craft from her mother and it became a way to support herself and her family. The loan is to buy raw materials like: needles, fabric, thread and scissors because she has pending orders to fill.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy needles, fabric, thread and scissors.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 46 años, es una madre de familia jovial, es separada y viven en su casa propia, junto a sus dos hijas. Hace más de 9 años, se dedica a la venta de artefactos y artesanías  en general. Es así que cada fin de mes viaja a provincias, llevando variedad de artefactos para el hogar y de regreso  compra cerámicas de arcillas. En un inicio sus clientes eran sus familiares y algunos amigos, pero con el tiempo logró captar clientela. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es el viaje que hace a provincias, ya que se distrae mucho y a la vez  se genera sus  propios ingresos económicos. Lleva más de 9 años realizando esta actividad y lo que espera en lo sucesivo es recorrer todo el país, para que así pueda realizar obras de labor social, que la ayuden a favor de los más necesitados de su distrito. Este es su quinceavo crédito con MFP, y sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas  y esta dispuesta hacerlo. Es la líder de su grupo y como tal es muy responsable. Con el crédito que solicita, incrementará de cerámicas y demás adornos, para atender los pedidos que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Maria is 46 years old and she is a very happy mom. She is separated and she lives in her own home together with her two daughters. For more than 9 years she has sold merchandise and general crafts. Every month she travels to the provinces from where she collects household items and ceramics. In the beginning her customers were her family and some friends. But with time she started to gain new clientele. What she most enjoys about her job is having to travel to the provinces. It serves as a distraction and at the same time she is able to secure her own source of income. She has had this business for more than 9 years and what she plans for the future is to travel throughout the entire country, to do some socially conscious work and gain some support for the most in need in the district where she lives. This is her fifteenth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she knows she must make her payments on time and she is committed to doing so. She is the leader of a group and as such she is very responsible. With the loan requested she will purchase more ceramics and other decorations and to fill some outstanding orders.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ceramics and decorations to meet client demand

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdoulaye G. est un jeune éleveur de 32 ans. Il est marie sans enfant. Après avoir arrêté ses études, il s’est oriente vers l’aviculture depuis 1996. Ainsi les revenus que lui   procure son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge de sa famille. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Bambilor depuis mai 2010.Il n’a pas antérieurement bénéficié de prêt dans l’institution. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000f qui sera destine a l’achat de 300 poussins en vue de développer son activité.  L’augmentation de ses  revenus  lui permettra   d’assurer la dépense quotidienne et de payer les  factures  électricité.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye G. is a young livestock farmer aged 32. He is married and has no children. After having ended his studies, he turned to poultry farming in 1996. The income from his business allows him to take care of his family. He has been a member of the Bambilor fund since May 2010. He has not benefited from any previous loans with this institution. He is seeking a loan of 150,000 F, which will be used to buy 300 chicks, with the goal of developing his business. The increase in his income will allow him to meet daily expenses and pay for electricity.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and raise chickens

loans.name: Nidia Sabina

texts.es: Nidia Sabina se dedica a una pulpería. Tiene más de 11 años de tener este negocio, pues con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado lo que tiene hoy.  Anteriormente su Papa se dedicaba a la pulpería con el paso del tiempo el fallece y le hereda la pulpería  Nidia, es así que sus vecinos llegan  a comprar los diferentes productos que ofrece.  Ella había realizado un financiamiento pues le fue muy bien porque compro lo necesario.  Con este nuevo crédito quiere comprar  materia prima y ofrecer una variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Nidia Sabina runs a general store. She has had this business for more than 11 years, and has achieved what she has today through a lot of effort. Previously, her father had the store. After some time he passed away and she inherited the general store. Her neighbors come to buy the products that she has to offer. She has had a loan which helped her buy what she needed. With this new loan, she wants to purchase merchandise and be able to offer a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jacqueline Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jacqueline vende arroz para poder mantener a sus dos hijos ya que es madre soltera. Ellos viven en una zona periurbana caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra es llamada “Paraíso”. 

Cuando el esposo de Jacqueline la abandono y se quedo con las deudas que tenían tubo que optar por un trabajo que le generara ingresos suficientes para poder mantener a su familia y paga las deudas, invirtió sus ahorros en sacos de arroz y los comenzó a vender a sus vecinos y conocidos. Una de sus hermanas le ayudan en la venta del arroz, trabajan desde las 11h00am.  

Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo sacos de arroz. En el futuro quiere comprar cantidades industriales de apiladoras y ser una comerciante mayorista.
texts.en:
Jacqueline sells rice to support her two children since she’s a single mother. They live in a periurban area noted for its unpaved streets called “Paraíso.” When Jacqueline’s husband abandoned her she was left with their debts and she had to go to work at something that would generate sufficient income to support her family and pay off her debts. She invested her savings in sacks of rice and started to sell it to friends and neighbors. One of her sisters helps her with the rice sales. They start work at 11am. To continue with her business she needs a loan to buy sacks of rice. In the future, she’d like to buy industrial quantities of rice and a rice husker to become a rice wholesaler.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice.

loans.name: Maria Albertina

texts.es:
María Albertina es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a s esposo y a sus cuatro hijos en el caserío Santa Isabel, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de su población ubicada en zonas rurales que distan mucho entre sí. El lugar pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Ella cría aves de corral y cuyes en unos corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio, alimentándolos de granos y pastos naturales y cada quice dias los vende en el mercado de su distrito. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo, que es comerciante de leña, en el sostenimiento de la economia de su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio comprando mas animales y mejorando la alimentación de los mismos para poder venderlos a un mejor precio, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de animales y alimento balanceado.

Su mayor anhelo es ver a su familia progresar y mejorar gradualmente su calidad de vida. Para ello se ha propuesto trabajar arduamente y seguir apoyando a su esposo. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
María Albertina, 32, is a mother living with her husband and their four children in the Santa Isabel settlement, a rural zone in Mórrope district, noted for having its population scattered among rural settlements that are quite far from each other. The place is part of Lambayeque province and is located over an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. She raises small farm animals for sale. She raises barnyard fowl and guinea pigs in some pens located in her back yard. She feeds them grains and natural grasses and sells them every two weeks in her district market. Income from these sales help her husband, who is a firewood merchant, to support the family. María wants to expand her business buying more animals and improving their nutrition so that she can sell them for a better price. To reach this goal she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan to buy animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them. Her greatest wish is to see her family make progress and gradually improve their quality of life. For that, she has pledged herself to work hard and continue to support her husband’s efforts. People who are acquainted with her consider her to be a levelheaded, responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small farm animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicken feed

loans.name: Ndeye Fatou Diop

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Fatou Diop N. est  une jeune  femme  mariée de 25 ans qui habite à Bambilor. Elle est électricienne de profession (réparation et installation).En même temps elle évolue dans le commerce  et s’active dans l’achat et la vente de pièces détachées depuis 2003 .Elle est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis octobre 2009.Elle na jamais bénéficiée  de prêt antérieur .Elle sollicite un prêt de 500  000f prévu pour l’achat de pièces détachées destinées a  la vente. L’augmentation de ses revenus lui donne la possibilité de soutenir son mari à gérer la dépense quotidienne  mais aussi de supporter ses charges personnelles.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndeye Fatou Diop N. is a young married woman, aged 25, who lives in Bambilor. She is an electrician by profession (repairs and installation). At the same time, she has developed a business buying and selling spare parts since 2003. She has been a member of the Bambilor local fund since October 2009. She has not benefited from any previous loans. She is seeking a loan of 500,000 F to buy spare parts destined for resale. The increase in her income gives her the possibility of supporting her husband in managing the daily household expenses, as well as providing for her own needs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: achat de piéces détachées

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Flor de María tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a uno de sus hijos en el sector Los Peches del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a mas de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega situada en su propio domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes una variedad de productos de uso diario al contado y al crédito. El negocio es de mucha utilidad para sus clientes debido a que les facilita el acceso a diversos productos por los cuales tendrían que dirigirse hasta el pueblo principal para adquirirlos.

Flor de María se vale de este negocio para ayudar a su esposo, que trabaja como jornalero en los campos agrícolas de la zona,  con el mantenimiento de la economía de su familia. Actualmente ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos de modo que sus ventas puedan expandirse y pueda conseguir un mayor numero de ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que dia a dia da lomejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Flor de María, 42, is married and lives with her husband and one of her children in Los Peches, Mochumí district, a farming area in Lambayeque province, located over half an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. She has a home-based store where she sells basic needs items and groceries. She sells her items both for cash and on credit. The business is very useful for her customers because she gives them easy access to various products that they would otherwise have to go all the way into the main town to get. Flor de María uses the business to help her husband, who works as a day laborer in the area’s farm fields, support the family. She wants to expand the business buying more products so that her sales will increase thus leading to higher profits. To reach her goal she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan. She is quite a hard working woman who daily gives her best to have her family succeed. People who know her consider her to be a responsible and calm person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic need items and groceries to stock her home-based store.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.fr: Monsieur alpha N. est un père de famille de 39 ans qui vit dans la localité de Bambilor. Cela fait 3 ans déjà qu’il exerce l’élevage de poussins et la culture de légumes (piments, aubergine, chou etc.).Ce qui l’a surtout motive a diversifier son activité  était le fait qu’il disposait d’un vaste champ inexploité. Il est membre de la caisse de  Bambilor depuis  avril 2010 .Il n’y a jamais contracté de prêt .Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000f qui sera utilisé pour l’achat d’intrants et la construction de deux bassins. Son souci est d’améliorer ses gains pour une meilleure prise en charge des besoins vitaux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Alpha N. is a 39-year-old father of a family living in the Bambilor area. For 3 years, he has raised chickens and farmed vegetables (peppers, eggplant, cabbage, etc.). What motivated him above all to diversify his business was the fact that he owns a vast field that is still unused. He has been a member of the Bambilor local fund since April 2010. He has not drawn any loans from them so far. He is seeking a loan of 200,000 F, which will be used to buy agricultural inputs and build two ponds. His concern is to increase his earnings in order to better take care of his family's essential needs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investissement

loans.name: María Dominga

texts.es:
Doña Dominga tiene 63 años de edad  está casada hace mas de 32 años, tiene 4 hijos ya mayores de edad.
Esta señora es muy emprendedora, teje mantas y manteles artesanales y ella misma se encarga de venderlos ya que  la mayoría de sus hijos vive en Argentina. 
Ella lleva sus productos a comercializarlos en Argentina, viaja una vez al mes y le resulta muy rentable su producto, hace más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad, gracias  a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo brindarle a sus hijos todas las comodidades y a la vez hacerles estudiar.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos y color para tejer hamacas que en ésta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dominga is 63 years old. She has been married for more than 32 years. She has 4 children who are already grown. She is a very enterprising woman. She weaves handmade blankets and tablecloths, and she is also responsible for selling them, since most of her children live in Argentina. She takes her products to sell in Argentina. She travels once a month, and she is able to earn a good profit with her products. She has dedicated herself to this work for more than 20 years. Thanks to her work and effort, she has been able to provide her children with all of the basic comforts and also pay for their education. She is requesting the loan to buy threads and dye to weave hammocks, which are in great demand among her customers during this season.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying thread, dyes and accessories to make handmade items

loans.name: Gregoria Eugenia

texts.es:
Gregoria de 64 años, es empleada domestica en una casa ya hace mucho tiempo para poder solventar sus gastos, vive en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales. 

Trabaja lavando, cocinando y planchando ropa en una casa donde es empleada domestica, trabaja la mayoría de días. Quiere en un futuro tener su negocio para poder descansar mas y asegurar su vejez. Con el préstamo quiere construir mejor su casa porque una parte del techo esta dañado y tiene miedo que le ingrese agua. 

En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando y poder cambiar el estilo de vida que tiene para que su vejez sea mejor.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 64 years old. She has worked as a domestic employee in a home for quite a while, in order to cover her expenses. She lives in an urban area where most of the inhabitants work as informal traders. She works washing, cooking and ironing clothes in a house where she is a domestic employee. She works on most days during the week. Sometime in the future, she would like to have a business of her own so she can take more time off and be secure in her old age. With the loan, she would like to improve her house, because part of the roof is damaged and she is afraid that water will come in. In the future, she would like to continue working and change her current lifestyle, so that her older years will be better.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roofing, paint and cement

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es: Brígida tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez ha aprendido a trabajar eficientemente en las tareas agrícolas, hoy cultiva papa, maíz, habas y arveja en sus propios terrenos de cultivo que le fue heredado. Ella y su esposo  se esfuerzan por darle lo mejor a sus hijos, quienes también están aprendiendo las técnicas de esta actividad. Afirma que le gusta trabajar en la agricultura porque le brinda la mercadería abundante para comercializarla en el mercado, además que tiene disponible del producto para el sustento familiar, por tal motivo desea adquirir más terrenos de cultivo y mayor cantidad de animales como ovejas y cerdos. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que la conocen como una persona responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono que le servirá para preparara la tierra en la siguiente siembra y asegurar obtener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Brigida is 39 years old and she lives in a house that is their own together with her husband and their 5 children. Since she was a little girl she has learned to work in the fields. Currently she cultivates potatoes, corn, fava beans, and sweet peas on land that was inherited to them. She and her husband work hard to provide the best to her kids. They, too, are now learning the business of agriculture. She says that she loves to work in agriculture because it yields abundant products to sell in the markets. She also uses the harvests to feed her family. For these reason she needs to have larger fields and greater numbers of livestock, including sheep and pigs. This is a first time loan for her through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to know that she has the financial support. She is known as a very responsible person with payments and she is also happy to be a member of her community bank. All the other members that she knows are responsible and they are team players. She is grateful to all those individuals that will contribute towards the loan that she requests and it will be very useful in the development of her business. The loan that she requests will be invested in the purchase of sacks of fertilizer to ready the fields for the next plantation, ensuring a good future harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio. Por la falta de oportunidades ella tubo que invertir sus ahorros en unas cabinas telefónicas y artículos de computadoras. La mama le ayudo con una parte de casa para que pueda construir y ubicar su pequeño negocio. 

Ella ofrece servicios de llamadas a nivel nacional con una tarifa muy baja, también vende todo tipo de artículos en su pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano. Ella  esta preocupada y le quiere dar una mejor vida a su hijo por eso quiere con el préstamo mejorar su casa comprando cemento, pinturas y otras cabinas telefónicas. En el futuro quiere tener un cyber y amplia su negocio
texts.en:
Rosa lives in an urban zone in El Suburbio. Due to the lack of employment opportunities she had to invest her savings in phone booths and computer equipment. Her mother helped her with part of the house she could use to build and set up her small business. She offers national phone call service at a very low rate and also sells all sorts of things in her small locale. She works from very early in the morning every day. She worries because she wants to provide a better life for her son. This is why she needs a loan to improve her house buying cement, paint and some additional phone booths. In the future, she’d like to have an Internet café and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cement, paint and telephone booths.

loans.name: Carlota Del Carmen

texts.es: Carlota del Carmen se dedica es la venta de refrescos. Tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, pues ha sido de gran ayuda. Ella tiene ubicado su negocio es en las afueras de un dispensario, en donde las enfermeras, doctores, pacientes entre otras personas. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues ha sido muy importante ya que es el trabajo que realiza todos los días para mantener a su familia. Este crédito lo realiza para comprar gaseosas, hielo, bolsas plásticas, jugos y frutas.
texts.en:
Carlota del Carmen sells refreshments. She has collaborated with the Foundation for a long time because it’s been a big help. Her business is located outside a dispensary where the nurses, doctors and patients, among others are her customers. She has been in business for over 8 years because it’s been very important in that it is the work she does daily to support her family. The loan will be used to buy soft drinks, ice, plastic bags, juices and fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, ice, plastic bags, juices and fruit.

loans.name: Carina

texts.es: Carina tiene 24 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era muy joven se dedicaba a la agricultura, aprendió las técnicas que utilizaban sus padres y cuando se caso, continúo trabajando en la siembra de papa, olluco, maíz y arveja, para sacar adelante a su familia. Han pasado 9 años, desde entonces le gusta mucho cultivar la tierra porque es lo que mejor que sabe hacer, aunque es algo sacrificado levantarse todos los días al amanecer y vigilar con dedicación sus campos. Señala que es gratificante cosechar y vender  todo a los mayoristas de la zona que le pagan regular dinero, que le permite darles una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos. Paralelamente a este trabajo, se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, que comercializa de vez en cuando a productores de la zona. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad para aumentar la producción y tener mayores ganancias económicas. Es la tercera vez que tiene su crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Carina comprará sacos de abono y semillas de arveja.
texts.en:
Carina is 24 years old and she lives with her husband and their 2 children in their own home. Since she was very young she started working as an agriculturist. She learned the techniques used by her parents and when she married she continued working the fields, cultivating potatoes, fingerling potatoes, corn, and sweet peas. All her efforts to support her family. Nine years have passed and since then she has continued to enjoy working the fields because it is what she knows to do best, although it is difficult to get up at the break of dawn every day and be so vigilant in the care of the plantations. It is very gratifying to harvest and sell the products to wholesalers in the region, giving her payments on a regular basis. This permits her to provide a good quality of life to her children. Along with this business she is also a cattle farmer and she makes her sales whenever producers come to the region. As she is an enterprising person she has plans for the future to have larger plantations to increase production and her earnings. This is the third time she has accessed a loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to know that she has this financial support. She has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments and she enjoys being a member of the community bank. All the members are a team of responsible individuals. She is grateful to all those individuals that will contribute to the loan she has requested; it will be very useful in the development of her business. Carina will purchase sacks of fertilizer and pea seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pea seeds.

loans.name: Alicia Halina

texts.es: Alicia Halina tiene 22 años, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, ella es una joven emprendedora le ha gustado trabajar para mantener a su familia. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad son para el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. Solicita este crédito para la compra de pantalones, ropa interior, camisetas, faldas, camisolas y trajes. Su mayor anhelo es ver a su familia progresar y mejorar gradualmente su calidad de vida. Para ello se ha propuesto trabajar arduamente y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Alicia Halina is 22 years old, and devotes her time to buying and selling clothes. For the 3 years she has had this business, this enterprising young woman has enjoyed her work, and enjoyed supporting her family. The income she makes goes to her family. She is seeking this loan to buy trousers, underwear, t-shirts, skirts, vests and suits. Her greatest desire is to see her family progressing and gradually improving their quality of life. For this reason, she vows to work hard and continue to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Teresa De Lourdes

texts.es:
Teresa de 46 años, es vendedora informal de confites y dulces en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive con su hijo de 12 años en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales.

Comenzó con su negocio ya que todos los días le tenia que comprar para la escuela a su hijo confites, opto por comprar en una cantidad grande confites y dulces y venderlos para tener un ingreso adicional. Poco a poco a podido incrementar su mercadería. Trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer para darle una mejor vida a sus hijos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar lácteos, confites para surtir mas su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener de alquiler locales para tener un ingreso adicional.
texts.en:
Teresa, 46, sells sweets and candy informally in front of her house. She lives with her 12 year old son in an urban zone noted for most of its inhabitants being informal merchants. She started her business because she had to buy her son snacks daily to take to school. She opted to buy a large quantity of snacks and candy to sell and have an extra source of income. Gradually she was able to increase her merchandise. She works every day from very early in the morning until nightfall to provide her children with a better life. The loan will be used to buy dairy products and sweets to better stock her business. In the future she’d like to have locales to rent as an additional source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For dairy products and sweets.

loans.name: Artesanas Beni Loma Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Carapeguá,  Compañia Beni Loma, distante a 15 km de la oficina de Carapeguá, unas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa, buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar, a travez del crédito, una fuente de  ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida.  
 Ellas ya obtuvieron créditos y  gracias a este programa pueden invertir en compras de hilos y trapos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sistemático. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Felicia quien posee un taller de ropas, se encuentra bien ubicada para el negocio y sus clientes estan muy satisfechas con los productos que su taller provee.
con los años que se dedica en el negocio ha adquierido mucha experiencia y esta muy satisfecha con la actividad.
Fabríca prendas de vestir de temporada y sobre pedido, desea incrementar sus ingresos abaratando los costos de insumos mediante la compra al por mayor de hilos, telas, apliques para confección de ropas.
texts.en:
In the Beni Loma neighborhood of the city of Carapegua, 15 miles from the central offices of Carapegua, some low-income women found out about the Comité de Mujeres Emprendoras program, and decided to meet to receive information about this program. They were looking for a little support in the form of loans, to develop a source of income and in this way improve their quality of life. They have already obtained loans, and thanks to this program they are able to invest in the purchase of thread and cloth and thus ensure systematic growth. One of the members is Felicia, who has a clothing workshop. Her business is in a good location, and her customers are very satisfied with the products that are made in her workshop. Over the years that she has dedicated herself to this business she has acquired a lot of experience, and she is very satisfied with this activity. She makes garments according to the season and sells them through orders. She wants to increase her income by decreasing the cost of her supplies by buying at wholesale the thread, fabric and appliques she uses to make clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fabric, thread and appliques used in making clothing

loans.name: Eucalda

texts.es: Eucalda vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era muy pequeña aprendió como jugando todo lo que era necesario para la correcta siembra y producción de las tierras donde cultiva principalmente el maíz y también la papa. La venta de maíz le ha resultado muy rentable, ya que le permitía sustentar muy bien a su familia, además de dar educación a sus hijas que era lo que más le interesaba. Siempre ha disfrutado de realizar la actividad agrícola ya que siempre le ha gustado el paisaje de su zona, ha pasado el tiempo y continúa  sembrando maíz. Paralelamente a esta actividad se dedica también a la crianza de  ganado porcino, para luego comercializarlo en las ferias de la zona por donde vive, de esta manera logra obtener ganancias extras de la agricultura. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar arveja, puesto que sabe que el precio de esta legumbre esta muy alto en el mercado. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y abono ya que en esta ocasión va incrementar la cantidad de terrenos sembrados.
texts.en:
Eucalda lives with her husband and 3 children in their own home. From a very young age, just like a game, she learned everything about the optimal planting and production of the lands where she now grows mainly corn and potatoes. The sale of corn has proved to be very profitable and supports her family, as well as providing her daughters with an education, which was the most important thing for her. She has always enjoyed farming because she loves the landscape in her area. Time has gone by but she still sows corn. She also raises pigs to sell them at local fairs and get some extra income on top of the one she gets from agriculture. She is a very enterprising woman and in future she plans to sow peas, because their price is high in the current marketplace. This is her second loan with MFP. She is very happy to have financial backing and she has always proved to be very responsible in her payments. She also enjoys being part of her loan group because all members are responsible and supportive. She would like to thank those managing her loan request as it will be very valuable in the development of her business. She will invest the loan in the purchase of fertilizers and manure, which will increase the amount of land available for sowing.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
El señor Eloy B. vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá, es casado, tiene 2 hijos, todos dependen de él económicamente. El se dedica al venta ambulante de productos varios (ropas, productos de limpieza, lencerias y analgesicos y otros.), cuenta con más de 100 clientes activos y tiene una antigüedad de 4 años en el ramo.
El señor Eloy trabaja con su esposa quien también firma como codeudora; cuenta con casa propia ubicada en la compañía Tajy Loma de la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Este préstamo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías que serán destinadas a la venta, de modo a obtener mayor cantidad de clientes.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir de forma puntual con el pago.
texts.en:
Eloy B. lives in the city of Carapeguá. He is married and has 2 children, both of which are economically dependent upon him. He works selling various products on foot (clothing, cleaning products, lingerie, painkillers, and other items). He has more than 100 active customers and he has been in the business for 4 years. Eloy works with his wife who is borrowing the loan with him. He has his own house located in Compañía Tajy Loma in the city of Carapeguá.

He will invest this loan in the purchase of merchandise to be sold so that he can get more customers.

He appreciates the Fundación Paraguaya for the loan and he promises to make his loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various merchandise at wholesale price to then sell in retail.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Nelida es casada, tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Nelida tiene un puesto en el mercado Santa Clara en donde vende juguetes, ganchos, discos, actividad que realiza con su esposo, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja mensualmente. Nelida abre su negocio a las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.
Nelida solicita un crédito de 3000 soles para la compra de discos y ganchos.
Los sueños de Nelida es educar a sus hijos y aumentar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Nelida is a member of the Sonrisa communal bank. She is married and has 2 children who are students. She has a stand in the Santa Clara market where she sells toys, hangers, and disks with her husband. She gets her products in the city of Lima, where she travels once a month. Nelida opens her business at 7am and closes at 9pm.

She is requesting a loan of 3000 PEN to purchase disks and hangers. Nelida’s dreams are to educate her children and to increase her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase disks and hangers

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es casada, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 1 estudia, Lucia viaja a las ferias de la región 3 veces por semana, en donde compra cereales variados y luego los comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa y necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de trigo, maíz y haba.
El sueño de Lucia es ahorrar para comprar un carro que le ayude a transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Lucia is married and has four children one of whom is still in school. Lucia travels to the regional markets three times a week to buy assorted cereals that she later sells in Ayacucho’s wholesale foodstuffs market. Lucia is a member of the Sonrisa (Smile) communal bank and needs a 2000 sol loan to buy wheat, corn and lima beans. Lucia’s dream is to save up to buy a car that will help her transport her products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat, corn and lima beans.

loans.name: Flavio Apolinar

texts.es: Flavio tiene 34 años, su actividad es una pulpería, el tiene 2 hijos, el es un hombre que ser caracteriza por ser muy responsable, pues se caracteriza por brindar una buena atención a sus clientes, el realiza un excelente trabajo todos los días se levanta temprano para abrir su pulpería e iniciar a atender a sus clientes. El viaja a león a comprar los diferentes productos que ofrece pues él vive en una comarca llamada san Claudio. Este financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, jugos, detergentes y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Flavio, 34, has a grocery store. He has two children. He is a man noted for his responsibility for he always tries to provide very good customer service. He performs excellently very day. He rises very early to open his store and tend to customers. He goes to León to buy the various products he stocks because he lives in a rural area called San Claudio. The loan is to buy sweets, soft drinks, juices, detergents and basic grains.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Frida Esther

texts.es:
Frida es separada, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 4 viven con ella, Frida se dedica a la venta de leña que ella misma manda hacer, producto que vende en el mercado Nery, además Frida se dedica a la agricultura de cereales y verduras en la comunidad de San Juan de Viñaca, también se dedica a la crianza de animales.
Frida es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa y necesita un préstamo de 2600 para la compra de leña y tara.
Los sueños de Frida son mejorar su casa para vivir mejor y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Frida is separated and has 8 children four of whom live with her. Frida sells firewood in Nery Market that she has made. She also farms cereals and vegetables in San Juan de Viñaca and raises animals. Frida is a member of the Sonrisa (Smile) communal bank and needs a 2600 sol loan to buy firewood and tara (a Peruvian tree rich in tannins). Frida’s dreams are to improve her home to live more comfortably and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and tara (Caesalpinia spinosa, a Peruvian plant rich in tannins)

loans.name: Maria Barbarita

texts.es:
María de 56 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales.

Comenzó con su tienda de vivieres ya que por su sector no había y necesitaba genera ingresos para su familia, poco a poco vendiendo aceites, arroz, bebidas pudo tener su tienda. Ahora trabaja todos los días en su tienda y en ocasiones vende comida. 

Para surtir mas su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, azúcar, bebidas. En el futuro quiere tener bien surtida su tienda para que sus clientes tengan mas opciones.
texts.en:
María, 56 years old, has a small store in the front of her house. She lives in an urban area where most people are informal merchants. She started her general store because there were none in her neighborhood and she needed to have an income for her family. She was able to open the store by selling oils, rice and beverages little by little. She now works every day in her store and occasionally sells food. In order to diversify her business, she will use the loan to buy rice, sugar and beverages. In the future, she would like to have a lot of variety in her store to offer her clients more options.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, sugar, beverages

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva pertenece al Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Genoveva es soltera, tiene 3 hijos y solo uno estudia, Genoveva tiene un restaurante llamado Miski Mikuy en un local alquilado en una avenida, brinda servicios de desayuno, almuerzo, cena, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de 5 personas, Genoveva tiene proyectado complementar su negocio con la venta de pizzas.
Genoveva necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles para la compra de un horno pizzero.
Los sueños de Genoveva son tener un local propio y sacar adelante a su hija.
texts.en:
Genoveva belongs to the Sonrisa ["Smile"] Community Bank. Genoveva is single and has 3 children, only one of whom is in school. Genoveva has a restaurant called Miski Mikuy in a rented location on a boulevard. She offers brekfast, lunch and dinner with the help of 5 people. Genoveva plans to complement her business with pizza sales. Genoveva needs a loan of 1600 soles to purchase a pizza oven. Her dreams are to have her own location and to get her daughter ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of a pizza oven.

loans.name: Teresa Natividad

texts.es:
Teresa es casada, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo una hija esta a su responsabilidad, Teresa junto a su hija y esposo realizan trabajos de artesanía en piedra de Huamanga (alabastro), productos que vende en el mercado artesanal de la ciudad, también vende otra variedad de artesanías que compra de los productores.
Teresa pertenece al Banco Comunal Sonrisa y necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de retablos y cerámicas.
Teresa sueña con ampliar su negocio y tener una tienda grande.
texts.en:
Teresa is married and has 4 children, of whom only one daughter is her responsibility. Teresa, her daughter and husband make crafts of alabaster, which they sell in the craft market of the city. She also sells a variety of crafts that she buys from the producers. Teresa belongs to the Sonrisa ["Smile"] Community Bank and she needs a loan of 1000 soles for the purchase of altarpieces and ceramics. Teresa dreams of expanding her business and having a large store.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of altarpieces and ceramics

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
Primitiva es casada y tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Primitiva tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los ias con L. ayuda D. sus hijos.
Primitiva es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa y solicita un préstamo D. 2000 soles para L. compra D. arroz, azúcar y aceite.
Los sueños D. Primitiva es que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Primitiva is married and has 4 children who are in school. Primitiva has a store in her home where she sells general groceries: vegetables, meat, and fruit. She does this every day with the help of her children. Primitiva is a member of the Sonrisa ["Smile"] Community Bank and she needs a loan of 2000 soles for the purchase of rice, sugar and oil. Her dreams are for her children to be professionals and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: El Quesillo Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Quesillo está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras quienes han sido beneficiadas tanto por los préstamo y como por las capacitaciones lo cual según comentan han aplicado para sacar adelante sus negocios. Una de ellas es Rosa Carolina L., coordinadora del grupo, comerciante de ropa desde hace siete años. El negocio lo inicio por medio de un préstamo el cual por su esfuerzo ha ido creciendo y desarrollándose.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Gladys María V. desde hace siete años tiene una tortillería y Anielka Azucena P. quien tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio en el 2004.
texts.en:
The El Quesillo group is made up of three hard-working women who have greatly benefited from their loans and training, and as they discussed they have applied for a loan to get their businesses ahead. One of these women is Rosa Carolina Lopez, the group coordinator. She has been a clothing merchant for seven years. She started her business with a loan, and with her hard work it has been growing and developing. The other group members are Gladys Maria V., who has had a tortilla store for seven years, and Anielka Azucena Pavon, who has a small grocery store which she opened in 2004.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of clothing merchandise

loans.name: Antolina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Antolina; ella tiene 28  años de edad y es casada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos como trigo, quinua, garbanzos y habas, ella vende en el mercado de Huancaro que queda ubicado en la ciudad de Cusco desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener un puesto donde vender los granos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  granos secos como un saco de trigo, garbanzos y quinua al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Antolina, 28, is married and has three children. She is a member of the “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata” communal bank located in Yuncaypata, Cusco province, Cusco department. She alternates household chores with the sale of dry goods like wheat, quinoa, chickpeas and lima beans. She sells in the city of Cucso’s Huancaro Market. She works from 8am until 4pm. She would like to have a stall in which to sell the dry grains. She is asking for a loan to buy dry grains like a sack of wheat, chickpeas and quinoa at wholesale. She makes use of this forum to thank all those that share her dream and promises to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dry grains like a sack of wheat, chickpeas and quinoa at wholesale.

loans.name: César Agustín

texts.es:
El señor Cesar Agustín F. Zárate vive en San Roque González de Santacruz, tiene 37 años y se dedica al comercio con una antigüedad de 5 años.
El señor Cesar Agustín F. es casado con 3 hijos, vive actualmente con su cónyuge quien  también firma como codeudora.
Ambos se dedican a la venta de ropas, zapatos y calzados deportivos; cuentan con casa propia y poseen su negocio en la misma.
El crédito se destinará a adquisición de mercaderías al por mayor como calzados,ropas como vestidos, blusas, shorts, para así obtener un mayor ingreso y mayor ganancia con las ventas.
Agradece a  Fundación Paraguaya por el préstamo otorgado ya que será de gran utilidad para el progreso de su negocio con miras al futuro.
texts.en:
Cesar Agustín F. Zárate lives in San Roque González de Santacruz. He is 37 and has 5 years of experience in business. Cesar Agustín F. is married with 3 children. He currently lives with his partner who is also signing as a co-debtor. Together they sell clothing, shoes and sporting shoes; they have their own home and have their business in it. The loan will be used to acquire merchandise wholesale, such as shoes, and clothing, such as dresses, blouses and shorts in order to obtain a better income and better profits with their sales. He thanks Fundacion Paraguaya for this loan, since it will be very useful for the progress of his business in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of seasonal clothing for the beginning of spring, and sports shoes and dress shoes for sale.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes M. M.  es  una mujer de 70 años y con sueños muy firmes, pues tiene como meta el montaje de almacén para exhibir vestidos femeninos e infantiles, en las líneas clásicas, formales e informales  y disfraces, adaptandose a los requerimientos que trae cada época a nivel comercial, porque ella aprovecha muy bien cada momento para desplegar su creatividad y vender permanentemente.
 
Mercedes desde hace 35 años, tiene el negocio de comercializar ropa femenina e infantil,  negocio que inició al observar en las actividades de su pueblo, Juan de Acosta,  un potencial  de confecciones femenina  dedicado a este oficio, produciendo con buena calidad, pero con poco capital de trabajo para hacer una oferta comercial;  desde ese momento  concibió el negocio que ahora tiene:  "comercializar en las ciudades de Santa Marta y Cartagena  ropa femenina e infantil, mediante el sistema de comprar la tela diseñar la moda y mandarla a fabricar en los talleres de su pueblo natal. Es así como todos los sábados envía los pedidos a estas ciudades, que son cancelados mediante un credicontado de 8 a 15 días. En la actualidad fabricó disfraces  para niñas porque se acerca el día de los niños y Halloween y está preparada para responder a sus clientes; su credikiva es el séptimo financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará telas, e insumos y pagara la mano de obra a las confeccionistas con las cuales trabaja. En sus tres años de ser clienta de la Fundación ha notado el incremento constante de su capital de trabajo, mediante sus créditos y su capacidad de hacer negocios.
  
La  señora mercedes vive con su sobrina pues es viuda y no tuvo hijos, e insiste en alcanzar su  sueño de tener un almacén para vender los productos al publico, pues la competencia todos los días la inspira para que desarrolle su creatividad ofreciendo alternativas que le permiten la sostenibilidad de su negocio y responderle como lo merece a su fiel clientela que desde hace mas de veinte años le compra .
texts.en:
Mercedes M. M. is a 70 year old woman with a goal of having a store for women's and children's dresses. These dresses will include classic cuts, formal and informal designs as well as costumes that would vary with the sales season. She is a woman who knows how to take advantage of the moment with her creativity in order to have consistent sales. For the past 35 yeas Mercedes has had a business selling women's and children's clothing, She started by noticing the possibility of making a quality product with little startup capital in her town of Juan de Acosta. Since that time she has had her current business selling women's and children's clothing in Santa Marta and Cartagena for which the fabric has been purchased, designs created, and sewn in her home town. Every Saturday she sends orders to these town which are purchased on 8-15 day credits. She recently made children's costumes since Halloween is drawing near and she is anticipated her clients' needs. Her Kiva loan is her 7th through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to buy fabric, related goods, as well as to pay labor costs. In her 3 years as a client, Fundacion has noted the steady growth in her operating capital through the loans and her business skills. Mercedes lives with her niece, as she is widowed and has no children. She is adamant in her dream of having a store to sell her goods to the public, since the competition pushes her to be more creative and offer more variety to sustain the business and react to her loyal (more than 20 years) and deserving customers' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and accessories as well as pay labor for the sewers she works with.

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es: Enedina tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo  y su hijo en su casa propia. Toda la vida ha estado dedicada a la agricultura y a la crianza D. animales que con mucho esmero ha venido realizando con su esposo con el fin D. sostener a su familia. En la actualidad mantiene las mismas fuerzas y energías para que pueda obtener una excelente cosecha y generen las rentas necesarias. Afirma que le agrada trabajar en esta actividad ya que es lo único que sabe hacer desD. que era un niño, ahora en lo posible comercializa su producción en el mercado mayorista, lugar donD. obtiene mejores ganancias, es por esta razón que desea mejorar sus futuras cosechas. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. abono ya que empezará una nueva temporada D. siembra.
texts.en:
Enedina, 53, lives with her husband and her son in her own house. She has been a farmer and has raised animals her entire life. She and her husband have been working very hard to support their family. She still has the same strength and energy to continue working to have an excellent harvest that will produce the necessary profits. She affirms that she likes working in this activity since it’s the only thing she’s known how to do since she was a child. Whenever possible, products are sold in the wholesale market where profits are best. For this reason, she’d like to improve future crops. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she can count on financial support. Besides, she likes being part of a communal bank because all the members are people she knows; they are responsible and mutually supportive. She is grateful to all those people who will fund the loan she is asking for that will be so useful for her business’ progress. She will use the requested funds to buy sacks of manure because the new planting season is about to begin.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Cayetana Cecilia

texts.es: Cayetana Cecilia se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y especies, hace más de 12 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy buena experiencia ella trabaja duro todos los días, los diferentes clientes transitan para realizar la compra de sus productos. Trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano por lo que tiene 4 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, su mayor desafío ha sido dedicarse a su negocio y a sus hijos pues ambos necesitan de su atención. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos y especies. Sueña con proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Cayetana Cecilia sells basic grains. She has had this business for over 12 years. It has been a very good experience and she works hard every day. Various customers travel to buy her products. She starts work very early every day because she has 4 young children under her care. Her greatest challenge has been taking care of her business and her children as both need her attention. The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of basic grains. She dreams of making improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Avelino

texts.es:
Avelino F. es un Sr. de 52 años de edad, oriundo de Roque González está casado hace más de 32 años con la Sra. Petrona de 51 años de edad, tienen 5 hijos juntos, 2 en edad escolar y 3 hijos que  ya mayores de edad y gracias a sus padres ya son profesionales.
Hace 20 años empezó con una pequeña despensa en su domicilio, donde la Sra. atendía mientras él se dedicaba a comprar animales para faena y luego vender la carne en la despensa. 
Actualmente se encuentran trabajando toda familia junta en la despensa, ya que es el centro de compras más importante y concurrido de la ciudad.
Ahora desea comprar más mercaderías como ser: bebidas y artículos de primera necesidad como:   Harina, yerba, fideos y arroz en cantidades, de modo a abaratar los precios de costo y así obtener mayores ingresos con las ventas.
texts.en:
Avelino F. is a 52 year-old man, born in Roque Gonzales. He has been married for 32 years to Petrona, age 51. They have 5 children together, 2 of whom are school aged, and 3 of whom are grown and are professionals, thanks to their parents. 20 years ago, he started with a small store in his home. His wife tended to the store while he worked on buying animals to do farm work, which they would later sell for meat in the store. The whole family works together in the store now, as it is the most important and highly-trafficked store in the city. He now wants to buy more merchandise such as drinks and basic staples such as flour, yerba, noodles and rice in bulk in order to get lower prices and thus obtain better earnings from the sales.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the acquisition of wholesale merchandise, such as: cloth, drinks, packaged foods, vegetables, cleaning products, hardware, etc.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo J. F. es una mujer muy trabajadora que viene de una comunidad rural llamada El Sauce de Cartago caracterizada por su cercanía al espectacular volcán Turrialba y por su atracción al turismo de montaña gracias a su acogedor Clima 
Doña Amparo es una socia muy activa en esta comunidad, desde hace años  produce la leche que vende a su vecinos. Ella quiere comprar una vaca lechera con  la cual puede aumentar su producción, con la  meta de comprar más vacas en el futuro. Es por eso que ella necesita un crédito de ¢500 000 (quinientos mil colones).
Ella es socia de  la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  su quinto    préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Amparo J. F. is a hardworking woman who comes from a rural community named El Sauce de Cartago. The community is located near the Turrialba volcano and attracts mountain tourists due to its welcoming climate. Amparo is a very active member of the community. She produces milk to sell to her neighbors. She wants to purchase a milking cow to increase her production. She has a goal to buy more cows in the future. This is why she is needs a loan for 600,000 colones. She is a partner of the Asociacion de Productores de El Sauce, one of the 100 EDESA member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be her fifth loan and she hopes to keep growing in an economic and personal level.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of milking cow

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana; ella tiene 33  años de edad y es casada  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos ella vende en el mercado de Huancaro que queda ubicado en la ciudad de Cusco desde las 7:00 a m hasta las 4.00 p.m   y después se va y también lleva a las distintas ferias que se realizan en la ciudad de Cusco, ella quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes en el distrito de Yuncaypata que está ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  granos secos como trigo, garbanzos y quinua al por mayor. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ana, 33, is married and has four children. She is a member of the “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata” communal bank located in Yuncaypata, Cusco province, Cusco department. She alternates her daily chores with the sale of dry grains in Cusco’s Huancaro Market. She works from 7am until 4pm. Then she leaves and also goes to the various farmers markets that take place in Cusco. She wants to have a grocery store in Yuncaypata which is located fifteen minutes from Cusco. She is asking for funds to buy dry grains like wheat, chickpeas and quinoa at wholesale. She makes use of this forum to thank all those who share in her dream and promises to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dry grains like wheat, chickpeas and quinoa at wholesale.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad says every day is wonderful because she spends it in the company of children. She has been running her in-home day care center since 2003, but her experience extends decades back. She is married and is the mother of three grown children.

Trinidad received a loan from ACCION USA to make improvements to her in-home day care. She is refinishing her floors, painting and purchasing some new toys and practical items for the children. As a licensed day care provider, she is required to make these improvements. 

This is the restructured version of Trinidad’s previous loan http://www.kiva.org/lend/114100 . With the aid of her daughter, Trinidad will continue working to strengthen her business and have a greater influence on her community.

loans.use: New flooring and paint for her home-based business as well as new toys and playpens

loans.name: Alba María

texts.es:
La Sta. Alba María es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, Barrio San José, tiene 20 años de edad, y con un hijo menor de edad.
     
Ella comenta que desde los 15 años empezó a trabajar como ayudante de una peluquería la cual le sirvió mucho como aprendizaje empírico, luego con su ingreso fue realizando compras a cuotas de algunos elementos más necesarios de peluquería pensando en tener lo que hoy en día ya pudo lograr, su propia peluquería, que gracias a su sacrificio y dedicación ya cuenta con clientela formada y con varios equipos propios.

Agradece a Fundación Paraguaya y kiva por la oportunidad de préstamo que le otorga para así aumentar día a día su crecimiento profesional, mediante la ampliación del negocio con herramientas que faciliten la atención a la clientela, así como pinturas para cabellos, maquillajes, herramientas de manicuro y pedicura.
texts.en:
Alba Maria is from the town of Carapeguá, San José district. She is 20 years old and has a young son. She tells us that she started working as a salon assistant at 15 years of age. That served her as practical experience. She started buying basic salon tools in installments with her income thinking about having her own salon which is a reality today. Thanks to her sacrifice and dedication she has an established clientele and many equipment of her own. She thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity to receive a loan to promote her professional growth day by day. This will be possible by increasing her business through purchasing tools to facilitate caring for her clients such as hair color, make up, manicure and pedicure equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of salon tools and materials, such as hair color, make up, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing, cosmetics, items for the home

loans.name: Vajio Km6 Group

texts.es:
Como presidenta esta la Sra. Martita se dedica a la de venta de cerveza hace 1 año en la zona del km 6 barrio el Vajio, su estado civil es  soltera  pero tiene un hijo, es madre soltera, por tal motivo ella se esfuerza para sacar adelante a su hijo y a su familia, es muy trabajadora, con el dinero del crédito comprara cerveza por cantidad y así poder incrementar su capital de trabajo.                                                                                                      Como Secretaria esta la Sra. Ingrid vive en la zona del km 6  barrio Vajio cuenta con el negocio de venta de cosméticos ambulante.  Estado civil, concubina con el sr: Romy  que trabaja en el área del medio ambiente. Cuentan con  dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, con el dinero del credito comprara cosméticos por catalogo que se encuentran en promosion.
El  Tesorero el Sr. Andrés  Cuenta con el negocio de venta de comida y electricista, en la zona km6 barrio el Vajio,  estado civil: concubino con la Sra.
