Mariela comerciante venta de Hanburguesas en la zona km6 barrio el Vajio , cuentan con 2 hijos que se  encuentran en edad escolar, con el dinero del crédito compraran Papa, aceite, insumos por cantidad para la elaboración de sus hamburguesas.
Todos los socios están muy agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del  crédito.
texts.en:
The group president, Martita, has sold beer for one year in the neighborhood of El Bajío -- Kilometer 6. She is single, but she has a son, so she is a single mother. For this reason she strives to help her son and her family move ahead. She is very hardworking. With the loan money, she will buy beer in bulk so she will be able to increase her working capital. The group's secretary is Ingrid, who lives in El Bajío -- Kilometer 6. She works selling cosmetics as a traveling saleswoman. She has a live-in partner, Romy, who works in the environmental field. They have two school-age children. With the loan money, she will buy cosmetics that are currently on sale from a catalog. The treasurer is Andrés. He works in food sales and as an electrician in El Bajío -- Kilometer 6. He has a live-in partner, Mariela, a businesswoman who sells hamburgers in El Bajío -- Kilometer 6. They have two school-age children. With the loan money, they will buy potatoes, oil, and supplies for making hamburgers. All the members are very grateful to the institution for the support offered them through the granting of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Willian Steven

texts.es:
Willian de 21 años, tiene un  taller de mecánica en un garaje, vive en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales.

Por la necesidad de un empleo tubo que comenzar a trabajar en la misma profesión del papa. Poco a poco a trabajando con la ayuda de su papa arreglando motocicletas a podido mantener a su hijo. Trabaja arreglando la parte electrónica de las motocicletas desde muy temprano. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una maquina para limpieza de inyectores. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y tener un taller bien arreglado para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Willian, 21-years-old, has a mechanic shop in a garage. He lives in an urban zone characterized by informal merchants. Because he needed a job, he had to start working in the same profession as his father. Little by little, working with the help of his father to fix motorcycles, he's been able to support his son. He wakes up early and fixes the electrical parts of the motorcycles. With this loan he wants to buy a machine that cleans fuel injectors. In the future he wants to expand his business and have a workshop that satisfies the needs of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of machine that cleans fuel injectors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase milk cows.

loans.name: Blanca Bertha

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora blanca tiene 78 años es viuda y tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad,  nos cuenta que tiene muchos nietos que ahora en su vejez le ayudan y le dan alegría. Uno de sus hijos vive con ella junto con su familia.

Se dedica hace quince años a la venta de ropa, dice que aunque pasen los años ella tiene sus clientes que la prefieren, trabaja los sábados y domingos en las ventas y cobranzas ya que deja a crédito y cobra los fines de semana. En sus recorridos le acompaña un nieto que le ayuda. La mercadería se la va a comprar un hijo a Guayaquil ya que  se encuentran mayor variedad y al gusto de sus clientes.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar más mercadería, porque tiene algunos pedidos y quiere cumplir con ellos a tiempo. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el principio y le ha gustado por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución.
 
Sus metas son seguir trabajando hasta que Dios le de fuerza.
texts.en:
The community bank named Maria the Helper meets in the La Sequita district belonging to Montecristi in the Manabita region. The population is hard working, dedicated, and proud of their heritage. La Sequita is a district whose inhabitants are honest and only want to work and support their families. Blanca is 78 years old, she is a widow, and she has 5 grown children. She has many grandchildren and now in her old age they help her and they are her joy. One of her children lives with her together with his family. For the past 15 years she has sold clothing and through the years she has maintained her client base that prefer to buy from her. She works on Saturdays and Sundays, selling and collecting payments from the sales made in credit. In her travels one of her grand sons keeps her company and helps her with the business. The merchandise is bought by one of her children in Guayaquil, location where a greater variety of clothing and the styles sought out can be found. This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise to fill some outstanding orders, wanting to provide the merchandise on time. She has been a member of this community bank since its inception and she has enjoyed it for the additional benefits the organization provides. Her goal is to keep working so long as God gives her strength.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase blouses, skirts, pants, t-shirts, dresses etc.

loans.name: Soley

texts.es:
Soley Castellon R. quiere a sus 35 años  convertirse en toda una microempresaria por medio de su taller de Costura.
Ella vive en canalete una comunidad rural en Alajuela, desde hace tres años ella se dedica a la confección de ropa interior y de ropa de vestir formal.  Con sus ventas a logrado hacer que su negocio sea reconocido en toda su comunidad, por eso ella quiere un préstamo de ¢600 000 (seiscientos mil colones)  para comprar una máquina de coser Overlock y demás materiales que necesita para lograr una mayor producción en su taller y convertirse al fin en una microempresaria.
Doña Soley  es socia  de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica, este será su cuarto Préstamo.
texts.en:
Soley Castellos R. is 35 years old and she wants to be a business woman, to have a tailoring shop. She lives in Canalete, a rural community in Alajuela. For the past three years she has been making under garments and formal attire. Through her sales she has managed to make a name for herself. She requires a loan in the amount of 600 000 (six hundred thousand) colones to purchase an Overlock sewing machine and materials that she needs to make larger quantities of clothing in her shop. Her goal is to become a small business owner. Soley is a member of Community Bank Canalete, one of the 100 organizations of Edesa (Kiva Field Partner) in Costa Rica. This will be her fourth loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and basic tailoring materials.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Don Jorge M. M. quiere comprarse una vaquita lechera. 
El vive en la comunidad del Sauce de Cartago, caracterizado por su cercanía al espectacular volcán Turrialba y por atracción del turismo de montaña gracias a su acogedor Clima.
Don Jorge se ha dedicado toda su vida a la lechería, y hoy necesita un crédito de ¢500 000 (seiscientos mil colones) para la compra de una vaca lechera, el asegura que con ella aumentara su producción y así mejora las condiciones  económica de su familia.
El  es socio de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  su cuarto   préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Jorge M. M. wants to buy a milking cow. He lives in the community of Sauce de Cartago, known for its spectacular proximity to the Turrialba volcano and for the popular tourist attraction of the mountains and its pleasant climate. Jorge has been a milk farmer all his life and currently he requires a loan of 600 000 (six hundred thousand) colones to purchase a milking cow. With her help he will improve his production and improve the financial situation of his family. He is a member of the Association of Producers of El Sauce, one of the 100 member organizations of Edesa (Kiva Field Partner) in Costa Rica. This will be his fourth loan and he hopes to keep improving himself and his finances.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Clotilde; ella tiene 43  años de edad y es casada  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos como habas, maíz, moraya, frijoles y trigo y su esposo trabaja como maestro de construcción y juntos sacan adelante a sus pequeños hijos, la socia quiere tener un lugar donde vender las verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  granos secos  al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Clotilde, 43, is married and has four children. She is a member of the “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata” communal bank located in Yuncaypata, Cusco province, Cusco department. She alternates her daily chores with the sale of dry grains like lima beans, corn, dehydrated potato, beans and wheat. Her husband is a master builder and together they support their young children. She would like to have a place to sell the vegetables. She is asking for funds to buy grains at wholesale. She makes use of this forum to thank all those who share in her dream and promises to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dry grains at wholesale.

loans.name: Ignacia Candelaria

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.
 
La señora Ignacia tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 14 años,  tiene tres hijos los cuales estudian en escuela y colegio. El marido se dedica a la albañilería. Es socia fundadora del banco y está muy agradecida con la Fundación Espoir por la ayuda que le han brindado.

Tiene una pequeña granja donde cría chanchos, ella compra los chanchos cuando están pequeños, luego los cría y después de 4 o 5 meses los vende en pie o los faena,  los vende por libras a sus vecinos y tiendas locales, nos cuenta que en 5 meses llegan a pesar hasta 200 libras las que venden a buen precio y deja buenas ganancias, trabaja todos los días unas tres a cuatro horas, sus hijos le ayudan más que todo cuando tiene que alimentarlos.

Va a utilizar este crédito para comprar 10 chanchos, alimento y medicinas para su mejor desarrollo.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para ir a entregar directo a los mercados y frigoríficos.
texts.en:
The community bank named Maria the Helper meets in the La Sequita district belonging to Montecristi in the Manabita region. The population is hard working, dedicated, and proud of their heritage. La Sequita is a district whose inhabitants are honest and only want to work and support their families. Ignacia is 35 years old and she has lived with her boyfriend for the past 14 years. They have three children together; all are attending school. Her partner is a construction worker. She is a founding member of the this community bank and she is very grateful to Fundacion Espoir (Kiva Field Partner) for the help they have provided her. She has a small farm from where she raises pigs. She buys the pigs when they are only piglets and she raises them. When they are 4 or 5 months old she sells them as livestock or as meat, selling them to her neighbors and to local stores. When they reach 5 months of age they reach 200 lbs so she is able to sell them at a good price, yielding a good profit. She works every day about three or four hours. Her children help her, especially in feeding them. She will use her loan to purchase 10 piglets, feed, and medicines to raise them. Her dream is to purchase a car and be able to deliver the products herself, to the markets and to butcher shops.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 10 piglets, feed and livestock medicines.

loans.name: Biviana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado  en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Biviana; ella tiene 56 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos como habas, maíz, moraya, frijoles y trigo y también se dedica a cultivar maíz y papa, ya que tiene un pequeño terreno de cultivo, la socia quiere mejorar su terreno. La socia solicita el préstamo para la educación de su hija que se está preparando para ingresar a la universidad.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Biviana, 56, is married and has four children. She is a member of the “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata” communal bank located in Yuncaypata, Cusco province, Cusco department. She alternates her daily chores with the sale of products like lima beans, corn, dehydrated potato, beans and wheat. She also farms corn and potato since she has a small field. She would like to improve her field. She is asking for funds for her daughter’s education since she is getting ready to enroll in the university. She makes use of this forum to thank all those who share her dream and promises to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For her daughter's educational expenses.  She's getting ready to start University.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: Ernestina tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde muy joven se dedicó a la agricultura, aprendió todas las técnicas agrícolas viendo a sus padres y hermanos como lo hacían, sembrando con mucho esmero la tierra. Ahora en compañía de su esposo, continúa dedicando a esta actividad; ambos siembran maíz y papa, cuidan  mucho de sus tierras para asegurar la producción, pues  deben vender todo a los mayoristas que van hasta sus mismas chacras a recoger la mercadería. Dice sentirse satisfecha ya que tiene buenas ganancias, por eso le gusta mucho su trabajo, pese que trabaja largas horas en el campo, pero es gratificante el esfuerzo, con tal de sacar adelante a sus hijos. Además paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y porcino para engordarlos y luego comercializarlos  en las ferias de la zona por donde vive. Ya tiene pensado para el futuro sembrar en mayor cantidad el maíz, ya que el precio en el mercado es regular, también quiere comprar más cabezas de ganado. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del crédito que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para esta campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Ernestina, 32, lives with her husband and two children in her own house. From a very young age she has been a farmer. She learned all the skills watching how her parents and siblings did things, planting the soil with much care. Now, together with her husband, she continues in the same activity. They both plant corn and potatoes. They care for the soil so that production will be assured because they must be able to sell everything to the wholesalers who come by their fields to gather the merchandise. She says she is content because she has good profits and that’s why she enjoys the work so much despite the long hours in the fields. The effort is gratifying as long as she can see her children get ahead. At the same time she raises cattle and pigs for subsequent sale in the area livestock fairs. She is planning to plant more corn in the future because its market price is regular. She also wants to buy more heads of cattle. This is her third loan with MFP and she is happy to know that she can count on financial support because she has always been responsible with her repayments. She is pleased to be part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible and mutually supportive people. She is grateful to all the people who will fund the requested loan that will be very useful for her business’ success. She will use the requested funds to buy sacks of manure for the upcoming planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Edith Mabel

texts.es:
Edith trabaja administrando la tienda de víveres de su papa en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales.

La tienda pertenece a su papa pero como el enfermo le pidió a ella que la administre para que no se pierda el negocio porque es la única fuente de ingresos de su familia. Poco a poco ha venido trabajando desde las 07h00am hasta las 20h30am todos los días. Vende arroz, víveres, legumbres etc. 

Para que el negocio siga aumentando sus ingresos necesita surtir mas la tienda por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, aceites, legumbres, carnes etc. En el futuro quiere que sus negocios sea mas grande.
texts.en:
Edith manages her father's grocery store located in the front section of the house. She lives in an urban region known for its many vendors. The store belongs to her father but since he fell ill he asked her to run the business for him, to keep the business alive. It is the only source of income for the family. She has been managing the business, working from 7a.m. to 10:30 pm every day. She sells rice, groceries, vegetables, etc. In order to keep her business growing and improving the profits, she needs to restock the store. She needs to purchase rice, cooking oils, vegetables, meats etc. In the future she would like to have a larger business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, cooking oils, vegetables.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilaria; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de crianza de animales menores como gallinas y chanchos y venta de productos como papa y maíz, ella los vende en diferentes mercados como Huancaro y San Pedro, la socia quiere tener un puesto para vender los productos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales y productos al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hilaria, 41, is married and has three children. She’s a member of the “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata” communal bank located in Yuncaypata, Cusco province, Cusco department. She alternates her daily chores with raising small farm animals like chickens and pigs. She also sells products like potato and corn in various markets like Huancaro and San Pedro. She would like to have a market stall to sell her products. She is asking for funds to buy animals and products at wholesale. She makes use of this forum to thank all those who share her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals and products at wholesale.

loans.name: Nery Alexandra

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Nery y nos cuenta algo de su vida, está casada hace 20 años y tiene 4 hijos tres mayores y una de 17 años que estudia el último año de colegio. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de atún en la ciudad de Manta. Es su cuarto ciclo en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque comparte buenos momentos con sus amigas en las reuniones.

Se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00. Además fabrica y vende bolos (helado de hielo en funda) de distintos sabores los mismos que son muy apetecidos por sus clientes, la mercadería la compra en  Portoviejo y en ciertos casos los recibe en su local,  le encanta su trabajo porque siempre está en contacto con todas sus amigas que son sus clientes.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar mercadería para surtir aun más su tienda, en especial va a comprar tanques de gas para vender ya que por allí cerca no hay depósitos.

Su deseo es construir otro piso en su casa.
texts.en:
The community bank named Maria the Helper meets in the La Sequita district belonging to Montecristi in the Manabita region. The population is hard working, dedicated, and proud of their heritage. La Sequita is a district whose inhabitants are honest and only want to work and support their families. Here we meet Nery and she tells us about her life. She has been married for 20 years and she has 4 grown children and a daughter that is 17 years old and in her last year of college. Her husband works in a tuna factory in the city of Manta. This is the Community Bank's fourth loan cycle and she enjoys being a member because she shares good times with her friends at their meetings. She is a salesperson and she has a grocery store. She works every day from 6a.m. until 10p.m. She also makes ice creams (water based treats sold in tubs) of various flavors, an excellent treat to offer her clients. She makes her purchases in Portoviejo. She loves her work because she is always in contact with her friends, who are also her clients. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise to restock her store. She will purchase tanks of gas to sell because there are no depots close by. Her dream it to build another story on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks, eggs, tanks of gas,etc.

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Estefania; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de verduras y cereales, ella vende tomates,zanahorias,cebollas,pepinos y toda variedad de cereales, ella vende en la ciudad del Cusco en los diferentes mercados desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, su esposo es maestro de construcción y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener un local para vender las verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Estefania, 46, is married and has three children. She is a member of the “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata” communal bank located in Yuncaypata, Cusco province, Cusco department. She alternates her daily tasks with vegetable and cereals sales. She sells tomatoes, carrots, onions, cucumbers and all kinds of cereals in various markets in Cusco from 7am until 5pm. Her husband is a master builder and together they support their children. She would like to have a market stall to sell her vegetables. She is asking for funds to buy vegetables at wholesale. She makes use of this forum to thank all those who share in her dream and promises to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Feliza

texts.es: Feliza tiene 58 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Feliza se dedica a varias actividades que le aseguran un ingreso económico estable todos los meses, siendo la agricultura la actividad principalmente que se dedica, mientras espera la cosecha, venD. animales que cría en su establo. Pero desD. hace 2 años el comercio D. productos agrícolas como fertilizantes y D. otros productos tiene mucha demanda, es por eso que se dedica a esta labor, ofreciendo a sus clientes los productos que tiene y los venD. al contado, por otro lado sus animales los venD. D. acuerdo a la necesidad D. dinero que tiene  y una vez llegada  la cosecha tiene  más trabajo por hacer, por lo que generalmente requiere D. la ayuda D. sus hijos o D. peones que contrata para que le faciliten el trabajo. Feliza se siente muy contenta D. ver que sus actividades son rentables por tal motivo ha decidido crecer más en su negocio. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen D. su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. más sacos D. abono al por mayor que utilizará tanto para su negocio como parar sembrar en sus propios terrenos D. cultivo.
texts.en:
Feliza, 58, lives with her two children in her own house. She is engaged in several activities that assure stable monthly income. Her main activity is farming. While she awaits harvest, however, she sells animals that she raises in her stable. Since about two years ago, the sale of farming supplies like fertilizers and other products has had much demand. For this reason she is in this business too, offering to sell her customers products she has for cash. On the other hand, she sells her animals according to her financial needs. Once harvest time arrives she has more work to do so she needs help from her children or from laborers she hires to make the job easier. Feliza is very content because her activities are profitable so she has decided to expand her business. This is her first loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she can count on financial help because they know she is a responsible person with respect to repayments. Besides, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because she knows all the members and they are responsible and mutually supportive. She is grateful to all those who will fund the loan she is requesting because it will be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the requested loan to buy more sacks of manure at wholesale that she will use both for her business and on her own farmlands.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa, nacida el 15 de noviembre de 1973, en Chuquisaca, con cuatro hijos, casada con don Isaac Sejas, ella vive en tiquipaya en el municipio de el Torno y trabaja en Rancho Nuevo a 8 Kms hacia el Sur de la Carretera de Tiquipaya, ella trabaja justamente con sus esposo y sus hijos, todo lo que siembre, como ser zanahoria y otras verduras, donde ella lo saca a la venta y lo vende directamente al consumidor en los mercados de la ciudad de Santa Cruz.
En la foto la Sra. Elsa	en la foto se encuentra en compañia de su esposo.
texts.en:
Elsa was born on November 15, 1973 in Chuquisaca. She has four children and she is married with Mr. Isaac Sejas. She lives in Tiquipaya in the municipality of El Torno. she works in Rancho Nuevo located about 8 km south of the main road of Tiquipaya. She works together with her husband and their children selling carrots and other vegetables. She goes out to make her sales directly to the consumers in the markets of the city of Santa Cruz. Elsa is pictured here with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the carrot harvest.

loans.name: Fanny Amarily

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Fanny tiene 43 años de edad y está casada hace 26, tiene 5 hijos, 4 son mayores de edad y el ultimo de 15 años,  aunque sean mayores todos aun viven en su casa, su esposo tiene un  puesto donde vende pollos por libras  en el mercado de Tarqui en Manta.

Ella tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo, vende además algunos remedios y tarjetas telefónicas esto le da ganancias extra comenta, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 19h00, dice que tiene muchos clientes porque en su tienda se encuentra de todo como: carne, queso, embutidos pescado, etc. En su tienda le ayudan sus hijos cuando están desocupados. Dice que ya son varios años que esta en este negocio y le ha ido muy bien. Su mercadería la compra en Portoviejo, Manta y también le entregan en su local.

Este crédito lo va emplear en surtir más su tienda con sus productos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 7 años y le gusta mucho. 

Su meta es agrandar aun mas su negocio.
texts.en:
The community bank named Maria the Helper meets in the La Sequita district belonging to Montecristi in the Manabita region. The population is hard working, dedicated, and proud of their heritage. La Sequita is a district whose inhabitants are honest and only want to work and support their families. Fanny is 43 years old and she has been married since she was 26 years old. She has 5 children, 4 are of legal age and the youngest is 15 years old. Although they are all grown they still live at home. Her husband sells chicken meat from a stand in the Tarqui market in the city of Manta. She has a grocery store and she also sells some basic medicines and prepaid telephone cards. These give her an extra source of income. She works every day from 7a.m. until 7p.m. She has a large client base because her store has a good variety of products: meats, cheeses, canned fish etc. Her children help her with the store when they are not busy. She has had this business for many years now and it has been successful. She purchases her merchandise in the city of Portoviejo and in Manta, but she also makes private purchases from individuals. This loan will be used to restock her store with products. She has been a member of the Community Bank for the past 7 years and she has greatly enjoyed it. Her goal is to expand her business even more.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugard, cheese, meats, eggs, cooking oil, fish, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de verduras y granos secos, ella vende tomates,zanahorias,cebollas,pepinos y toda variedad de granos secos, ella lleva a diferentes lugares como Urubamba, Pisac y también los vende en la ciudad del Cusco y en algunas oportunidades manda a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado, su esposo se dedica a cultivar verduras en su pequeño terreno de cultivo y por medios de estos trabajos pueden sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener un puesto para vender las verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras  y también para comprar abonos y semillas para su terreno de cultivo.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata communal bank. The bank is located in the community of Yuncaypata, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Julia is 38 years old, married, and has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling vegetables and dried grains. She sells tomatoes, carrots, onions, cucumbers, and all varieties of dried grains. Julia travels to different places like Urubamba, Pisac, and also sells them in the city of Cuzco. When she has the opportunity, she also sends them to Puerto Maldonado. Her husband works growing vegetables on his small piece of farmland and through these jobs, they are able to help their children get ahead. Julia wants to have a stand to sell the vegetables. She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables, as well as fertilizer and seeds for their farmland.

Julia is grateful for everyone who has made this dream possible and she promises to make her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, as well as fertilizer and seeds for their farmland.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Basilia; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos como moraya, trigo, quinua y maíz, ella vende en el mercado de Huancaro desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m y también tiene un pequeño de terreno de cultivo, la socia quiere tener una tienda donde pueda vender los productos secos.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar producto secos al por mayor y también poder comprar semillas para su terreno de cultivo. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata communal bank. The bank is located in the community of Yuncaypata, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Basilia is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling dried products such as moraya (a freeze-dried potato product), wheat, quinoa and corn. She works selling in the Huancaro market from 6am to 5pm, and she also has a small piece of farmland. Basilia wants to have a store where she can sell her dried products. She is requesting the loan to buy dried products at wholesale and also to purchase seeds for her land.

Basilia is grateful for everyone who has made this dream possible and she promises to make her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dried products at wholesale and also to purchase seeds for her land.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguá  en la Compañía Potrero, uñas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa. 
Estas Señoras son activas muy trabajadoras y se dedican a las  actividades ya mencionados más arriba. 
Ellas buscando un poco más de apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.
La Sra. Mirtha  es una de las integrantes y se dedica al tejido y confección de ropas artesanales, así también cortinados, mantas, manteles y adornos en tejido de hilos.
Posee buena clientela, gracias a la calidad de sus productos y tiene bastantes pedidos, siendo que son prendas artesanales con variados diseños y son excelentes para regalos y recuerdos de algo muy tradicional del Paraguay.
Desea incrementar sus ingresos mediante la adquisición en cantidad de hilos de variados colores, así como los apliques que se utilizan en las prendas.
texts.en:
In the city of Carapegua, in the Potrero district, a group of poor women met with the program named Enterprising Women (Kiva Field Partner) and they decided to become members to gain more information about the program. This group of women is very active and hard working and they have various kinds of businesses. They are in search of more support to promote the growth of their family income through a loan, to improve their quality of life. They require a loan to invest in their businesses and to achieve the sustainable development of them as a group and each as individuals. Mirtha is one of the members of the group and she knits and makes traditional clothing, as well as drapes, table cloths and decorations. She has a good client base thanks to the quality of her products. She has a good number of orders especially because her items are in various designs and are excellent as gifts and souvenirs. These are very traditional crafts in Paraguay. She wishes to improve her earnings by acquiring large quantities of threads and yarns in various colors, as well as appliqués used in the clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase threads, fabrics, and appliques for traditional clothing.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: La señora Martina esta Casada con el Sr. Esteban tienen Siete hijos que se encuentran estudiando en colegio y en la universidad, y otros ya casados e independientes, la Sra. Martina y su esposo nacidos en Potosí, Hace 20 años que llegaron a conseguir una pequeña parcela en quebrada Leon a 18 Km D. El Torno hacia el oeste en la cual Trabaja en la Agricultura, tambien se dedica a la ganaderia y fruticultura, tiene cítricos como ser: Mandarina, Maracuyá; pero el problema es que la fruta se cosecha una vez al año, por eso desea sembrar arroz y maiz, es para esta siembra que solicito el prestamo, para la preparacion D. la tierra y para la siembra D. estos productos, es una persona trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Martina is married to Esteban. They have seven children who are in high school and college, and others are married and independent. Martina and her husband were born in Potosí. 20 years ago, they were able to get a small land parcel in the Leon ravine 18 Km west of El Torno. She farms there and they have cattle and grow fruit. They have citrus such as tangerines and passion fruit. The problem is that the fruit is harvested once a year and because of that, she wants to grow rice and corn. That is why she is asking for the loan; to get the land ready and to plant these products. She is a hardworking person and she is very grateful to the institution for the support offeres in granting this loan. .

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To do preparation and planting of rice and corn

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano tiene 49 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura y desde que se ha casado ha heredado los terrenos que le correspondían. En la actualidad trabaja ininterrumpidamente en la siembra y cosecha de papa y maíz, su esposa siempre ha sido el principal apoyo al igual que sus hijos, ya que esta actividad requiere de mucho esfuerzo y solo no se da abasto. Manifiesta además que le agrada trabajar en el campo porque es tranquilo, pero sabe que todo esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo la recompensa a ello, es buena. Por ello seguirá trabajando en esta actividad con miras de mejorar su producción. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de abono y semillas.
texts.en:
Feliciano, 49, lives with his wife and three children in his own house. From childhood on he has been a farmer and since he got married he inherited the fields that were rightfully his. He works uninterruptedly farming potatoes and corn. His wife has always been his main helper as have been his children since this activity requires much effort and he wouldn’t be able to do it all by himself. He states that he likes working in the fields because it’s tranquil but he knows that all the effort he puts into his work will yield good rewards. Therefore, he will continue working in this activity aiming to improve production. This is his first loan with MFP. He is happy to know that he can count on financial support. He is also pleased to be part of a communal bank because all the members are people known to him and they are responsible and mutually supportive. He is grateful to all those who will fund the loan he is requesting that will be so useful for his continued progress. He will use the requested funds to buy manure and seed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and seed.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Avelina; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos, ella los compra pequeños y los alimenta y los hace crecer y los vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco, este negocio lo realiza junto con su esposo que también tiene un pequeño terreno de cultivo, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio de crianza de chanchos y ampliar el lugar donde viven los animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chanchos y también para comprar alimento para los animales. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Virgen del Carmen de Yucaypata community bank; the bank is located in the Yuncaypata community, belonging to the province and department of Cusco. The member is Mrs Avelina; she is 49, married and has 1 child. She alternates her daily activities with her business where she raises animals such as hogs. She buys them small and feeds them, growing them and then selling them in the markets of Cusco city. She does this business with her husband who also has a small plot of land for farming. She wants to improve her hog-raising business and expand the area in which the animals live. She is requesting this loan to purchase hogs and also to purchase food for the animals. She thanks those who will be part of this dream through this loan and promises to repay the quotas as established.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing hogs, and also to purchase food for the animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the purchase of shoes, perfume, clothes and sewing materials

loans.name: Evelyn Leonela

texts.es:
Evelyn, tiene un salón de belleza en una parte de su casa que construyo para su negocio. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral rodeada del estero salado de Guayaquil. 

Comenzó a estudiar de muy joven peluquería poco a poco pudo armar su negocio ya que le gusto mucho esta actividad para poder mantener a sus dos hijos. Su mama le ayuda con el negocio en horarios rotativos. Para generar mas ingresos ella hace trabajos de estilista a domicilio. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar tintes y maquinas para su salón de belleza. En el futuro quiere tener una peluquería bien surtida para asi tener dinero para darles una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Evelyn has a beauty salon in a part of her house that she built for her business. She lives in an area on th eoutskirts of town called Perimetral. It is surrounded by the salt wedge of Guayaquil. She started to study hair styling when she was very young and little by little began to establish her business, since she really like this activity to be able to support her two children. Her mother helps her with the business on a rotating schedule. To generate more income, she does styling in people's home. With the loan, she wants to buy dyes and appliances for her beauty salon. In the future, she wants to have a well supplied hair salon to be able to have money to give a better life to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dyes, appliances

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Rosa esta en el Banco Comunal desde el principio Y ella ocupa el cargo de presidenta, el cual ha sabido llevar muy bien, le gusta porque siempre ha recibido los créditos a tiempo, además por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la Fundación Espoir. Tiene 46 años está casada, tiene tres hijos que están estudiando la educación superior, su esposo es albañil.
 
Ella es ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo comenzó a criar chanchos, primero en pequeñas cantidades pero fue creciendo y ahora cría hasta 30 chanchos por temporada. Los compra pequeños, los alimenta y cuida de tres a cuatro meses hasta que  tengan un buen desarrollo y luego los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa a comprárselos, trabaja sin horario fijo  todos los días ya que les da muchos cuidados para evitar las enfermedades, algunas veces sus hijos le ayudan en su labor.

Con este crédito va a construir otro corral para meter más chanchos, además de alimentos y medicinas.
 
Su meta es que sus hijos sean profesionales y que puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora Communal Bank meets in Sequita parrish, which is in the canton of Montecristi, in the prosperous Manabí province. The area is full of hardworking people who are proud of the roots. Sequita is a parrish where the residents are honest people who only know how to work and take care of their families. Rosa has been in the communal bank since it started and she is its president. She has has managed this position very well and likes the communal bank because she has always received her loans on time and also because of the extra benefits offered by Fundación Espoir. She is 46, married and has three children who are studying higher education. Her husband is a bricklayer. She is a housewife but began raising pigs to help out her husband. She started with small quantities but the business grew and now she raises up to 30 pigs per season. She buys them when they are small, feeds them and cares for them for three to four months. When they are well developed she delivers them to traders who come to her house to buy them. She works every day without any set hours and gives them a lot of care so they do not get sick. Sometimes her children help out. With this loan she will build another pen so that she can have more pigs as well as buy feed and medicines. Her goal is for her children to become professionals and succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a pen and to buy feed and medicines for her animals.

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés es un padre de familia de 53 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a uno de sus hijos en el caserío Rio Hondo del sector Sialupe Baca, una zona rural situada en el distrito de Lambayeque, una zona de movimiento comercial considerable ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Andrés se dedica a brindar transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte), el suele brindar este servicio dentro de la ciudad de Lambayeque y en el caserío donde reside. Adicionalmente a esta actividad, se dedica a la crianza y comercializacion de animales menores. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar los gastos de su familia.

Andrés desea brindar mantenimiento a su unidad móvil y reparar algunas fallas que se han presentado debido al continuo uso otorgado. Para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir progresando para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus seres queridos. El da lo mejor de si para sacar a los suyos adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Andres is a 53 year old head of household who lives with his wife and one of his children in the town of Rio Hondo in the Sialupe Baca region. This is a rural area in the Lambayeque district which has a lot of commercial activity and is just outside the city of Chiclayo. Andres makes a living transporting good and people in his motorcycle taxi. He provides this service in Lambayeque and in his town. He also raises and sells small animals. He uses the income from these activities to help maintain his family. Andres hopes to maintain his motorcycle taxi and repair a few problems created by its constant use. To achieve this he has requested his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 Nuevos Soles. His greatest wish is to keep growing to improve his loved ones quality of life. His gives his all to help his family. People who know him describe him as easy going and responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance and repair for motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Teófilo

texts.es:
Teófilo tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, un lugar caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de su población ubicada en zonas rurales que distan mucho entre si. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte), el brinda el servicio dentro de su distrito y siempre cuenta con clientes ya que el servicio brindado por estos vehículos se caracteriza por ser rápido y barato.

El continuo uso otorgado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Teófilo es un joven bastante responsable y trabajador. Su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir otra mototaxi y poder crecer en su negocio. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Teófilo, 21, is single and lives with his family in Olmos district, a place noted for having most of its inhabitants scattered among rural communities that are quite far from each other. It is part of Lambayeque province and located an hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He provides passenger and cargo transportation services with a mototaxi (motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle that has a cabin attached used to provide transport). He provides this service within his district and always can count on customers because the service provided by this kind of vehicle is rapid and inexpensive. The continuous use of the vehicle, however, has led to its needing urgent repair so that it can continue to run correctly; thus his loan request to Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 new soles. Teófilo is quite a responsible and hard working young man. His greatest wish is to be able to acquire a second mototaxi so that his business can grow. He has collaborated with our Institution in the past and has been responsible and punctual with his repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: Nélida tiene 28 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Esta luchadora mujer se dedica a sembrar maíz, desde que era muy joven aprendió las técnicas  que le enseñaron sus padres y hermanos. Cada día se despierta con el alba para dirigirse hacía sus campos agrícolas, para vigilar y cuidar que la plaga de insectos o el mal tiempo dañe el desarrollo de sus plantaciones. Aunque es un trabajo algo duro para una mujer, dice que le gusta mucho ya que la motiva el hecho de sacar adelante a sus hijos, y cuando es tiempo de cosechar vende muy bien toda su producción, y con el dinero que obtiene, puede dar el sustento y educación a sus hijos. Para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad el maíz y contratar los servicios de peones o personal, para obtener mayores ganancias. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá para comprar sacos de abono ya que esta en plena temporada de siembra.
texts.en:
Nelida is 28 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their 3 children. This struggling woman sows corn. When she was very young she learned the technique, taught by her parents and brothers. Each day she gets up at sunrise to head to her agricultural fields to watch out for plagues of insects or bad weather that may harm the development of her crops. Although it is very hard work for a woman, Nelida says that she likes it very much and she's motivated by the desire to advance her children. At harvest time, her produce sells very well, and with the money she receives, she can provide support and education for her children. In the future, she plans to sow a larger quantity of corn and contract the services of day laborers to obtain better earnings. This is Nelida's 3rd loan with MFP. She is very content to know she has this financial help. Nelida has always been very responsible with her payments and is pleased to be part of a communal bank, because all the members are responsible and very supportive people. Nelida also wishes to thank everyone who supports her loan, which will be very useful in her business's progress. With this loan she will buy sacks of manure for we are now in the heart of planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING SACKS OF MANURE TO FERTILIZE HER CORN FIELDS

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es: El Sr. Alcides  casado con la señora Ibelia hace  31 años, tienen 4 hijos  dos están con ellos uno de 2 0 y 1 7 años sus otros dos hijos están casados. Los señores viven en el  barrio los Tusequis. Don Alcides de dedica al Rubro del transporte hace  25 años,  su señora es costurera, ella le ayuda  con los gastos del hogar. El crédito que se le otorgo al sr. es para el mantenimiento de su vehículo (reparación caja automática, equipo de gas, dirección hidráulica compra de llanta y cambio de aceite u otros) El cliente agradecido infinitamente con la  institución  por la agilidad y la eficiencia que se le atendió deseándolos mucha prosperidad.
texts.en:
Alcides has been married to Ibelia for 31 years. They have four children. Two of them, ages 20 and 17, live with them. The other two are married. They live in the Tusequis district. Alcides has been working in transportation for 25 years. His wife is a seamstress and helps him with the household expenses. The loan granted to Alcides will be used for maintaining his vehicle (repairing the transmission, gas equipment, power steering, purchase of tires, oil change and others). He is forever thankful to the bank for the promptness and efficiency in helping him and wishes them great prosperity.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in raw materials necessary for making bags

loans.name: Abelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Abelina; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos como arroz, azúcar y aceite, ella tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado de Huancaro  desde las 6:00 a.m hasta 5:00 p.m, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene un pequeño terreno donde cultiva maíz, papa y pasto, la socia quiere agrandar su puesto y poder vender más variedad de productos.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata” communal bank. The bank is located in the community of Yuncaypata. It belongs to the province and department of Cuzco. The member is Abelina. She is 41 years old and is a married mother of two children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling products such as rice, sugar and oil. She has a small locale in the ella Huancaro market from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. Her husband is a farmer. He has a small plot of land where he grows corn, potatoes and grass. The member wants to enlarge her locale and be able to sell more of a variety of products. She is asking for the loan to buy products wholesale. The member is grateful to those who have become a part of her dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy products wholesale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith B. L. tiene 63 años y vive con su cónyuge y tiene 4 hijos; desde hace 34 años empezó a vender ropa interior para niños y así apoyar los gastos del hogar; poco a poco con la ayuda de su esposo, quien le daba un dinero mensual para ayudarla a construir su sueño, "Variedades Judith"  fue creciendo gradualmente hasta que hace diez años llegó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, allí ha recibido cuatro  créditos mediante los cuales ha tenido muchos logros por ejemplo el de fortalecer el capital de trabajo de su negocio, darle estudio a sus hijos, hacer en el segundo piso en su vivienda un apartamento, que ahora arrendado le genera un ingreso mas, así como también cubrir muchas veces los gastos alimenticios. Actualmente sus hijos son profesionales y están trabajando y ella dice que todo esto es producto del apoyo recibido, eso si agregándole disciplina en el trabajo y en la inversión. Ahora sueña con adecuar su almacén en la parte baja de su casa y continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, para organizar un sistema de distribución en muchas mujeres trabajadoras con tal de que ellas  tengan su fuente de ingreso también. Su credikiva es su cuarto crédito, con el planea abastecerse comprando ropa variada y disfraces para las fiestas que se avecinan: la de los enamorados, la fiesta de los angelitos, Halloween, pero especialmente para Diciembre donde todo el mundo compra lo que ella vende.
texts.en:
Judith B. L. is 63 years old, lives with her spouse, and has four children. When she was 34, she began selling children's underwear to contribute to household expenses. Slowly, with the help of her husband, who gave her money every month, she was able to build her dream. "Variedades Judith" [Judith's Variety Store] was growing slowly until she came to the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation ten years ago. There, she has received four loans, which she has used with a lot of success. For example, she has increased the capital in her business, sent her children to school, and turned the second floor of her house into an apartment, which also generates income, and often covers the cost of food. Today, her children are working professionals, which she says is the result of the support they received, which added discipline in their work and in the investment. Judith dreams of putting her store in the lower part of her house, and to continue increasing her working capital in order to organize a distribution system for other working women so that they can have a source of income as well. This loan would be her fourth, and she plans to stock up on a variety of clothing and costumes for holidays that are coming up: a feast for ones in love, a feast of the angels, Halloween, and especially for December, when everyone buys what she is selling.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and costumes for holidays and celebrations

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Epifania; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos como trigo, maíz y moraya, ella vende en el mercado de Ttio desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener un puesto donde vender los productos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos  al por mayor.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Epifania is a member of the Virgin of Carmen de Yuncaypata Community Bank which is located in Yuncaypata, in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. She is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She divides her time between her daily activities and running her business selling dried goods such as wheat, corn, and potatoes in the Ttio market. Epifania works there from 6am to 5 pm and would like to have a stall there from which to sell her merchandise. She is seeking a loan to buy dried goods in bulk. Epifania is grateful to all who help make her dream possible and promises to pay back the loan according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane A, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy dried goods in bulk

loans.name: María Leticia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Marie tiene 47 años, está casada hace 20 años y tiene 7 hijos,  4 de ellos aun viven con ella. Los mayores viven en Manta y los que viven con ella están estudiando en el colegio.
 
Ella y su esposo se dedican al comercio, venden recipientes y otros productos de plástico, trabajan desde las seis de la mañana hasta las 16 h00, salen a ofrecer sus productos en los campos ya que por allá estos productos son muy vendidos. Estos productos los compran en Picoaza en un lugar que le dejan a precio de mayorista para que ellos tengan ganancias, dice que siempre ha trabajado junto con su esposo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más mercadería. Está en el Banco Comunal hace cinco ciclos y le ha gustado por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos y por las reuniones informativas.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para vender sus productos con más comodidad.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora Community Bank meets in the parrish of Sequita, which is in the prosperous area of Montecristi, and full of hard working people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita is a parrish of honest people who only know how to work and take care of their families. María is 47 years old, has been married for 20 years, and has seven children. Four of her children are in school and live with her. The older ones live in Manta. She and her husband work in trade selling containers and other plastic products. They work from 6:00am until 4:00pm. They go out to the country to sell their products, because they are very popular there. They buy their products in Picoaza from a wholesaler, so that they make profits. María has always worked with her husband. She is going to use this loan to purchase more merchandise. They have been in the community bank for five cycles, and they like how easy it is to get loans, and for the informative meetings. Her dream is to purchase a car to sell their products more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase different types of containers, glasses, etc.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José de 62 años, vive en una zona urbana llamada “Suburbio” caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales. Es zapatero en su propio taller de calzado. 

Aprendió hacer zapatos con la ayuda de su papa desde muy joven, hasta que tubo su familia y pudo comprar maquinas para hacer su propio taller de calzados, poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido distribuir zapatos en distintos almacenes. Trabaja desde muy temprano haciendo sandalias, zapatos casuales y reparándolos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales para hacer mas zapatos como pegamento, correas etc. En el futuro quiere que las sandalias que hace lleguen a ser conocidas y comercializadas por todo el país.
texts.en:
José is 62 years old and lives in an urban area called Suburbio, which is characterized by the fact the majority of the people living there are informal merchants. He is a shoemaker and has his own shoe workshop.

He learned to make shoes as a child with the help of his father and when he had his family, he was able to purchase machines to create his own shoe workshop. With effort, little by little, he has distributed shoes to different stores. He starts work very early making sandals and casual shoes, as well as repairing shoes.

With this loan he wants to purchase shoemaking materials such as glue, straps, etc. In the future he would like for his sandals to become known and sold throughout the country.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shoe straps and glue

loans.name: Nemicia

texts.es: Nemicia tiene 61 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. muy pequeña aprendió a cultivar la tierra, le gustaba ayudar a sus padres en las labores agrícolas. Con el pasar del tiempo, ahora trabaja junto a su esposo, sembrando maíz y papa, actividad que le ayuda en su economía y en la educación D. sus hijos. Manifiesta que le gusta mucho el trabajo, fue lo único que aprendió desD. niña y lo hace muy bien, es así que logró independizarse. Por otro lado se dedica también a la crianza D. ganado vacuno y ovino que, según dice, es un negocio seguro ya que venD. sus animales mensualmente, recibiendo regulares ganancias. Como es una mujer muy empeñosa para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, además D. comprar más cabeza D. reses. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. abono, semillas, así como también contratará mano D. obra para que le ayuD. en la siembra.
texts.en:
Nemicia is 61 years old, and lives with her husband and 3 children in her own home. She grew up learning to farm, and she liked to help her parents with their farming chores. Time passed, and she now works with her husband, growing corn and potatoes, which helps her with finances and her children’s upbringing. She states that she enjoys the work, that it is all she has known since childhood. Because she is good at what she does, she has been able to support herself. She also raises cattle and sheep, which she calls a reliable business. She sells animals each month, generating steady earnings. Because she is highly committed, she plans to grow larger quantities in the future, and also to buy more cattle. This is her third loan with MFP, and she is happy to know that she has financial support. She has always been consistent in making her payments, and she enjoys belonging to her communal bank, because all the members are reliable and support one another. She thanks those who make it possible to have the loan, which will serve her in growing her business. She will use the loan to purchase bags of fertilizer, seeds, and will also hire labor to help her with the planting.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar sacos de abono, semillas y mano de obra para que le ayude en la siembra.

loans.name: Irene Rosario

texts.es: La señora Irene de 46 años de edad convive con el Sr. Antonio hace mas de  24 años tienen cinco hijos los cuales tres son independientes, doña Rosario mas conocida como charito vive en el Barrio Villa Alegre zona los lotes. doña charito trabaja como ambulante hace 22 años vendiendo (toallas para baño, toallas para cocina, pañuelos, medias u otros). El credito que se le otorgo al cliente es para la compra de mercaderia compra de soleras y poleras ya que esta empezando la epoca de calor necesita comprar ropa de temporada,  cliente agradecio infinitamente a la institucion  por la agilidad y la eficiencia que se le atendio.
texts.en:
Irene Rosario is 46 years and she has been living with her partner Antonio for more than 24 years. They have 5 children, 3 of which are independent. Rosario, more well known by her nickname Charito, lives in the Villa Alegre neighborhood in the Los Lotes area. Charito has worked as a traveling saleswoman for 22 years. She sells bathroom towels, kitchen towels, scarves, socks, and other items.

The credit granted to Charito is for the purchase of merchandise – sundresses and T-shirts, because the warm weather is beginning and she needs to purchase seasonal clothing. She is infinitely grateful for the institution for the agility and efficiency with which they attended to her.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sundresses and T-shirts

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria; ella tiene 19 años de edad y es conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos y crianza de animales menores como gallinas, cuyes y cerdos, la socia vende productos como quinua, moraya y trigo en la diferentes ferias que se realizan en la ciudad de Cusco, los animales también los vende en estas ferias y en los mercados, la socia quiere tener un lugar más amplio para la crianza de los animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  animales y  alimentos para los animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the communal bank “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata," which is located in the community of Yuncaypata, which is part of the Cusco province and department. Maria is 19 years old, lives with a partner, and has a 1 year-old son. She alternates her daily activities between 2 businesses: a business selling dry goods, and a business raising small animals such as hens, guinea pigs and pigs. For her first business she sells quinoa, dried potatoes, and wheat in various markets that are held around the city of Cusco. She also sells her animals at these markets. Maria wants to have a bigger place to raise animals. She requests a loan to buy animals and feed for the animals. Maria thanks everyone who makes it possible for her to pursue her dreams through these loans, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy animals and feed for the animals

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Rosendo ; el tiene 42  años de edad y es viudo y tiene 1 hijo, el socio trabaja como maestro de obras de construcción, hace diferentes obras en lugares como Cusco y en Urubamba por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su hijo, el socio quiere tener un terreno de cultivo. El socio solicita el préstamo para  comprar herramientas para su trabajo de maestro de construcción y también para la mantención de su hijo. 

	
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Virgen del Carmen dy Yuncaypata". The bank is located in the community of Yuncaypata, which is in the Cusco province and the department of Cusco. The member is Rosendo. He is 42 years old and is a widower with one son. He works as a construction foreman and works at various locations like Cusco and Urubamba. This work enables him to give the best to his son. He wants to have some land to cultivate. The member is requesting a loan to buy tools for his work as a construction foreman and also to support his son. He is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this loan, and he promises to make his repayments according the the established timetable.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to buy tools for his work as a construction foreman and also to support his son.

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Anacleta; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada  y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos, la socia junto con otras socias venden productos secos en el mercado de Huancaro sección granos secos, ellas se juntan y venden desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener un local para vender los productos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  productos secos al por mayor como quinua, trigo y moraya. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata". The bank is located in the community of Yuncaypata and is in the province of Cusco and Cusco department. The member is Anacleta. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling dried foods. Along with other members of the bank, she sells dried goods at the Huancaro market in the dried grains section. They meet and start selling their goods at 6:00am and work until 5:00pm. She wants to have a store where she can sell dried goods. She is requesting a loan to buy dried goods such as quinoa, wheat, and dried potatoes. She is grateful to everyone who is part of this dream through this loan, and promises to make her repayments according to the established timetable.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dried goods such as quinoa, wheat, and dried potatoes.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo tiene 63 años es viudo y vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Siempre ha estado dedicado a las tareas del campo, sus padres fueron sus principales mentores en esta tarea y toda su vida la consagró a esta labor, es así que día a día se sigue esforzando en todas sus actividades tanto en la siembra, como en la cosecha de maíz, papa, arveja entre otros cultivos más. También se dedica a la crianza de animales, en donde los fines de semana los vende en una feria ganadera cercana a su comunidad. Sus hijos son el principal apoyo en la realización de este trabajo, ya que le ayudan en la cosecha y en la venta de su producción, es así que se siente satisfecho por los logros alcanzados. En lo sucesivo desea continuar adelante con su trabajo. Es su 14avo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para la siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Pablo is a 63 year old widow who lives with his two children in his own home. He has always been a farmer - his parents were his main mentors for this work and he has dedicated his life to this work. Everyday he strives his best in all his farming activities from sowing the seeds to harvesting corn, potatoes, peas, and other crops. He also raises animals and sells them at the weekends at a livestock market close to his community. His children are his main support in all this work as they help him with the harvest and selling his produce, and this makes him feel satisfied with their achievements. For the future, he wants to carry on with his work.
