This is his 14th loan from MFP and he is very happy to know that he has financial support and has already shown himself to be responsible about his repayments. Plus, he likes being part of the community bank because all the members are responsible people and very supportive. He is grateful to the people who manage the loan and it will be very useful to him in continuing his business. He will use the loan he is requesting to buy sacks of fertilizer for sowing potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
María Esperanza es una madre de familia de 59 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y uno de sus hijos en el sector Remigio Silva, una zona urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo. La ciudad es considerada como una ciudad eje del comercio en el norte del Perú debido al gran movimiento comercial y de transporte que existe en la zona, es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la venta de pescado fresco en un puesto ubicado en los exteriores del mercado modelo de la ciudad de Chiclayo (el mercado con mayor afluencia de clientes y con mayor variedad de productos de la ciudad). Ella adquiere su mercadería todos los dias en el terminal pesquero de la región, hacia donde suele dirigirse muy temprano por la mañana, y vende sus productos durante todo el dia. Su esposo se dedica a la misma actividad y juntos trabajan para mantenerse y salir adelante.

Su negocio siempre cuenta con una clientela fija que le otorgan su preferencia gracias a la buena calidad de atención que les brinda. Actualmente desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas pescado fresco para poder aumentar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer bastante entregada a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen la consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
María Esperanza is a 59-year-old mother and lives with her husband and one of her children in Remigio Silva, an urban zone in the area outlying the city of Chiclayo. The city is considered to be the main city for business in northern Peru due to the business and transportation in the area. It is the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She has been working for more than 10 years selling fresh fish at a stand located outside of the Mercado Modelo in the city of Chiclayo. It is the market with the most customers and with the most variety of products in the city. Every day, she gets her merchandise from the regional fish market, where she goes early in the morning and then sells her products throughout the day. Her husband works in the same business and they work together to support themselves and to get ahead.

Her business always has regular customers who prefer her thanks to the good quality of service that she provides to them. She currently wants to expand her business with the purchase of more fresh fish. This way, she can increase her sales and have more income. To achieve her goal, she considered it to be necessary to request a loan of 1000 PEN for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa.

María is a woman who is very dedicated to her family and who always watches out for their well being and development. The people that know her consider her to be a calm and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish to sell at her stand.

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ubaldina; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es madre soltera  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos, la socia junto con otras socias venden productos secos en el mercado de Huancaro  y la socia también se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas y cerdos, la socia quiere tener un lugar para vender los animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  productos secos y alimentos para los animales. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ubaldina belongs to the communal bank “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata," which is located in the community of Yuncaypata, which is part of the Cusco province and department. Ubaldina is 36 years old and is a single mother of 2 children. She alternates her daily activities between her 2 businesses. She sells dry goods along with other members of the bank in the market of Huancaro, and she also raises animals such as hens and pigs. She wants to have a place where she can sell her animals. She is requesting a loan to buy dry goods and feed for the animals. Ubaldina is grateful to the people who are allowing her to pursue her dream through these means, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy dry goods and feed for her animals

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es madre soltera  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de productos secos y otros, la socia junto con otras socias venden productos secos en el mercado de Huancaro. Ella trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener un local para vender los productos secos.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  productos secos como trigo, maíz.moraya y quinua. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Virgen del Carmen de Yuncaypata." The bank is located in the community of Yuncaypata which is in the province of Cusco and Cusco department. The member is Gladys. She is 28 years old and is a single mother who has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling dried goods and other products. Along with other members, she sells dried goods in the Huancaro market. She works from 6:00am until 5:00pm. She is building a good life for her children with this business. She wants to have a store to sell her dried goods. She is requesting a loan to buy dried goods such as wheat, corn, dried potatoes, and quinoa. The member is grateful to everyone who is part of this dream through this loan and promises to make her repayments according to the established timetable.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dried goods like wheat, corn, dried potatoes and quinoa.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es un padre de familia de 43 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Los Pinos del distrito de Pimentel, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada a un lado de la carretera que une los distritos de Pimentel con Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a la agricultura, el siembra varios tipos de verduras en un terreno de cultivo ubicado cerca a su domicilio. Actualmente tiene sembrado camote, cebolla y culantro. Los productos que logra cosechar los ofrece en venta en el mercado mayorista Los Pathos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Sus hijos le ayudan en esta labor que es la unica fuente de ingreso con la que cuentan para salir adelante.

Carmen desea comprar algunos fertilizantes y pesticidas para brindar mantenimiento a los cultivos que tiene instalados, asimismo desea preparar una parte de su terreno para sembrar rábanos. Como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es un padre entregado a su familia y que diariamente se esfuerza al máximo para poder sacarlos adelante. Su mayor anhelo es darle a sus hijos la posibilidad de estudiar una carrera superior que les depare un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Carmen is 43 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Los Pinos neighborhood in the district of Pimentel, an agricultural region located next to the highway that joins the Pimentel and Chiclayo districts. He began working in agriculture when he was young when he planted several kinds of vegetables in a plot close to his home. Today, he plants sweet potatoes, onions, and cilantro. He sells his harvest in the Los Pathos wholesale market in the city of Chiclayo. His children help him with his work because it is their only source of income that they can count on to get ahead. Carmen wants to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to provide maintenance to the crops he has planted. He would also like to prepare part of his land to grow radishes. He doesn't have enough money to do this, so he decided to request a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time. He is a father who is dedicated to his family and every day makes his best effort to bring them up well. His greatest wish is to give his children the opportunity to study for a better career, which will give them a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Eileen Gessner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs of planting and maintaining crops

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta  caracterizado por su ecología en disolución. Su actividad económica es ser vendedora informal en un puesto de la calle de Duran. 

Con la separación de su esposo tubo que mantener a sus hijos muy pequeños. Compro bisutería y implementos de peinar. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm todos los días para poder mantener a su familia. Vende binchas a $ 0.50, aretes a $ 1.00 c/u. 

Quiere continuar con sus ventas ambulantes pero surtiendo mas su mercadería con binchas y aretes.  En el futuro quiere tener su negocio en un local y darle una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Flor is 43 years old and she lives in a suburban region named Duran. This location is known for its diminishing ecology. She is a vendor and she has a stand on the main street in Duran. Following her separation from her husband she was left to support her very young children. She purchased jewelry and hair accessories. Since then she has worked from 8a.m. to 4p.m. every day to support her family. She sells barrettes for $.50 each and earrings for $1 each. She would like to keep up her sales though she wishes to increase her stock of barrettes and earrings. In the future she hopes to have a store for her business and to provide her children with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase earrings and jewelry.

loans.name: Modesto Gilberto

texts.es: Modesto Gilberto tiene 54 años, su actividad es ofrecer los servicios de floristería. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, el inicio por su esposa quien anteriormente se dedicaba a este negocio, fue así que el necesitaba mantener a su familia y proporcionales el alimento diario. Por lo que vive en una zona en donde es transitada por muchos clientes, que le solicitan este servicio. El financiamiento es para la compra de materiales para su negocio como flores, alambres, plásticos, adornos entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Modesto Gilberto is 54 years old and he is a florist. For more than 4 years he has had this business. He started this business because his wife used to work in the same field and he needed to be able to support his family, to give them enough to eat every day. They live in a very well traveled region and there is a great demand for his services. The loan will be used to purchase materials for his business, such as flowers, florist's wire, plastics wrapping, decorations and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Jose Dilmer

texts.es:
José tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el sector Ciudad de Dios del distrito de San José, una zona rural dedicada principalmente a actividades relacionadas con la agricultura y ganadería, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la crianza de ganado vacuno lechero. El cuenta con cuatro vacas de las cuales diariamente extrae la leche que producen para ofrecerla en venta a un acopiador de la zona. El alimenta a sus animales con alimento balanceado y pastos naturales de modo que pueda obtener una buena producción. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personas y apoyar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

José desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de una vaca, de modo que pueda aumentar su producción y pueda percibir mas ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es un joven bastante responsable y entregado a su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como ganadero y poder adquirir ganado de raza que produzca mas leche.
texts.en:
Jose is 22 years old, he is single and he lives with his parents in the Ciudad de Dios district in San Jose. It is a rural region that is primarily agricultural and farm land, belonging to the Lambayeque province, about 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Since he was four years old he has been raising milking cows. Currently he has four milking cows and they are milked every day. The milk they produce is sold to a distributor in the region. He feeds his animals with a well-balanced diet and with natural grasses to ensure he will always have a good yield. The profits he earns from his business are used to cover his personal expenses and to contribute to the family's finances. Jose wishes to expand his business with the purchase of one more cow. He will be able to increase his production and see an improvement in his earnings. To reach his goal he requires a first time loan from Edpyme Alternative (Kiva Field partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. This young man is very responsible and devoted to his work. His greatest dream is to keep improving as a dairy farmer and to one day have a herd of purebred cattle, to produce more milk.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a milking cow.

location.town: Ciudad de Dios - San José - Lambayeque

loans.name: Antonia Magali

texts.es: Antonia Magaly tiene 35 años su actividad es la venta de artesanía. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella tiene 3 hijos menores de edad  de 16, 13 y 11 años respectivamente con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha logrado que estudien. Ella se levanta muy temprano desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, que llega a su vivienda a realizar las tareas del hogar. Este financiamiento es para la compra de más artesanía.
texts.en:
Antonia Magaly is 35 years old and she sells traditional crafts. For more than 15 years he has had this business. She has 3 young children, aged 16, 13, and 11 years old. With great effort she has managed to send them all to school. She starts her days very early in the morning at 7a.m. and works until 8 in the evening. After work she comes home to take care of the household chores. This loan will be used to purchase more crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Livingstone

texts.es:
Livingstone es un padre de familia de 24 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hija de tres años en el sector Ciudad de Dios del distrito de San José, una zona dedicada principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, el distribuye su mercadería al crédito con los vecinos de la zona y luego cobra a domicilio. Adicionalmente trabaja como obrero de construcción civil. Gracias a estas actividades el se hace cargo del mantenimiento de su esposa y de su menor hija.

Livingstone desea adquirir mas prendas de vestir para poder ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ganancias. Para lograr este objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

El es un joven trabajador y que da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su esposa y a su hija, su mayor anhelo es poder terminar de construir su vivienda. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Livingstone is a father, he is 24 years old and he lives together with his wife and their 3-year old daughter. They live in the Ciudad de Dios district in San Jose, a region primarily made of agricultural and farm land. The city is located in the province of Lambayeque, located about 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He sells clothing and he sells his merchandise on credit to his neighbors in the region, payments that he later collects at his customer's homes. He also works as a construction worker. Thanks to these businesses he is able to support his wife and their baby daughter. Livingstone wishes to acquire more clothes to expand his business and increase his profits. In order to reach his goal he requires a first time loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1500 neuvos soles. He is a hardworking young man and he puts the best in him to support his wife and their daughter. His greatest dream is to finish building their home. People know him to be a responsible and calm person.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale business.

location.town: Ciudad de Dios - San José - Lambayeque

loans.name: Polleritas Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “POLLERITAS” está iniciando su segundo ciclo, está en proceso de consolidación. Esta conformada por 8 personas, siete mujeres y un varón. La mesa directiva esta constituida por la presidenta, la tesorera y la secretaria de actas.

La señora Aurelia, al igual que el resto de las socias está en su segundo ciclo y dispuesta a mejorar en relación al primer ciclo.  Además como presidenta tiene el desafío de motivar a su asociación.
El negocio que desarrolla es tejido de chompas, primero aprendió como ayudante en tejidos, desde hace cuatro años tiene su propio negocio.
El primer crédito fue de Bs. 2000.- y lo invirtió en la compra de lana, para este segundo ciclo su solicitud fue de Bs.1000.- para comprar materia prima.  Las ventas son realizadas en la Feria de la zona 16 de Julio, de 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.  Una señora le ayuda con la costura de las chompas.  Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella indica que le gusta ahorrar.

Las otras integrantes de la asociación también tienen sus propios negocios: venta de comida, venta de helados, venta de escobas, tejido de mantas.
texts.en:
The “POLLERITAS” communal bank is starting its second cycle; they are in the consolidation phase. It has 8 members, seven women and one man. The governing board consists of a President, a Treasurer and a Recording Secretary. Aurelia, like the rest of the members, is in her second cycle willing to improve the record of the first cycle. Besides, as President her challenge is to motivate her association. The business she’s in is sweater weaving. She first learned as a weaving assistant but has had her own business now for four years. The first loan was for Bs.2000 and it was used to buy wool. This second loan request is for Bs.1000 to buy raw materials. Sales take place at the 16 de Julio market from 6am until 8pm. She has a woman who helps her with the weaving. When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she indicates that it’s the savings. The other group members have their own businesses: food sales, ice-cream sales, broom sales, blanket weaving.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un padre de familia de 46 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y asus cuatro hijos en el caserío La Raya del distrito de Túcume,una zona conocida a nivel nacional por su atractivo turístico, ya que ella se encuentran ubicadas un conjunto de 26 pirámides cuya fecha de construcción data de civilizaciones anteriores a los Incas. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mas de 25 años, el cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde ha sembrado frijol. El depende de esta actividad para poder sacar adelante a su familia, por ello siempre se esfuerza al maximo para obtener una buena cosecha. Una vez cosechados sus productos ellos vende en su mismo terreno a los negociantes que visitan la zona con frecuencia.

Manuel desea adquirir algunos fertilizantes para poder brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona responsable y bastante entregada a su familia. Ya ha trabajdo anteriormente con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Manuel, 46, lives with his wife and four children in La Raya, Túcume district, an area known nationwide for its tourist attractions: there is a complex of 26 pyramids there that were built before the time of the Incas. It is part of Lambayeque province and located more than forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a farmer for over 25 years. He has a field where he grows beans. He depends on this activity to support his family so he always exerts the maximum effort to obtain a good crop yield. Once his products are harvested he sells them at his own fields to merchants that visit the area frequently. Manuel wants to get some fertilizers for crop maintenance so he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan. He is a responsible person who is quite dedicated to his family. He has collaborated previously with Edpyme Alternativa and was punctual and responsible with his payment obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his bean crops.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer es un padre de familia de 23 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Pátapo, un distrito agrícola situado a  mas de cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chicayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno desde hace mas de cuatro años, el cuenta con cuatro vacas de las cuales extrae diariamente la leche que producen para comercializarla con un acopiador de la zona. Adicionalmente cuenta con una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte) con la cual brinda servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros. Con los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades se encarga de hacerse cargo de los gastos familiares.

Elmer desea aumentar la producción de su ganado adquiriendo alimento balanceado para lo cual ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es un joven padre que dia a dia se esfuerza en su trabajo para sacar adelante a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una persona tranquila y de confianza.
texts.en:
Elmer is a 23 year old father who lives with his wife and two children in Pátapo district, a farming area located more than 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a dairy farmer for over four years. He has four cows that he milks daily to sell the milk to the area milk consolidator. He also has a mototaxi (motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin used to provide transportation services) that he provides cargo and passenger transportation services with. Income from these activities allows him to meet family expenses. Elmer wants to increase milk production by providing his cows with nutritionally balanced feed. He has found it advisable to request a first, 1000 new sol loan, from Edpyme Alternativa. He is a young father who struggles daily in his work to support his family. People who know him hold him in high esteem and consider him to be a levelheaded, trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced feed to increase his dairy cattle’s milk production.

loans.name: Barrio Lindo Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “BARRIO LINDO” está iniciando su primer ciclo en el centro focal de Panamericana. Esta conformada por 8 mujeres que han decidido unirse para solicitar un crédito. 

La asociación “Barrio Lindo” ha elegido a la señora Cecilia como presidenta, ella así como su asociación se ven muy animadas al emprender esta nueva experiencia.
El negocio que desarrolla la señora Cecilia es el de artesanías de acuerdo a la época, comenta que aprendió de una sobrina, desde hace dos años tiene su propio negocio.
Este primer crédito es de Bs. 500.- y piensa invertirlo en material de trabajo.  Para elaborar las artesanìas recibe el apoyo de su familia, es decir su pareja y sus dos hijos.

Las otras integrantes de la asociación también tienen sus propios negocios: venta de comida “rellenos de papa”, tejido en lana de vicuña, costura de enaguas, tejido de mantas, tienda de barrio, artesanìas.
texts.en:
The “BARRIO LINDO” (Lovely Neighborhood) communal bank is starting its first cycle in Panamericana Focal Center. It is composed of 8 women who have decided to unite to request a loan. “Barrio Lindo” has elected Cecilia as President. She, as well as the association, is enthusiastic about starting this new experience. The business that Cecilia is in consists of seasonal crafts. She states that she learned from a niece. She has had her own business for two years. This initial loan is for Bs.500 and she intends to invest it in work materials. Her family, partner and two children, help her make the crafts. The other group members also have their own businesses: sale of “rellenos de papa” (stuffed potatoes), vicuña wool weavings, skirt making, blanket weaving, neighborhood grocery store and crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For various materials, for example: wool.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo es un padre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos menores hijos en el distrito de Jequetepeque, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, especialmente aves de corral, el cría patos, pavos y gallinas en la parte posterior de su domicilio y las alimenta de granos, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona. Esta actividad es la unica que le genera ingresos por lo que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si para mantenerse el rubro.

Arturo desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de alimento balanceado para lograr que sus animales se desarrollen de mejor manera y sean vendidos a mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona bastante responsable y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su familia la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida. En la foto sale con un toro que no es suyo.
texts.en:
Arturo, 31, is a father living with his wife and two minor children in Jequetepeque district, a farming area in Pacasmayo province, La Libertad region, located two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. He raises small farm animals, especially barnyard fowl. He raises ducks, turkeys and chickens in his back yard. He feeds them grains and when they reach a good level of development he sells them to area merchants. This activity is his only source of income so he always gives the best of himself to stay in business. Arturo would like to expand his business buying nutritionally balanced feed so that his animals will develop better and command a higher sales price. To reach this goal he has had the need to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 new soles. He is quite a responsible, hard working person. His greatest wish is to provide his family with the opportunity to have a better quality of life. He is pictured with a bull that does not belong to him.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small farm animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy D. G. is a 43-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing  business. She lives in Prk. Pareno, Brgy. Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1994 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her  fishing  business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Mercy is now borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she  can purchase fishing gear and equipment. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Mercy aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam T. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Pateno, Brgy. Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: general store, fishing and tricycle (motorcycle transport) businesses. Her husband Ronie T., who is 33 years old, works as a driver to earn his living. They have  no children. 

Meriam joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 3 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Meriam has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4500, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 4th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future. 

Meriam T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mrs. Phaok Lorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of twenty-one people located in Putthi Sam village in Takeo province. Mrs. Phaok L., 56 years old, is the village bank president, selected by the other members who will each use their loan for different purposes to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. Phaok L. is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support her famiL.. She has some problems because her field has infertile soil and it is far away fR. the irrigation system. So, to improve production, Mrs. Phaok L. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. With the rest of the loan, she will hire farm laborers. Her husband is a traditional musician. With these businesses, they support four children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are attending school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Voir

texts.en: Mrs. Voir V., 46, is a single mother with a young school-aged daughter. She works caring for kids at an organization located in the middle of Battambang Province. She is concerned that she has to spend money for taxi travel to her workplace and wants to save by borrowing $800 to purchase a motorbike. She is very happy and thankful to those who provided her with financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is from the village of Culpan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old and married with four adult children. To make a living, Conchita   operates a retail sari-sari (variety) store. Conchita is about two years into this business and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Conchita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to be used for her Sari-Sari Store. This will be the third loan taken out by conchita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her retail (sari-sari) store

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara D. P. is from the village of San Francisco, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 56 years old and married with five adult children. To make a living, Barbara owns & operates a business providing motorcycle transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Barbara joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI which was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Barbara is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to increase her working capital. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Barbara from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand the her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Myrna's Group

texts.en:
Myrna G. is from the village of Pagbangkeruan, Alcala, Cagayan. She is 39 and the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Myrna is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living she sells AVON cosmetics in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first taken out by Myrna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Châk

texts.en: Mrs. Châk N. has had a farming business for a long time, planting various crops to earn a living. In addition to her farming work, Châk N. goes with her husband to fish in and around the river. They wake up every morning, drive their boat toward the middle of the river, and then fish. After the fishing is done, they hurry to bring their fish to the market to sell to their regular buyers on credit. This couple has been married for years; they do not have any children. Their fishing tools are worn out so Châk N. is applying for a loan to buy new tools for fishing activities.

loans.use: To buy new tools for fishing activities.

loans.name: Munhzul

texts.en:
Munhzul Z., age 33, lives with her husband and two children in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. She lives in a "ger," the traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, with her family. Both of her children attend a local school. Munhzul has been operating a second-hand products business since 2003, after running a grocery trade business for one year. Her husband helps out with her business. 

Her earnings have enabled her to provide for her family. In the future, she hopes to have her own workplace. She is a very modest and hardworking woman and is requesting a 2,100,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase more variety of second-hand goods at wholesale prices in order to increase her product line.

loans.use: To purchase more variety of second-hand goods

loans.name: Orgilbulag

texts.en:
Orgilbulag B. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a "ger," a traditional nomadic housing tent, in Hovd province in western Mongolia. Her oldest attends a school while youngest child stays at home. Her husband works in construction; in short, he does all kinds of jobs that bring him money to supplement his family's income. 

Orgilbulag currently operates a grocery trading business at a local market. She started her business in 2009 in a rented store in her town. Her store location is in a popular spot that attracts many customers. Her daily income is between 50,000 and 100,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). For the future, she hopes to grow her business and have her own land with a fence for her family. She has good moral character. 

Orgilbulag is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more inventory for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Ma. Guadalupe

texts.en:
Ma. Guadalupe C. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Dakit, Bogo, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a tailoring business.  Her husband Antonio C., who is 46 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are 14 to 23 years old. Ma. Guadalupe joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Guadalupe has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,500, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to purchase additional materials so she can continue to save up for the future for education and the renovation of her house. Ma. Guadalupe C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna C. is from the village of San Francisco, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 32 years old. Myrna is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business selling snacks like fried elbow macaroni in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Myrna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Otgontsetseg

texts.en: Otgontsetseg D., age 38, lives with her husband and two children in their ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent, in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her oldest child currently attends a local primary school, while her youngest is in kindergarten. Her husband currently works and lives in Korea. Otgontsetseg operates a vegetable business in her town. She has been engaged in this business for the past three years and has gained significant experience. She purchases her vegetables from wholesale traders and sells them from a rented stall as a retailer. Her husband also sends her money. She is a hardworking and very energetic person. With her business revenue, she is planning to build a fence around her home. She is requesting a 1,650,000 MNT loan to purchase more vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Mrs. Prum Ngim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-two people make up this village bank loan located in Putthi Sam village in Takeo province. Mrs. Prum N., 40 years old, is the village bank president, selected by the other members who will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Soy Kem, is a rickshaw driver. 

She has a problem because her home is uncomfortable to live in. So, to improve this condition, Mrs. Prum N. is asking for a loan to fix up her own house. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a laborer, and the other is attending school. (The man in the back wearing a baseball cap is not a village bank member.)

loans.use: To fix up her own house

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita S. is a 43-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: food vending and livestock sales. She lives in Brgy. Dakit, Bogo, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 5000 PHP. Nenita is now borrowing 18000 PHP so that she can purchase raw materials for food vending. This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 16000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Nenita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and assure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en: Purevsuren D. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife is employed as a nurse in a local organization, and two of their children attend a local school. Purevsuren makes a variety of wood products and furniture. He started this business in 1995 and has since made quality furnishings for the people of his province. Over his many years in business, he has gained a lot of experience and has a large customer base. Purevsuren also operates a taxi service and repairs cars to supplement his earnings. He is a very modest and business-minded person. He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to buy more wood for making furniture.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen L. is from the village of Salamague Lamut, Ifugao. She is 31 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Ellen owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Ellen has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4,500 PHP when she sells her raised animal.

In 2010, Ellen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ellen is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ellen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma M. is from the village of Siempre Viva Norte. She is 36 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Emma owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Emma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Emma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Mrs. Sovannry Srin Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sovannry S., 24, is a village bank president selected by fourteen members who make up a village bank loan. Each will use their share of the loan for different purposes. They are located in Ta Loung village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sovannry S. and her husband, Mr. Lun Khen, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support their family. She also weaves silk. Her field has a problem because it has infertile soil. So, to improve production, Mrs. Sovannry S. is requesting for a loan to buy fertilizer. She is the mother of one child who is too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa N. is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: fishing and a sari-sari (general store). She lives in Sitio To-ong, Brgy Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing and sari-sari store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 13,000. Teresa is now borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she can purchase fishing materials and more inventory to sell in her general store. This will be her eleventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Teresa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tsolmon

texts.en: Tsolmon N. is a 31-year-old single woman who lives with her mother in Hovd province in western Mongolia. She and her mother live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her mother is retired. Tsolmon sells a variety of woman's clothes out of a stall at the local market. She started her business in 2007 by selling only woman's lingerie and underwear. She has found success in her trade and expanded her product variety and lines. She is a clever businesswoman. She is applying for this 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount of leather boots at wholesale prices from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of leather boots

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma M. is a strong mother who aims to become successful someday by developing her handicraft business. Vilma is thankful to ASHI; through the loans they have provided since 2006, Vilma has been able to maintain her handicraft business. She hopes to further improve her business in the future through hard work and with the continuous assistance of ASHI and its partner, Kiva.

Lack of business capital encouraged Vilma to ask KIVA lenders for financial support. She will be glad to have her loan request granted and will use the loan wisely by purchasing the needed raw materials for her handicrafts. Her hard work and perseverance are the basis for achieving a better life for her family. Her long term goal is to someday have her own booth for her products. Vilma hopes to maintain a long-term sustainable handicraft business.

loans.use: to purchase the needed raw materials for her handicraft business

loans.name: Tumurbaatar

texts.en: Tumurbaatar M. is 54 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Tumurbaatar is the landlord of a coal market which he has been managing since 1998. With these many years of operation, he has gained a lot of business experience and built a successful operation. Tumurbaatar has 30 clients who rent space at his market. His wife operates a coal trading business at his market. His earnings have enabled him to build a house (which is under construction now) at his market. In the future, he plans to build a house for his family from his earnings. Tumurbaatar is a very business-minded hardworking man. He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrik loan to purchase more coal for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more coal

loans.name: Ulambayar

texts.en:
Ulambayar R. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and 1-year-old son in the Zavhan province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband operates a transportation business in his town to supplement his family's income. 

Ulambayar operates a cafe in a rented space of 24 square meters. She provides a variety of meals for her customers. She has been engaged this business for six years and has built a successful operation. She hired two workers and pays them a monthly salary of 108,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) each. Over the years of operation, she has managed to expand her business activities and has gained a positive reputation among her customers. 

Ulambayar is a very open-minded and hardworking person and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan both to decorate her cafe and to buy new electronic equipment for her cafe.

loans.use: To buy new electronic equipment

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en: Uuganbayar O. is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two small daughters in Zavhan province in Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife has recently given birth and stays at home taking care of two daughters. Uuganbayar owns and operates his own shoe repair business. He began his business in 2008 in his home, but has since moved to a rented workspace of 16 square meters which gives him greater access to more customers. Over his years of operation, he has built a stable operation and earned a positive reputation amongst his customers. He pays rent of 15,000 MNT per month. His earnings have enabled him to provide for his entire family. In the future, he hopes to hire one more worker to help with his busy production. Uuganbayar is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to buy more repair supplies and tools for his business.

loans.use: To buy more repair supplies and tools
