loans.name: Mrs. Hin Ouk Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hin O., 31, is the village bank president selected its 16 members from Trapeang Kak village in Takeo province. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Hin O. is a farmer who owns a 1 hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Heab Vorng, is a construction worker. She is the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. She has a problem because her field has infertile soil. So, to improve production, Mrs. Hin O. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she will buy some piglets and pig feed to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Leoncita

texts.en: Leoncita P.'s main source of income comes from providing general alterations and tailoring services in her community. She is 55 years old, married and has five adult children. She is from the village of Villa Verde, Iligan City. Leoncita has been in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Leoncita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Leoncita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan C. is from the village of Malasin, Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 33 years old. Susan is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Susan runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Susan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Susan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Malasin Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Khoun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khoun C., 39, is the group leader, selected by three people from Trapeang Kralaong village in Takeo province.  They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Khoun C. sells brooms door-to-door, earning a large profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Oeurn Dy, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support the family. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Khoun C. wants to expand. So, she is applying for a loan to buy more brooms to sell. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory while the others are studying at school.

loans.use: To buy more brooms to sell

loans.name: Chheang's Group

texts.en:
Twenty four people make up this group located in Slab Ta Aon village, Kandal province. Chheang S., who was born in 1980, is a married woman and was selected as the village bank president.  Each member of the village will use their portion of the loan to support  their various business purposes.

Chheang S. earns her living as a beautician in the local village while her husband, Mr. Sreng Chamroeun, who was born in 1981, works as a construction worker. With B. of their occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support the family. For her beautician business, Chheang S. will use the funding through AMK to buy more beautician supplies to support her business activities. 

This couple has two children, who are seven and four years old.

loans.use: To buy more beautician supplies to support her business activities.

loans.name: Hilaria Sagabaen's Group

texts.en: Hilaria S. is from the village of Culalabat, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 44 years old. Hilaria is the group leader of a 13-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Hilaria is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Hilaria runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Hilaria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Hilaria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hilaria has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Hilaria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Hilaria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Saom Bo Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The eleven people who make up this village bank loan live in Chen village in Takeo province. Mrs. Saom B. is 41 years old, and was selected to be the village bank president by the other members.  Each will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

She and her husband, Mr. P. YoU., are farmers who own a one hectare plot of land on which they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. He is also a motor taxi driver. Her problem is that her field contains infertile soil. So, to improve production, Mrs. Saom B. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and with the rest of the loan she will hire a plowing machine and pay for farming laborers. 

She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a laborer, one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are attending school. The day of the loan disbursement Mrs. Saom B. was busy working in the field. Her husband, Mr. P. YoU., received the loan for her.  In the photo above is Mrs. Saom B.'s husband.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly P. is a 43-year-old married woman who was selected as the leader for this group loan, which consists of four people located in Anlong Ta Sek Kraom village, Kandal province. 

Ly P. and her husband, Mr. Ngy Oeun, who is 44 years old, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate string beans and rice for a living. Beside being farmers, they are also cow middlemen who are able to earn a small income this way to improve their family. For their cow business, Ly P. will use the funding through AMK to add to her savings to buy more cows to sell. 

This couple has four children who are students and who also help support their parent's businesses.

loans.use: To buy more cows to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine M. is from the village of District 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 45 years old. Josephine is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business selling cow's meat in the public market. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet M. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 33 years old. Janet is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Janet owns & operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Janet has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Janet joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby pigs to raise & sell in the future. Janet is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feed & other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Janet from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed & other supplies

loans.name: Pak

texts.en:
Pak Y., is a 47-year-old married woman who lives in Krabau village, Kandal province. Pak Y. earns her living by selling vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Yoeun Y., is 43 years old. He is a construction worker, and he receives a small salary to support his family. 

In addition to these occupations, they are also fishermen, but their fishing boat is broken. Thus, Pak Y. decided to ask for a loan to repair her fishing boat. 

This couple has three children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory and the third attends the local school.

loans.use: To repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Mrs. Soem Savoeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Soem S., 41, is the village bank president, having been selected by the fifteen people in this group loan.  They will use their portion of the loan for various ways to support their families living in Chen village in Takeo province. 

She is a farmer who owns a half hectare plot of land on which she cultivates rice to sell to support her family and she is also a fish seller in the local market where she is able to earn a large profit. She has some problems because her field contains infertile soil. So, to improve production, Mrs. Soem S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and with the rest of the loan she will hire farming laborers. 

Her husband, Mr. Ou Ly, is a recycle seller and a pig breeder. Through these activities, they support four children who are attending school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Teofy

texts.en:
Teofy is from the village of Dullan, Aloran Oroquieta City. She is 45 years old. Teofy is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Teofy  owns  and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. Teofy has been in this business for about six years and earns approximately  3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2004, Teofy  joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teofy  has successfully repaid her previous loan of 12,000 PHP. Teofy  is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used for her sari-sari store. This loan will be Teofy's eighth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template so its Field Partners could continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari

loans.name: Mr. Pich Sam Oeurn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Pich S. O., 38, is the village bank president who was selected by the seventeen people who make up this village bank group. This loan will help the members to improve their businesses which are located in Thnal Bat village in Takeo province. 

He and his wife, Mrs. Thoeun Chhet, are farmers who own a 1.95-hectare plot of land on which they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. He is also a traditional musician who is able to earn some money in this way to support his family. His problem is that his field contains infertile soil, and it has a lot of insects. So, to improve his production of rice, Mr. Pich S. O. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed. 

He is a father of four children, three of whom are attending school, while the youngest one is five years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed

loans.name: Yeth's Group

texts.en:
Yeth S. is a 33-year-old married woman who was selected as the village bank president by the members, located in Lekh Pram village in Kandal province. The members of this village bank will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Yeth S. and her husband, Mr. Soeung Kimsong, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate vegetables, rosemary and herbs for a living. They lack money to support the farm. Thus, Yeth S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to cultivate vegetables, herbs, aromatic plants, basil, etc. This couple has three children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to cultivate vegetables, herbs, aromatic plants, basil, etc.

loans.name: Giovanna Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Giovanna del Rosario S. Z., tiene la edad de 43 años habita en el populoso Barrio Laureles Sur, lugar de conocido record de delincuencia, y escasos recursos de sus habitantes, habita acompañada por su pareja de vida, el cual trabaja como mecánico, tienen dos hijos menores de edad el cual el mayor se dedica  a la los estudios de la secundaria y el pequeño está actualmente en preescolar, pronto la mayor entrara a la universidad para realizar los estudios de su carrera profesional, estos planes son de prioridad para sus padres puesto que desean apoyar a su hija a  forjar su camino profesional, ella vende reposterías, y cosméticos, desde hace mas de 8 años, fue con sus recursos de ahorro que logro comenzar a laborar en esta actividad, ellos habitan en una humilde morada y es para su negocio que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de  materiales de construcción que le admitan reparar el baño principal del hogar, y de esta forma ofrecerle a sus hijos una vivienda digna donde desarrollarse en un ambiente cómodo, salubre y seguro con la finalidad de la tranquilidad de  los padres. 
Este no es el primer ciclo de la señora S., con los diferentes prestamos que se le han otorgado, ha mejorado de manera significativa su hogar, trayéndoles mejores condiciones económicas para todos los miembros de la familia, y es para nosotros un orgullo el ayudar de esta manera a toda una familia de valores responsables y emprendedores.
texts.en:
Giovanna del Rosario S. Z. is 43 years old and lives in the populated neighborhood of Laureles Sur, known for its delinquency record and its peoples’ scarce resources. She lives together with her life partner who works as a mechanic. They have two young children, the older of which is in high school and the younger is in preschool. Their older child will be starting college soon to begin studying for her professional degree. These plans are a priority for them as parents because they want to support their daughter in her career path. She has been selling baked goods and cosmetics for the past 8 years and was able to begin working in the business with her savings.

She lives with her family in a humble home and is requesting the loan for the purchase of construction materials to be able to repair the main bathroom in their house. This way, she will be able to provide her children with a decent home where they can grow in a comfortable, healthy, and safe environment and she and her partner can live calmly.

This is not Ms. S.’s first loan cycle. With the different loans that she has been granted, she has improved her house significantly and brought better economic conditions to all of the family members. We are proud to help an entire responsible and enterprising family in this way.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make repairs to the main bathroom in the house

loans.name: Bibirobiya

texts.ru: Бобоназарова Бибиробия проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 34 года. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж занимается строительными работами по найму. Сама Бибиробия имеет среднее образование. Более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота. Она хочет улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Bibirobiya B. lives in the Yavan region. She is 34 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband does construction work for hire. Bibirobiya has secondary education. She has been doing animal husbandry for more than five years. She feeds and sells cattle. She is taking out the loan to buy large cattle. She wants to improve her family's financial situation.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Закуп крупно - рогатого скота

loans.name: Dy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dy V. is a 62-year-old married woman with three children: one is a teacher, one is a security guard in a private company, and another is a seamstress in a garment factory.

Mrs. Dy V. is the leader of this group loan, having been selected by its four members located in Preaek Samraong village, Kandal province. She stays at home while her husband, Mr. Kheng Chok, is a motorbike taxi driver who is able to earn some income to support the family. But now her husband’s motorcycle is old so she wants to replace it. Thus, she requests a loan to add to her savings to buy a new motorbike to support her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband's business

loans.name: Mrs. Prum Phal Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Prum P., 48, is the village bank president selected by 13 people who make up this village bank located in Thnal Bat village in Takeo province. They will use their loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Prum P. and her husband, Mr. Touch Long, are farmers who own a 0.5 hectare plot of land to cultivate rice for their family's use. She is also a Khmer cake maker, while her husband sells coffee in their village. She has a problem because she does not have enough Khmer cake supplies to use. So, to improve this situation, Mrs. Prum P. is applying for a loan to buy more Khmer cake supplies to use. She is the mother of two children who are both security guards at a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more Khmer cake supplies to use

loans.name: Yessenia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Yessenia del S. C. S., es una joven de 29 años de edad, casada y con un hijo de 3 añitos, ellos viven en un pueblo de la ciudad de Masaya llamado Nindiri, su esposo labora como vendedor, proveyendo un importante sustento económico al hogar, ella labora como cajera de un sucursal de un Banco, de la ciudad, labora en esa identidad desde hace 3 años, ellos han logrado edificar su vivienda con mucho esfuerzo y poco  a poco, dentro de sus planes esta la culminación de las construcciones de sus vivienda y para esto solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que lleven a cabo este objetivo sobre todo que su pequeño ya está creciendo y las condiciones no son las mejores de esta manera se  atenderá  a su salud, bienestar, y protección, con este crédito lograran mejores condiciones que favorezcan a  toda la familia. Sobre todo que es un matrimonio de recién casados que se abren paso a emprender su bienestar economico-social.
texts.en:
Yessenia del S. C. S. is a young woman of 29. She is married and has a 3-year-old child. They live in a village in the metropolitan area of Masaya, called Nindiri. Her husband works as a vendor, providing significant economic support to the household. Yessenia works as a cashier in a bank branch in the city. She has worked at this job for 3 years. She and her husband have succeeded in building the basic frame of a house, with great effort and little by little. Among their plans are finishing the construction of their home, and for this reason they are requesting a loan to buy construction materials to achieve this objective. Above all, their little child is growing up, and their current conditions are not the best. In this way, they will be able to attend to his health, well-being and protection. With this loan, they will achieve better conditions which will benefit the entire family. Above all, this is a recently married couple who are reaching for an opportunity to improve their economic and social well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing the construction of their home

loans.name: Chum's Group

texts.en:
Chum C. is a 44-year-old married woman and the village bank president selected by its 16 members, all living in Daeum Rues village, Kandal Province. The members will use their portion of the loan for various purposes.

Chum C. earns her living by selling Khmer cakes in the local market, using her profits to support her family and save for the future. Since her business is going well, she is requesting a loan to buy more Khmer cake supplies to expand her business activities. Her husband, Mr. Sambath Preap, 45 years old, is a farmer who owns 1.20 hectares upon which he cultivate rice; he also helps in his wife's business activities. This couple has a child who is a student at the local school.

loans.use: To buy more Khmer cake supplies to continue and expand her business activities.

loans.name: Mrs. Bun Yim Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of fifteen people who live in Thnal Bat village in Takeo province. Mrs. Bun Y., born in 1967, is the village bank president selected by the other members who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes. She and her husband are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Mrs. Bun Y. has some problems because her field's soil is infertile. To improve production, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and to rent a plowing machine to plow her field. Mrs. Bun Y. is the mother of five children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory, two are studying in school and one is too small to work or study.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to rent a plowing machine

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en:
Enhbayar D. is 24 years old and lives with his wife and one-year-old son in their own house in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife is currently unemployed and is taking care of their son. Enhbayar has been operating a wheel and tire repair center since 2007 and has found success with his business. With his earnings, he was able to build a car repair center in his yard in 2008. He has built a successful operation within a short period. 

In 2009, he also started a taxi service after purchasing a new car from his earnings. Since starting his business, not only has his business expanded but also his financial situation has improved. Today he has his own car, house, and garage. Enhbayar is a very modest man who says "All I want is to have my own repair service center." He is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase lubricant oils for machinery.

loans.use: To purchase lubricant oils for machinery

loans.name: Sum's Group

texts.en:
This village group loan consists of five people who live in Daeum Rues village in Kandal province. Sum M. was selected as leader of the group loan by the members, who will use their portions of the loan to support their different businesses.

Sum M., a 42-year-old single woman, is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. She faces a problem because she does not have enough money to support her farm. Thus she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to cultivate rice. Sum M. also earns her living by teaching at the local school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to cultivate rice

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Four members living in Samraong village in Takeo Province comprise this group loan, led by 37-year-old Mrs. Sopheap S., the group leader selected by the other members, who will use their portion of the loan for various purposes to improve their living standards.

Sopheap is a chicken seller in the local market, earning sufficiently large profits to support her family. To improve her business, she is seeking a loan to buy more chickens to sell. Her husband, Mr. Rorth Nak Khoem, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which he cultivates rice to sell to help support the family. The couple has three children, two of whom are students in the local village school, while the youngest one is only two years old.

loans.use: To buy chickens to sell

loans.name: Felix Ruben

texts.es: El Señor Felix Ruben M. O., tiene la edad de 35 años habitante del Barrio San Antonio Sur, casado y su esposa labora como conserje, ayudando al gasto mensual en el que se incurre, ellos tienen un hijo de 5 años, que estudia la escuela primaria, él labora como docente, desde hace mas de 16 años, ellos  habitan en una humilde casita puesto que los salarios de los maestros en el país son valorados muy bajos, por tanto no cuentan con los recursos económicos para lograr repara algunas imperfecciones en su hogar, es por esta razón que solicitan un nuevo  préstamo, para edificar un muro en la parte trasera de su vivienda con el propósito de separar el terreno de su vecino con el de él, y en segunda proteger a su familia de la delincuencia que amenaza a la población que habita en el lugar, siendo esta la razón principal de su petición, favoreciendo a futuro el bienestar socioeconómico de todos los miembros de la familia.
texts.en:
Felix Ruben M. O. is 35 years old and lives in the San Antonio South neighborhood. He is married, and his wife works as a maintenance employee, helping with the family's monthly expenses. They have a 5-year-old child who goes to primary school. Felix Ruben has worked as a teacher for more than 16 years. They live in a humble house, since teacher salaries in the country are very low. Thus, they do not have the economic resources to repair some imperfections in their home. For this reason, they are requesting a new loan to build a wall behind their home, with the aim of separating their yard from that of their neighbor, and also to protect the family from the crime that is threatening the population of the area. This is the main reason for their request, which will favor the socioeconomic well-being of all members of the family in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a wall behind his house

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth F. is from the village of Villa Verde, Iligan City. She is 51 years old. Elizabeth is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP so she can purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Elizabeth's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template so field staff can continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villaverde, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica R. is from the village of Hinaplanon, Iligan City. She is 54 years old. Veronica is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Veronica provides pedicure and manicure services to local community members. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Veronica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase materials needed for pedicures and manicures. This loan will be Veronica's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template so field staff can continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for pedicures and manicures

location.town: Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Rita Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Rita Esmeralda M. C., es un joven de 28 años de edad, casada con dos hijos pequeños que se dedican, el mayorcito a estudiar la escuela secundaria y el menor la escuela primaria. Su esposo es albañil y es el principal apoyo económico de la familia, habitan en un humilde Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, con las lluvias del invierno su hogar se ha desmejorado amenazando con el bienestar salubre de la familia, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de  laminas de zinc  para cambiar el techo de su hogar y apoyarles a mejorar las  comodidades con las que actualmente cuentan. 
Como se muestra en la foto ellos son una familia muy humilde y este es su tercer ciclo, ello han sido bien responsables con sus cuotas, y es para nosotros de importancia el poderles ayudar a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rita is a young woman of 28, married with 2 young children to whom she is dedicated. The older one is in secondary school and the younger is in primary school. Her husband is a brick layer and the principal economic provider for the family. They live in a humble development called Reparto Juan Ramon Padilla. Since last winter's rains, their home has deteriorated, threatening the family's health conditions. For this reason, she is soliciting a loan to buy zinc sheeting so they can install a new roof on their home, helping to provide comfort they can count on. As the photo shows, Rita's family is very humble and this is their 3rd loan. They have been very responsible in making payments, and it is important for us to help them improve their conditions of life.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING ZINC SHEETING TO PUT A NEW ROOF ON HER HOUSE

loans.name: John

texts.en: John K. J. is 40 years old, married and has four children between the ages of 1 and 17 years old. His business is located at Bombolulu estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many, many tourist attractions including the Indian Ocean's white beaches. He sells water to the local people. He also provides plumbing services. He has been in business for three years and he says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is the fact that he doesn't have a building where he can carry on his business. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 60,000 to buy a water storage tank and plumbing tools to meet his customer's needs. He hopes to open a hardware store in the future. He also hopes to improve the living standards of his family. He describes himself as customer friendly.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank and plumbing tools.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita N. is from the village of Hinaplanon, Iligan City. She is 39 years old. Angelita is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Angelita owns & operates a business selling clothing & shoe products from a supplier in the local community. Angelita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Angelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Angelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es: El señor Luis Humberto P. N., es un hombre de 45 años de edad, habitante del Reparto Juan Ramon Padilla, es casado y su esposa labora como responsable de una tienda, apoyando con sus ingresos a la economía del hogar, ellos tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad que son independiente y le apoyan a sus padres con una mensualidad para sus gastos, el señor es agricultor desde hace 2 años, comenzó con el apoyo del tío de su esposa quien le hablo de los beneficios de la actividad, decidiendo Don Luis de dedicarse de lleno a esta labor. Problemas de plagas y enfermedades en las tierras han ocasionado disminución en la producción de las cosechas y es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas tales como fertilizantes, fungicidas, insecticidas y abonos que mejoren el mantenimiento y produzcan una mejor cosecha que beneficie las ventas y la economía de la familia, a fin de reinvertir en su negocio o en planes familiares, que ayuden  mejorar las condiciones de vida de su esposa y la de él, como por ejemplo le infraestructura de su hogar que el planteaba que se encontraba en condiciones inhabitadas.
texts.en:
Luis Humberto P. N. is a 45-year-old man who lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood. He is married and his wife is responsible for a store, which helps with the household income. They have five older children who are independent and support their parents with monthly payments for their expenses. Mr. P. N. has been a farmer for the past two years. He started with the help of his wife’s uncle who told him about the benefits of the business. After this, he decided to dedicate himself fully to this line of work. Pest problems and diseases on his lands have caused a decrease in crop production, which is why he is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, fungicides, insecticides and manure. This way, he can improve the maintenance of his crops and have a better harvest that benefits his sales and his family’s economic situation. In reinvesting the earnings in his business or in family plans such as the infrastructure of their house which is in inhabitable condition, it will help to improve the living conditions of him and his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To provide excellent maintenance to his crops

loans.name: Muhamadi

texts.ru: Халимов Мухамади проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно – рогатого скота, то есть он хочет купить два бычка и увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Muhamadi H. lives in the Yavan region. He is 30 years old. He is married and has three children, he has secondary education. He has been doing animal husbandry breeding cattle at home. He mainly feeds and sells cattle. He has been doing this business for twenty years now. He is taking out the loan to buy large cattle, meaning that he wants to buy two calves and increase their number.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Benadette

texts.en:
Benadette N. O. is a married lady with four children between 16 and 21 years old. Her business is located at the Mikindani estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well-known for its many many tourist-attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian ocean white beaches. 

She has been selling such items as rice, flour, oil, detergents, soft drinks, etc., for the last six years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more general items to expand her business. She hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. She also hopes to open other shops in other areas. She describes herself as welcoming.

loans.use: Flour, cooking oil, detergents, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a 34-year-old married man with two children. He operates the Borabora retail shop to earn a living. He has been running the business for 12 years. He has two employees but his wife also helps him in running the business. He wasn't available for the photo but his wife, who was running the business at the time, is in the photo.  

Benard also sells water and rents out houses to earn extra income. He appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping him to buy a house where he is currently staying. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a room in the slums for renting out.

loans.use: To buy a room in the slums

loans.name: Safarmurod

texts.ru: Мавлонов Сафармурод проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 51 год. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Сыновья в Росси на заработках. Сам Сафармурод имеет среднее образование. Более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Он в основном разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Safarmurod M. lives in the Yavan region. He is 51 years old. He is married and has six children. His sons are now working in Russia. He has secondary education and has been doing animal husbandry for more than ten years. He mainly breeds for future resale. He is taking out the loan to buy large cattle to increase their count.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of large cattle

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley is a 45-year-old married man with four children aged 20, 14, 7 and 3. He makes jikos (energy-saving cookers) and metallic suitcases. He has been in the business for 15 years. He has managed to employ one person in his business. He also does farming to supplement his family’s income. He appreciates Faulu Kenya because he can now save his money. He has requested a loan of 56,000 Kenyan shillings to buy metallic sheets. He hopes to have a mega workshop in the future.

loans.use: To buy metallic sheets

loans.name: Charmen's Group

texts.en: Charmen H. is from the village of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is 24 years old. Charmen is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are jointly responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group member if either is delinquent or defaults. Charmen is married and has an infant-aged child. To make a living, Charmen owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling dried fish, bagoong and dry goods. Charmen has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Charmen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charmen is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which she will use to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Charmen from GDMPC. About GDMPC GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expansion.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 32 years old and married with three children in school. She has been operating a grocery shop for five years. She is a member of the Favour Self Help group in Faulu Kenya. She has been guaranteed her first loan by the group.  

With 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she will add stock of vegetables, tomatoes and oranges. She hopes to work hard in her business so as to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: To add stock of vegetables, tomatoes and oranges

loans.name: Rubilee's Group

texts.en:
Rubilee H. is from the village of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is 30 years old. Rubilee is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if either is delinquent or defaults.

Rubilee is married. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes from selling sugar, milk, coffee, noodles and canned goods. Rubilee has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rubilee joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rubilee is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which she will use to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rubilee from GDMPC.

<b>About GDMPC<b>

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For business expansion.

loans.name: Shiringul

texts.ru: Давлатова Ширингул проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 53 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж на заработках в России. Сама Ширингул имеет среднее образование. Более 13 лет занимается торговлей. У нее продуктовый магазин. Сейчас ей приходится много работать, чтобы накормить семью, так как у нее большая семья. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Shiringul D. lives in the Yavan region. She is 53 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband is working in Russia. Shiringul has secondary education. She has been in the retail business for more than thirteen years. She has a grocery store. She has to work a lot right now to be able to feed her family as it is quiet big. She is taking out the loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a farmer in a village in Nairobi West. She has been farming for 10 years. She is a married lady who is blessed with three children. She has managed to educate two of the children and one is still in school.  

As a farmer, she only grows vegetables but she hopes to start rearing cows and goats on her farm. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, her living standards have improved. 

She has requested a 10,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, pesticides and a spraying machine. She hopes to become a large-scale farmer who owns 5 acres of land in the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, pesticides and a spraying machine

loans.name: Wilma's Group

texts.en: Wilma Y. is from the village of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is 42 years old. Wilma is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Wilma is married and has one school-aged child. Wilma owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of her income comes from providing general services to local community members. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Wilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which she will use to purchase tools for her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Wilma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools for her business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie E. lives with her family in the province of Antique in the Philippines. Her husband works long hours as a fisherman to support the family. 

To supply additional income, Annie would like to receive a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase raw materials needed in her fishing business, such as fishing net, and for the maintenance of her fishing boat. With more fish to catch and sell, Annie believes that sales will increase, leading to higher revenue.  

As a dedicated member of Kiva partner ASHI, she ensured strong performance with regular attendance at group meetings and steady repayments. Annie is thankful for access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her business will continue to flourish to improve the family’s quality of life and fund all of her children’s educations until they finish college.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed in her fishing business, such as fishing net, and for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Mirembe Women's Group,nyenje-Mukono

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Robinah M. of the Mirembe Women's Group exemplifies business purposefulness in its essence. On the strength of that attribute, combined with other factors, she has established a dependable niche for her brick sales and poultry business that she has been at the helm of for the last five years in Nyenje-Mukono. 

Robinah is happily married with five kids. In a week, she makes profits that total up to 50,000 shillings and with this loan, she wants to buy more chickens to sell.

loans.use: The purchase of more chickens to sell

loans.name: Zanabayar

texts.en:
Zanabayar N. is 34 years old and lives with her husband and 6-year-old son in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a "ger," the Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent. Her son attends a local elementary school while Zanabayar operates a sewing business in her home by customer order. 

Her husband is a carpenter and makes a variety of wood products in their town. He had been operating a repairing center for wheels and tires between 2007 and 2009. And Natsagdorj, Zanabayar's husband, started his carpentry business in 2009. 

They have used their earnings to provide for their family and to pay the monthly loan principle with interest on time. Zanabayar is a very open-minded and friendly woman, She says, "We want to open our own carpentry workplace and increase more jobs." 

She is requesting a 500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan in order to purchase fabrics and materials for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en: Ponciana P. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 46 years old. Ponciana is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Ponciana raises pigs for breeding. Ponciana has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Ponciana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ponciana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Ponciana is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the second loan taken out by Ponciana from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Arcel

texts.en: Arcel P. is from the village of Canubay, Oroquieta City. She is 34 years old, married with a school-aged child. To make a living, Arcel owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, her main source of income is from providing general services to local community members. Arcel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5500 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Arcel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arcel is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which she will use to purchase equipment to improve her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Arcel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve her business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia F. is from the town of Banga. She is 38 years old. Delia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Delia plants and harvests rice for sale. Delia works hard to improve her business. 

Delia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Delia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Shalimar

texts.en: Shalimar G. is from the village of Mabasa Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old. Shalimar is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Shalimar raises ducks to produce and sell eggs. Shalimar has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,200 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Shalimar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shalimar is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Shalimar from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Mabasa Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Milia

texts.en:
Milia is married and has four children: Joy, Mary, Jackson and Ruth.

Milia has been in the livestock business for six years. He is servicing his first loan with KADET and he has another loan in another MFI (microfinance institution). Milia was introduced to KADET through existing customers.

Milia shall use the loan to add more livestock so as to meet demand. Milia sells livestock to other busy markets. With the extra profits, Milia shall save in a fixed deposit account. Milia hopes to become a big livestock seller.

Milia describe himself as hardworking and enterprising.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Jay

texts.en: Jay J. is from the village of Layawan, Oroquieta City. She is 34 years old. Jay is single and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Jay makes and sells food. While not the only means for generating revenue, her main source of income comes from selling specialty food like home made longanisa, viand and snacks in the local community. Jay has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Jay joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jay has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which she will use to purchase raw ingredients for making her products. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jay from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie F. is from the village of Talic, Oroquieta City. She is 46 years old and married. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling biscuits, candies, toothpaste, shampoo, soap and other dried goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $92 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Rosie is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 5th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Fe's Group

texts.en:
Fe T. is from Barangay 5, Tangub City. She is 37 years old. Fe is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Fe is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of making and selling snacks and ice cream in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $47 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Daisy Antonio's Group
