With her current loan, she is going to bolster her business by stocking up substantially with 2 cases of rainbow wrasse, 1 case of sole, 1 case of sea bass and 1 case of barbel. In the future she would like to have 2 or 3 other stalls and become a businesswoman in this field. With the income that she will generate, she is going to take care of the education of her 3 children and ensure a good standard of living. She is considered a role model in her neighborhood.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rainbow wrasse, sole, sea bass and barbel.

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.en:
Ma. Isabel is a 41 years old and single, and supports her family by operating three business ventures: a general store, E-loader and food vending businesses. She lives in Purok Burgos, Brgy. 4, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000, and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, mobile phone credit electronic loading and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,000. 

Ma. Isabel is now borrowing PHP 16,000 so that she  could  purchase more merchandise to sell. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 16,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Isabel aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
Mirtha es socia del Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun que significa Ayudémonos en Quechua.
Mirtha es conviviente, tiene 6 hijos estudiantes, Mirtha vende golosinas variadas en el parque central de la ciudad de Huamanga y también viaja a las fiestas patronales de los diferentes pueblos en donde vende sus productos, también vende canchas que ella misma prepara. Además Mirtha se dedica a la compra de chatarra de diferentes pueblos para lo cual cuenta con un carro, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo.
Mirtha necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles para la compra de maíz, aceite, bolsas.
Mirtha sueña con tener un local propio, un negocio estable y dedicarse a la crianza de cuy.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a member of the Yanapanakusun communal bank. In Quechua, ‘yanapanakusun’ means ‘let’s help each other’.

Mirtha has a live-in partner and has 6 children. She sells various candies in the central park of the city of Huamanga, as well as popcorn that she makes herself. She travels to the patron saint day festivities in different towns where she sells her products. In addition, Mirtha also purchases scrap with her husband from different towns and uses a car to do so.

Mirtha needs a loan of 3000 PEN for the purchase of corn, oil, and bags. Her dreams are to have her own space to sell, a stable business, and to work raising guinea pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, oil, and bags.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia Z. is a widow who lives in Hillside, Brgy. Nabulao, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: general store, ticketing outlet for Negros Navigation and mobile phone credit electronic loading businesses. 

Eufemia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006, because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Eufemia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her increase her monthly profit to PHP 20,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her tenth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,000, which she intends to use to pay for more merchandise for her general store (e.g., soft drinks, groceries and e-load) so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her general store store and send her children to college. 

Eufemia Z. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the purchase of sewing materials

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun que significa Ayudémonos en Quechua.
Vilma es soltera y tiene 1 hija estudiante, Vilma tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, negocio que inicio hace 2 años, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de arroz, azúcar y fideos.
Los sueños de Vilma son tener una tienda grande y surtida.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Yanapanakusun communal bank. In Quechua, ‘yanapanakusun’ means ‘let’s help each other’.

Vilma is single and has a daughter who is a student. She has a store in her parents’ house which she opened 2 years ago where she works every day selling general groceries, vegetables, and meats.

Vilma needs a loan of 1000 PEN for the purchase of rice, sugar, and pasta. Vilma’s dream is to have a large, well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar, and pasta.

loans.name: Joena

texts.en:
Joena T. is a 47-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: food vending, fishing and pig fattening. She lives in Sitio Paho, Brgy. Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. She will use her loan as additional working capital for her food-vending business and to purchase a new fishing net. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 24,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Joena aspires to improve her family's living conditions and ensure its future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva and joining our team.

loans.use: As additional working capital and to purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
Celestino es casada y tiene 4 hijos estudiantes, Celestino tiene una carpintería en un local alquilado, negocio que inicio hace 10 años, Celestino atiende pedidos y tiene 2 personas que le ayudan.
Celestino es socio del Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun que significa Ayudémonos en Quechua y solicita un crédito de 1500 soles para la compra de clavos, pegamento y pintura.
Los sueños de Celestino son ampliar su negocio, tener un taller grande con maquinaria moderna.
texts.en:
Celestino is married and has 4 children who are students. He has a carpenter’s workshop in a rented space. He began the business 10 years ago. He takes requests and has 2 people that help him.

Celestino is a member of the Yanapanakusun communal bank. In Quechua, “yanapanakusun” means “let’s help each other.” He is requesting a 1500 PEN loan for the purchase of hammer, glue, and paint. Celestino’s dreams are to expand his business and to have a large workshop with modern machinery.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hammers, glue, and paint.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia Gracia R. es una mujer joven dedicada a la confección de blusas, ella ha trabajado en este oficio desde hace mucho tiempo, cuando en un principio solo contaba con  una máquina sencilla, mucho esfuerzo y el apoyo de su familia. Gradualmente logró adquirir su maquina plana y su fileteadora y así ha ido creciendo hasta lograr tener una infraestructura de taller que le genere utilidades, con la cual adquirir todo lo necesario para el sustento de sus 3 hijos de 4 meses, 7 y 9 años, por eso su sueño está en conseguir el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su taller para tener un futuro con mayor bienestar familiar y mejores oportunidades.

Con su credikiva que es el primero, comprará una  máquina collarín y una fileteadora, con ellas logrará mejorar la calidad, y los tiempos de producción además de disminuir los costos del proceso pues alquila estos servicios y debe pagar transporte para obtenerlos. En la actualidad su mayor desafío es responder a la producción que cada dia crece ,pues no tiene las maquinarias que ello le amerita y también el tiempo necesario para dedicarle a sus pequeños hijos, pero ella sabe que esta construyendo su futuro familiar  y justamente por eso trabaja fuertemente.
texts.en:
Alicia Gracia R. is a young woman whose work is making blouses. She has worked in this business for a long time. At the beginning she had only a simple sewing machine, a lot of energy, and the support of her family. Gradually she managed to acquire her flat-bed sewing machine and her serger, and thus she has continued growing her business until she had a workshop infrastructure that produced profits, with which she can acquire everything necessary to support her three children, of ages 4 months, 7, and 9. For this reason, her dream is to grow and strengthen her workshop in order to have a future with better well-being and more opportunities for her family. With her Kiva loan, which is her first, she will buy a collar machine and a serger. With them she will be able to improve the quality and time in production, in addition to decreasing the cost of production, since she hires these services and has to pay transportation to obtain them. Now her greatest challenge is keeping up with production, which grows every day, since she does not have the machines that her work requires or the time that she needs to dedicate to her little children. But she knows that she is building the family future, and this is precisely why she works hard.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a collar machine and a serger

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Madres Trabajadoras”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Saturnina; ella tiene 57 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de confección de ropa, ella es costurera, ella cose diferentes ropas como pantalones y blusas, su esposo trabaja como empleado de electro sur este, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio de costurera y comprar máquina de coser nueva.La socia solicita el préstamo para ampliar el taller de costura para comprar materiales de construcción.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Saturnina is a member of the Communal Bank “Madres Trabajadoras” (Working Mothers), which is located in the District of Santiago, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 57 years old, married, and has three children. Sra. Saturnina divides her time between her daily activities and her business making clothes. She is a seamstress by profession and sews different types of garments such as trousers and blouses. Her husband works as an employee of the electric utility in the southeast. Saturnina wants to expand her sewing business and buy a new sewing machine. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy construction materials to expand her sewing workshop.

Saturnina is grateful to those who made her dream come true and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to expand her sewing workshop

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A. is a widow who lives in Prk. Esmeralda, Brgy. Talacagay, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by fishing and selling fish. 

Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Erlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 7th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 11500, to use to pay for more  fingerlings to stock in her ponds so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of her business and buy a new motor boat. Erlinda A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund Operations

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 40 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos quienes son su motivo de adoración. El trabajo al que se dedica Nelly, es la venta de productos de primera necesidad, en su bodega que tiene instalada en un espacio dentro de su casa. Cuando empezó con el comercio, se inició vendiendo medicamentos genéricos, pero lamentablemente no le fue nada bien, ya que aparecieron la grandes cadenas farmacéuticas. Desde entonces se vio en la necesidad de cambiar de rubro, es ahí cuando vende productos de primera necesidad, que hoy en día continua con la venta y le va muy bien, ya han transcurrido 20 años en esta labor y mantiene el mismo carisma y ganas de atender a su clientela, procurando además que su bodega esté más surtida. Para en el futuro, planea diversificar su negocio, con la instalación de un bazar – Librería. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP, y sabe que de tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta dispuesta hacerlo. Se siente contenta de pertenecer a su grupo comunal, porque las integrantes son muy responsables y honestas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará arroz, azúcar, productos lácteos y sobre todo cerveza, ya que en la cerveza capta mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 40, is a hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and her three children who she adores. Nelly sells basic necessities from a store that is established in a designated space in her house. When she first started her business, Nelly sold generic medicines but did not do very well because she had to compete with the large pharmacy chains. Seeing the need to switch to another field, she began selling basic necessities and continues to do so today. Nelly has been in business now for 20 years and has done very well. She continues to possess a charismatic personality and the desire to serve her customers. In addition, she is always mindful of keeping her store well-stocked. Later on, Nelly wants to diversify her business by adding a bazaar and a bookstore.

This is her twelfth loan with MFP. Nelly knows that she must submit her payments on time and is willing to do so. She is pleased to be part of her Communal Bank because the members are responsible and honest. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, dairy products, and beer so that she can generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, dairy products, and beer

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel C. is a 24-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Sitio Calumpang, Brgy. Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She earns an average monthly income of 6000. Maricel is now borrowing PHP 19000 so that she can purchase more goods to sell. This will be her 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Maricel aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Reyna Del Cielo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Reyna del Cielo lo conforman  cuatro personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Jordan David M.  de 23 años quien se dedica a prestar dinero a otras personas las cuales no pueden acceder a créditos el inicio este negocio hace tres años. 

Los otros integrantes son Delfina del Carmen P. Ramírez comerciante de ropa desde hace 8 años en el M. Oriental, Daniel Antonio Calera  Ruiz  acarreador de arena e invertirá el crédito en ropa para tener más variedad de ingresos y José Gerardo Alegría quien acarrea arena y con el préstamo comprara un caballo.
texts.en:
The group Reyna del Cielo is made up of 4 hard-working people. One of them is 23-year-old Jordan David M.. For a living, he loans money to people who don't have access to loans. He started this business three years ago. The other members are Delfina del Carmen P. Ramírez, who has been selling clothing in the market for 8 years; Daniel Antonio Calera Ruiz, who works as a sand hauler and will buy clothing with the loan to diversify his income; and José Gerardo Alegría, who is also a sand hauler and will use the loan to buy a horse.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To loan and also to buy clothing and a horse

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
José de 31 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral rodeada del estero salado de Guayaquil. tiene un pequeño local de venta de accesorios telefónicos. 

Hace algunos años el tuvo problemas con su familia por su conducta pero por la buena dirección de su esposa pudo remediar sus errores y obtener un pequeño capital para tener su propio negocio. Compro accesorios de celulares y empezó a venderlos desde ese tiempo hasta la actualidad el tiene ya su local, trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días con ayuda de un joven. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar celulares para tenerlos a la venta de los clientes. En el futuro quiere tener su casa propia y construir un local en su casa para tener cerca de su familia y pasar mas tiempo.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old. He lives on the outskirts of Guayquil along the Perimetral highway, which is surrounded by a salt marsh. He has a small store where he sells telephone accessories. Some years ago he had problems with his family because of his behavior, but with the right guidance from his wife he was able to correct his mistakes and obtain a small amount of capital to open his own business. He bought cell phone accessories and has been selling them ever since. He works from 9:00 am until 6:00 pm everyday with the help of a young worker. With the loan he will buy cell phones to sell to his customers. In the future, he would like to have his own house and to build a store in his house in order to be closer to his family and to be able to spend more time with them.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cell phones

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Madres Trabajadoras”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elsa; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de comida en el paradero llamado Sr de Cabildo, ella vende comida desde las 12:00 p.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, su esposo es obrero realiza diferentes obras de construcción en la ciudad de Cusco, la socia quiere tener un restaurant donde pueda preparar las comidas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar y también para comprarse una cocina nueva.  
 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Communal Bank “Madres Trabajadoras” (Working Mothers), which is located in the District of Santiago, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 51 years old, married, and has four children. Elsa divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling food at the Señor de Cabildo bus stop. She sells food between noon and 10pm. Her husband is in construction and works at different sites throughout the city of Cusco. Elsa wants to open a restaurant where she can prepare her meals. The loan she is requesting will be used to acquire ingredients for cooking and to purchase a new stove.

Elsa is grateful to those who made her dream come true and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for cooking & a new stove

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Madres Trabajadoras”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Luis; el tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el socio trabaja como taxista, el hace servicio de taxi en un carro alquilado, el trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, su esposa es comerciante, ella vende ropa para niños y adultos y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere tener su carro propio. El socio solicita el préstamo para el arreglo del carro y también para la mantención de su casa.
	

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Luis is a member of the Communal Bank “Madres Trabajadoras” (Working Mothers), which is located in the District of Santiago, Province and Department of Cusco.

He is 29 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Sr. Luis works as a taxi driver and provides his services using a rented car. He works from 5am to 8pm. His wife is a merchant who sells clothing for children and adults. They work as a team so that their children can get ahead. Luis wants to have his own vehicle. The loan he is requesting will be used make repairs to the vehicle he has now and to maintain his house.

Luis is grateful to those who made his dream come true and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs & maintenance of his house

loans.name: Noel Nestor

texts.fr:
Jeune monsieur de 48 ans, marie et pere de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 et 21 ans,il commence ce commerce en 2002 quand il perd son travail lors de la faillite de lusine ou il travaillait.

Pour pallier a cela et prendre en charge la vie de sa famille il se lance dans la quincaillerie .
Il a plusieurs strategies de vente, ses clients sont les entrepreneurs, les fonctionnaires qui sont entrain de construire des maisons.
En moyenne il vend environ 5000 a 50.000frs par jours
Avec le pret qu'il compte recevoir, il va renforcer en achetant des interrupteurs, des fusibles, des sanitaires,des robinets, des ^pointes de toute taille..
A l'avenir il pense se lancer dans la vente en gros et avec ses economies , epargner beaucoup pour pouvoir ouvrir un grand magasin , voyager aller acheter de la marchandise au Cameroun, Nigeria et Dubai 
Tres serieux, il pense aussi a envoyer ses enfants dans des grandes ecoles pour leur formation.
texts.en:
This young gentleman, aged 48, is married and a father with four children, whose are from 5 to 21 years old. He started this business in 2002 when he lost his job, as the factory in which he worked had failed. To alleviate the situation and to support his family, he embarked on a hardware business. He has several sales strategies. His customer base includes entrepreneurs and civil servants who are building houses. On average, he has sales of about 5,000 to 50,000 francs a day. With the loan that he plans on receiving, he is going to stock up by buying electrical switches, fuses, sanitary items, faucets, and nails of any size. In the future, he is thinking of selling in bulk. And with his savings, he thinks he will save a lot of money, open a big store, and go buy merchandise in Cameroon, Nigeria, and Dubai. A very serious man, he is also thinking about sending his children to major schools for their training.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying equipment and supplies for electricity, construction, plumbing, sanitation

loans.name: Lynnie Marie

texts.en:
Lynnie Marie G. is from the town of Banga. She is 33 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Lynnie Marie owns a business raising rice. She has been farming for over nine years and she also grows pigs for fattening.

Lynnie Marie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies including livestock feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business and supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Romulo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Madres Trabajadoras”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Rómulo; el tiene 35 años de edad y es casado y tiene 1 hijo; el socio trabaja como transportista, el es propietario de una combi que hace servicio público de la ruta llamado León de San jerónimo, el socio trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, su esposa trabaja vendiendo verduras y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere arreglar su carro. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para su carro. 
	

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rómulo is a member of the Communal Bank “Madres Trabajadoras” (Working Mothers), which is located in the District of Santiago, Province and Department of Cusco.

He is 35 years old, married, and has one child. Sr. Rómulo works in the transportation business. He owns a minibus that he drives along the public service route called León de San Jerónimo. Rómulo works from 5am to 7pm. His wife sells vegetables and they work together as a team so that their children can get ahead. Rómulo wants to make repairs to his vehicle. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy spare parts for his minibus.

Rómulo is grateful to those who made his dream come true and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, es una madre de familia muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos a quienes desea brindarles la mejor educación. Su trabajo de Gladys es el servicio de maquillaje y peluquería, para ello cuenta con un salón de belleza, en donde todos los días, realiza corte, tintes, permanentes y reacondicionamiento de cabellos de sus clientes. En horas de la tarde su establecimiento es el más concurrido y más aun cuando son fechas festivas o de celebraciones. Es así que atiende hasta altas horas de la noche, realizando peinados y maquillajes, siendo esta actividad muy gratificante para ella, le gusta mucho su labor por que le es muy rentable y tranquilamente puede pagar el alquiler del local. Lleva 20 años de trabajo y en todo este tiempo ha logrado el reconocimiento de sus clientes, es por ello que para el futuro planea trasladar su local en un espacio más amplio e instalar un bazar donde pueda vender productos de belleza y bisutería. Es su doceavo crédito con MFP y se compromete pagar puntualmente como lo venia haciendo. Se siente feliz de integrar este grupo comunal; por lo responsables que son. Con el crédito que solicita, renovará algunos accesorios de su salón de belleza y comprará una computadora, para que su hija, quien estudia en  la universidad.
texts.en:
Gladys is a kind and hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and her three children for whom she wants to provide the best education. Gladys has her own beauty salon where she provides makeup and styling services. There she works every day providing haircuts, coloring, perms, and hair conditioning to her customers. Her establishment is busiest in the afternoons, especially during the holiday festivities and celebrations. She provides her services to her customers until the late hours of the evening since it gives her great satisfaction. Gladys enjoys her work because it is both profitable and peaceful. In addition, it helps pay the rent for her salon. Gladys has been working for 20 years, and during this time, she has become well-known among her customers. In the future, she plans to expand her business by adding more space in order to open a bazaar where she can sell beauty products and trinkets.

This is her twelfth loan with MFP and she promises to complete her payments on time like she always has. Gladys is pleased to be part of her Communal Bank because everyone is responsible. The loan she is requesting will be used to replace of the accessories in her salon and to purchase a computer for her daughter who is studying at the university.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the equipment in her salon & purchase a computer for her daughter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials needed for the production of decorations

loans.name: Ganesh Maya

texts.en:
Ganesh Maya R. is 46 and married with one child, aged 21. In 2005, she established her general store business. Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she supoorts her family. With this loan from Patan BPW she wants to add kitchenware to her inventory. In the future, Ganesh Maya plans to expand the business.  She thanks you for your support.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: buying kitchen ware for general store

loans.name: Emma  Judith

texts.fr:
Femme de 41ans celibataire et mère de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie de 7ans à 20ans et ayant 5 personnes en charges.Elle débute son commerce de vente en gros et detail de banane plantin en 1990 avec un capital de 31000frs. 
ses recettes journalières varie entre  50000 et 85000,elle s'approvisionne sur les marchés auprès des camions et à la gare ferrovière. 

Avec ce prêt elle va renforcer son commerce en achatant plius des regimes de banane et ouvrir 1 ou 2 coins de ventes afin de generer plus de benefices.
Pour satisfaire ses clients, elle fait frire des bananes et evite de perte.
Quand elle aura plus de revenues, elle va efrfectuée des déplacements à l'interieur  du pays pour se ravitailler.
 elle veut améliorer ses conditins de vie en achetant une parcelle et encourager ses enfants à poursuivre  leurs études.dans son quartier, elle est comptée parmis les femme ambitieuse.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a 41-year old woman, single and the mother of three children from 7 to 20 years of age, with five people to provide for. She launched her business selling plantains retail and wholesale back in 1990, with a starting capital of 31,000 Francs. Her daily sales range between 50,000 and 85,000; she stocks up at the market near the truck stop and the railroad station. With this loan, she would like to strengthen her business i by purchasing more bunches of plantains and opening an additional sales location or two in order to increase her profit. To meet her customers’ needs, she also fries plantains, avoiding loss due to spoilage. When she has higher income, she is going to travel inside the country in order to stock up. She would like to improve her life conditions by purchasing a land plot and encouraging her children to continue with their studies. In her neighborhood, she is known as a goal-oriented person.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing plantains

loans.name: Virginia Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Virginia es una de muchas mujeres con deseo de lograr un techo digno, siendo su familia de dos hijos y su esposo labora como mecánico.
Hoy en día se dedica al comercio de venta de chatarra, comenzando con poco y con ayuda de su esposo.
Atreves de los préstamo ha hecho mejoras en la compra de madera para mejorar su casa, un cuarto que logro hacer, pero ahora es de urgencia poder votar toda la casa de madera vieja ya que debido a los torrentes de agua en la capital, se ha aflojado toda. 
Lo que atreves de Afodenic espera levantarla de concreto y así poder tener una casa signa y con mayor seguridad.
Comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, laminas de zin, y poder comenzar hacer su nueva casa.
texts.en:
Virginia is one of many women with a desire to achieve a decent home. Her husband works as a mechanic, and they have two children. She now works in the business of selling scrap iron, which she began with very little but with the help of her husband. Through the loans she has been able to buy wood to make improvements in her home. She has succeeded in building one room, but now it is urgent to be able to replace all the old wood in the house, since it has all loosened up due to the rainstorms in the capital. Through Afodenic, she hopes to build it of concrete and thus be able to have a decent house with better security. She will buy stone, sand, cement, iron, and sheets of zinc to begin building her new house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stone, sand, cement, iron, and sheets of zinc to begin building her new house.

loans.name: Lalita

texts.en:
Lalita N. is 48 and married with two young children. In 1995, she established a tailoring business. Working 6 days a week and 7 hours a day, she supoorts her family. She wants to use this loan from Patan BPW  to buy more materials for tailoring In the future, Lalita plans to expand the business.  She thanks you for your support. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: buy materials for tailoring

loans.name: Renaldy German

texts.es: Renaldy Germán tiene 28 años, su actividad es la venta de repuestos de computadora y un taller de computación. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio es que ha logrado progresar tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo, el es un padre responsable que le enseña pues todos los días tiene que buscar la forma de ganarse la vida de la manera más humilde. Este crédito que solicita es para la compra de exhibidores y además comprar computadoras y alguno repuestos necesarios. El sueña con agrandar su local y además proporcionarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Renaldy Germán is 28 years old. He sells computer replacement parts and works in a computer shop. He has had this business for over five years. He has managed to progress because of his great effort and sacrifice. He has one minor child under his care. He is a responsible father who teaches his child that everyday he has to look for a way to earn a living in the most humble way. The loan he is requesting is to buy display cases, computers, and some needed replacement parts. His dream is to expand his place and to give his family a good quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cecilia Del Rocio

texts.es:
Cecilia de 23 años, vive en una zona periurbana con caminos de tierra llamada “Fortín”. vende ropa por catalogo a sus conocidos para poder mantener a sus hijos.  

Comenzó a vender ropa de una revista hace años con sus pocos ahorros y comenzó a venderlas a sus amigas y conocidos, repartiendo y promocionando la ropa por catalogo desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm todos los días y con algunas ganancias que ha obtenido compro víveres para una pequeña tienda. 

Para mejorar sus ventas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y víveres como arroz, aceites y azúcar. En el futuro quiere tener su propio minimarket.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 23 years old and lives Fortin, a periurban area that has dirt roads. She sells clothing through a catalog to her acquaintances in order to support her children. With her small savings she began selling clothing from a catalog several years ago and started by selling to her friends and acquaintances. She distributes and promotes the clothing from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. everyday and with some of the profits she bought groceries for a small store. Cecilia wants to buy clothing and groceries such as rice, cooking oils and sugar in order to improve her sales. In the future she hopes to have her own mini market.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, cooking oils and sugar.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una señora de edad muy avanzada, pero con mucha ganas de trabajar, se ha esforzado para salir adelante con su familia ya que son de pocos recursos económicos. 
Hoy en día se dedica a la venta de leña, maíz, frijoles, el cual ella misma esta cultivando en unas manzanas de tierra. Un hijo está con ella y su  esposo que trabaja como cadete de taxi. Lo que ambos se apoyan para lograr mejores ganancias
Para ella ha sido difícil ya que ha trabajado muy duro en acarreo de sus ventas. Atreves de los prestamos ha logrado las mejoras en su pequeña casa, son catorce créditos que Afodenic ha dado por su buen comportamiento de pago el cual ha logrado pagar en tiempo y forma ya que se ha beneficiado para lograr su objetivo.
Con este financiamiento comprara leña, maíz y abonos y venenos ya que cultivara maíz para seguir aumentando sus ventas y lograr mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana is an older woman but has a lot of desire to work. She has put in a lot of effort to get her family ahead since they have few economic resources.

Now she works selling firewood, corn, and beans, which she grows herself on a few ‘manzanas’ of land (1 manzana is equal to approximately 7000 square meters in Nicaragua). One son is with her and her husband works as a taxi driver. They both support one another to better their income.

It has been difficult for Juana since she has worked very hard in carrying her goods. Through the loans, she has been able to make improvements to her small home. AFODENIC has provided her with 14 loans to help achieve her goal due to her satisfactory loan repayment which she achieved by paying on time.

With this loan she will purchase firewood, corn, manure and insecticide to grow corn and continue increasing her sales and improving her income.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, fertilizer, insecticide and firewood for growing corn

loans.name: Rami

texts.en: Rami is a 31-year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and child. Rami has worked in construction, specifically with cement, since 1993. Rami's experience is his best investment as he is excellent in his work. This is Rami's second loan with Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, and he has a good repayment history. His last loan helped him to change the pick-up that he uses for his work to a better one that improved his business. This time Rami is requesting a loan in order to buy wood for his work and also for his personal use in the winter season. Rami hopes to expand his work in the future by opening a big cement factory.

loans.use: To buy wood necessary to his work

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es: La señora María Martha tiene 35 años, ella es casada,  y tiene dos hijos de 7 y 11 años respectivamente. Maria se tiene su pulpería, cabe señalar tiene cinco años de tener este negocio y también posee una clientela ya establecida en el municipio. La mayoría de sus ventas son al contado, sin embargo también realiza ventas a crédito. Este negocio nació por la necesidad de incrementar los ingresos familiares, para mejorar económicamente. Ella desea invertir este crédito en la compra de golosinas, refrescos, detergentes y granos básicos. El préstamo mejorara sus ganancias. Su sueño es tener un minisúper para generar más ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en:
María Martha is 35 years old, and she is married. She has two children, ages 7 and 11. María has a grocery store. It is worth noting that she has had this business for five years. She also has established customers in the municipality. Most of her sales are for cash, but she also makes sales on credit. This business was born from the need to increase the family income in order to improve financially. She wishes to use the loan to buy sweets, soft drinks, detergents, and basic grains. The loan will improve her earnings. Her dream is to have a mini-supermarket in order to generate more income for her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de dos hijos, muy dedicada para lograr ayudar a su familia, junto a su esposo trabajan en zona franca siendo asistente de plancha.
Y ella operaria. Se trabaja mucho aunque el  salario sea bajo se esfuerzan para equilibrar los gastos.
Con ahorros y el primer financiamiento lograron cerrar su casa en mejores condiciones. 
Hoy en día con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de materiales de  construcción para terminar de cerrar el cuarto y comenzar la construcción del baño ya que aun no tiene la seguridad y privacidad para esta higiene necesaria de cada día. Comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, tubos de agua, para comenzar hacer la obra. Lo que está contenta,  por esta mejora que beneficiara a la familia en gran manera.
texts.en:
Rosa is the mother of two children. She is very dedicated to helping her family. She works along with her husband at the free trade zone. He is an ironing assistant and she is an operator. They work very hard and although their salary is low, they strive to balance their costs. With their savings and their first loan they were able to better wall off their house. With the current loan they will invest in the purchase of construction materials to finish the room walls and start building the bathroom. They still don't have the safety and privacy for their necessary daily hygiene. She will purchase stone, sand, cement, iron and water pipes to start construction. She is happy because this improvement will greatly help the whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stone, sand, cement, iron, water pipes to start construction.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Madres Trabajadoras”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teodora; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de comida y venta de refrescos como agua de manzana en forma ambulatoria, ella trabaja desde las 1:00 p.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, ella prepara todo tipo de comida, su esposo trabaja como chofer de una empresa que hace servicio público, la socia quiere tener un local donde pueda vender la comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, carne y huevos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Madres Trabajadoras” communal bank. The bank is located in the Santiago district, which belongs to the province and department of Cuzco. The member is named Teodora. She is 36 years old and is in a common law marriage. She alternates her activities between her daily activities and her street vendor business selling food and beverages, such as apple juice. She works from 1:00 p.m. until 8 :00 p.m. She makes all kinds of food. Her husband works as a driver for a public service company. She wants to have a locale where she can sell her food. She is asking for the loan to buy products to cook, such as rice, meat and eggs. . The member is grateful to the people who are a part of this dream in this way, and she is committed to making the payments according to the establishes schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy products to cook such as rice, meat and eggs.

loans.name: Herlin Santana

texts.es:
Don Herlin es un hombre trabajador, dedicado a su familia, casado siendo su esposa ejecutiva de ventas. Gracias al apoyo de ella han logrado hacer su casa.
Su trabajo  es de tipógrafo el cual lleva varios años en el oficio, y está contento por lograr el objetivo de mejorar cada día. Siendo Afodenic la puerta a la mejora de vivienda en su familia.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo podrá terminar de cerrar un muro en la parte de atrás de su solar, el cual está bastante avanzado y que espera terminar, lo que le dará satisfacción ya que podrá tener un poco mas de seguridad contra los delincuente del barrio.
Para esto comprara: piedra, trescientos bloques, veinte bolsas de cemento, hierro, arena, piedrín, clavos entre otros.
texts.en:
Herlin is a hardworking man who is dedicated to his family. He is married and his wife is a sales executive. Thanks to her support, they have been able to build their house. He has had his job as a printer for several years. He is happy to achieve his goal of improving every day. Afodenic has been the door to improving his family's housing. Today, with this new loan, he will be able to finish a wall in the back part of his lot. It is coming along very well and he hopes to finish it. THis will give him the satisfaction of being able to have more security against the crime in the neighborhood. For this he will buy: stone, three hundred blocks, twenty bags of cement, iron, sand, gravel, and nails, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will buy: stone, three hundred blocks, twenty bags of cement, iron, sand, gravel, and nails among other things to be able to finish building a wall.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more dozens of slippers

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Madres Trabajadoras”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yovana; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos ; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de comida en forma ambulatoria en el paradero final de una empresa que hace servicio público llamada Cabildo, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,ella prepara caldos y segundos, su esposo trabaja como chofer y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar y para comprar ollas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Madres Trabajadoras communal bank. The bank is located within the district of Santiago, which is in the province and department of Cusco.

Yovana is 41 years and has a live-in partner and two children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling food on foot at the final stop of the route for a public transportation company called Cabildo. She works from 8am to 6pm making soups and main course dishes. Her husband works as a driver and together, they get their children ahead. Yovana wants to improve her food selling business. She is requesting the loan to purchase cooking products and pots.

Yovana is grateful for everyone who has made this dream possible and she promises to make her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cooking products and pots.

loans.name: Monica Katiuska

texts.es:
Mónica de 30 años, tiene una papelería en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral rodeada del estero salado de Guayaquil. 

Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido tener su propia papelería ya que es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos que mantener. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm. Vende papelería, cuadernos, plumas, laminas etc. Ella quiere con el préstamo comprar papelería y artículos de papelería etc. 

En el futuro quiere continuar con su negocio, poderlo expandir. También terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mónica is 30 years old and has a stationery store in the front part of her house. She lives in a periurban area, called La Perimetral, that is surrounded by the salt marsh of Guayaquil.

With effort, little by little, she has been able to have her own stationery store since she is a single mother with two children to support. She works from 7am to 10pm and sells stationery, notebooks, pens, laminated sheets, etc. She wants to use the loan to buy stationery and other supplies for the store.

In the future she wants to continue with her business and be able to expand it. She also wants to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pens, notebooks, paints

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es: El señor José Ramón tiene 51 años, es casado y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. El señor se dedica a una pulpería, el posee en su casa de habitación una pulpería muy reconocida en su vivienda, tiene 5 años de tenerla la cual en principio inicio con fondos propios y con mucho esfuerzo y entusiasmo. Don José ha continuado con este negocio debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para mantener a su familia, además que es un negocio bastante rentable. El señor solicita este crédito con el propósito de comprar más mercadería, ya que desea generar mayores ingresos. Su sueño es ampliar mas su negocio para generar mayores ganancias y de esta manera, mejorar la casa en que habita.
texts.en:
José Ramón is 51 years old, married, and has 3 young children for whom he is responsible. He has a grocery store in his house that is very well-known in the area. He opened the store 5 years old with his own savings and with a lot of effort and enthusiasm. José has continued with this business because of the need to earn income to support his family. It is also a rather profitable business.

José is requesting this loan with the intention of purchasing more merchandise because he would like to earn more money. His dream is to further expand his business to have a higher income so that he can make housing improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dominga Del Rosario

texts.es:
Dominga es una señora muy trabajadora, su trabajo desde hace varios años, ha sido de docente y alquiler de cuarto. Logrando a si equilibrar sus gastos.
Gracias a su empeño y tenacidad logro hacer su casa. A un  le falta repellar las paredes, poner piso, pero con estos financiamiento que han venido a beneficiar su hogar espera lograrlo a corto plazo. Ya que como prioridad ha sido las mejoras de los cuartos de alquiler.
Este es su cuarto crédito, en donde hará remodelación en el cuarto de alquiler pues ha venido haciendo las mejoras ya que con el crédito anterior logro mejorar bastante los baños y las paredes, ya que estos son el medio de ingreso necesario para sobresalir adelante, ya que solo con sus ingresos de maestra no alcanza.
texts.en:
Dominga is a very hardworking woman. For several years she has worked as a teacher and in room rental to balance her expenses.

Thanks to her effort and tenacity she was able to build her house. She still needs to plaster the walls and install flooring but with these loans that she has received, she hopes to be able to do it in the short time. Improvements to the rooms that she rents have been her first priority.

This is her fourth loan, which she will use to do remodeling in the rental room. She has been doing improvements and with the previous loan, she was able to make significant improvements to the bathrooms and walls. The rental rooms are a necessary means of income for her to get ahead because her income from teaching is not sufficient.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to remodel rental rooms and provide better service.

loans.name: United Group

texts.en:
Helena K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called the United Group. She is 33 years old and married with five children who are between the ages of 2 and 18 years. She was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to financial constraints.

For three years, she has been selling ladies blouses in the Waterside Market in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000-Liberian-Dollars portion of this 30,000-Liberian-Dollars group loan to buy more dozens of ladies blouses.

She describes herself as a friendly woman whose dream is to improve her business and to continue to educate her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more dozens of ladies blouses

loans.name: Fanny Guadalupe

texts.es:
Fanny pertenece al Banco Comunal Wiracocha que significa Dios Sol en quechua.
Fanny es casada, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 es estudiante y el otro es pequeño, Fanny tiene una tienda de Joyas y materiales para manualidades en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, Fanny aprendió a hacer joyas, manualidades en México y la ciudad de Lima, actualmente brinda clases sobre manualidades, también vende joyas a pedido y sus creaciones son exhibidas en su tienda, Fanny en el próximo mes implementara una nueva tienda.
Fanny necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles que será invertido en la compra de vitrinas y materiales para la nueva tienda.
texts.en:
Fanny belongs to the Wiracocha communal bank. In Quechua, Wiracocha means ‘Sun God’.

Fanny is married and has 2 children, one of which is a student and the other is still little. She has a store where she sells jewelry and craft materials in a rented space located in the city center. Fanny learned to make jewelry and crafts in Mexico and she currently provides craft classes in Lima, where she also sells jewelry by order. Her creations are on display in her store and in the next month, she will open up a new store.

Fanny needs a loan of 3000 PEN that she will invest in the purchase of display cases and materials for her new store.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase display cases and materials for her new store.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Madres Trabajadoras”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yanet; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de venta de golosinas en forma ambulatoria, ella vende en la plaza de armas del Cusco desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, ella vende chupetes, galletas, gaseosas, chicles y dulces, su esposo trabaja como chofer de servicio de taxi, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender las golosinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas al por mayor. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the community bank "Madres Trabajadoras" (working mothers). The bank is located in the district of Santiago, in the province and department of Cusco. She is Sra. Yanet. She is 31 years old and is married with one son. She alternates her daily activities with her business, selling candy as a traveling vendor. She sells in the Plaza de Armas in Cusco from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 pm. She sells lollipops, cookies, soft drinks, chewing gum, and candy. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Srs. Yanet wants to have a store to sell sweets. She is applying for the loan to buy sweets wholesale. She is thankful to those who make it possible for her to pursue her dreams through this means, and she promises to make her loan payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets wholesale.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha que significa Dios Sol en quechua.
Julia es conviviente y tiene un hijo de 2 años, Julia tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama, porque Julia es docente y cuando ella no esta su mama le ayuda.
Julia solicita un préstamo de 1500 soles para la compra de gaseosas.
Los sueños de Julia son tener una ferretería y que todos sus proyectos se cumplan.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Wiracocha communal bank. In Quechua, Wiracocha means ‘Sun God’.

Julia has a live-in partner and a 2-year-old son. She has a store in her parents’ house where she sells general groceries, vegetables, and fruits. Julia is a teacher, so her mother helps her when she is not there.

Julia is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN for the purchase of soft drinks. Her dreams are to have a hardware store and that all of her plans work out.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco reside en el Departamento de San Miguel, tiene 36 años y vive junto a su esposa y tres hijas quienes dependen económicamente de francisco y su esposa, él se dedica a pintar y hace rótulos de publicidad, su esposa vende pupusas y juntos ven la forma para que no falte en su hogar la alimentación.
Francisco atiende el negocio desde las siete de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde junto a un ayudante, ese negocio es el único en la zona por lo que francisco no tiene competencia por el momento.
Él necesita remodelar su negocio ampliándolo y construyendo una oficina pero no cuenta con  los fondos necesarios, por lo que solicita un préstamo para llevar a cabo el mejoramiento del local. Esto ayudara tener mejor atracción de parte de los clientes y les dará mejor servicio ya que estarán mas cómodos en un local mejor organizado y de esta manera Francisco aumentara el número de clientes y mejoraran sus ingresos.
Sus proyecciones a futuro son tener un mejor local, contar con más clientes, mejorar la atención a quienes le visiten, ayudar a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco lives in the Salvadoran department of San Miguel. He is 36 years old and lives with his wife and their three children, who are still economically dependent on them. He paints and makes signs. His wife sells pupusas, a Salvadoran snack. Between the two of them, they make sure their family is well fed. Francisco works from seven in the morning until six in the evening and has one assistant. His business is the only one in the area, which means that for the moment he has no competition. Francisco needs to remodel his business, expanding the space and building an office, but he doesn't have the money needed so he's requested a loan to carry out the improvements. This will help him attract more customers and give them better service, since they'll be more comfortable in a better organized space. In this way, Francisco hopes to expand his customer base and increase his income. His plans for the future are to have a better space and more customers, improve service for those who come to him, and help improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodelar el negocio ampliándolo y construyendo una oficina

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha que significa Dios Sol en quechua.
Miriam es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales uno estudia y el otro es pequeño, Miriam se dedica a la venta de animales menores que compra en las diferentes ferias de la región y también le traen a su casa, los animales los comercializa en el mercado 12 de abril.
Miriam necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuys.
Los sueños de Miriam son tener una tienda de abarrotes, dar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miriam is a member of the Wiracocha communal bank. In Quechua, Wiracocha means ‘Sun God’.

Miriam has a live-in partner and has 2 children, one of which is a student and the other is still little. She works selling young animals that she buys at different markets in the region and brings to her house. She later sells them at the ‘12 de abril’ market’.

Miriam needs a loan of 1000 PEN that she will invest in the purchase of guinea pigs. Her dreams are to have a grocery store and to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase guinea pigs

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 53 años, es una madre de familia muy serena y laboriosa, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Hace más de 16 años María se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de rayitos, tintes, permanentes y cortes de cabello, para ello posee un salón de belleza que es muy concurrida, por lo que se dedica la mayor parte del tiempo. En un inicio su establecimiento lo tenía en un puesto en el mercado de su zona, pero descuido a su familia, así que su esposo la apoyo para que puedan acondicionar su casa e instalar lo que ahora es su salón de belleza. Además de ofrecer el servicio de peluquería también ofrece el servicio de cosmetóloga. Esta contenta con su labor, pues le es rentable y eso le favorece mucho en la economía familiar, es por ello que en adelante desea terminar de construir su casa y tener varias habitaciones con el fin de poder alquilarlos. Es su doceavo crédito con MFP y seguirá siendo puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, puesto que desea tener nuevos créditos. En su grupo, se siente muy contenta, ya que las integrantes, son muy responsables y honestos. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar productos para implementar su salón de belleza, asimismo comprará materiales de construcción para terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Maria, who is 53 years old, is the very serene and hard-working mother of a family. She lives in her own house, with her husband and three children. For more than 16 years, Maria has offered services of highlights, coloring, permanents, and haircuts. For this, she has a beauty salon that is very busy, where she spends the majority of her time. At the beginning, she had her business in a stall in the market in her district, but she had to neglect her family, so her husband helped her prepare their house and install what is today her beauty salon. In addition to offering hairdresser's services, she also offers cosmetology services. She is happy with her work, since it is profitable, and this helps a lot with the family finances. For the same reason, in the future she wants to finish building their house and have several bedrooms that can be rented. This is her twelfth loan with MFP, and she will continue to be punctual in her payments, since she wants to have new loans in the future. She is very happy in her group, since the members are very responsible and honest. With the loan that she is applying for, she is thinking of buying products to stock her beauty salon and at the same time she will buy construction materials to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to stock her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more dozens of slippers

loans.name: Sidi

texts.fr: Monsieur sidy D. est  un célibataire sans enfant de 26 ans. Il habite à Bambilor. Il a été  initié  dans l’aviculture depuis qu’il était jeune par son père. Ainsi  Il a opté  pour  cette activité depuis 2 ans. Il est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis avril 2010. C’est sa première demande en financement. Il sollicite un prêt de 250 000f qui sera  destiné  à  l’achat d’aliments de poussins en vue de mieux renforcer son activité.  les revenus qui seront issus de cette opération  lui permettront de faire face aux frais de scolarisation de ses enfants plus particulièrement.
texts.en:
Mr. Sidy D. is 26-year old single man. He lives in Bambilor. Under his father's instruction he started raising chickens from a very young age. He started his business 2 years ago. He has been a member of the community bank Bambilor since April 2010. This is his first request for a loan. He requests a loan in the amount of 250 000 francs that will be invested in the purchase of feed for his chicks as a means of developing his business. The profits from the busienss will allow him to pay for his children's tuition.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es:
Valeria es viuda, tiene 3 hijos ya independientes, Valeria tiene una tienda en el centro cultural San Cristóbal en donD. venD. artesanías variadas, productos que compra D. los productores D. la region, ademas manda hacer polos turísticos con imágenes D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho que tienen mucha aceptación.
Valeria es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha que significa Dios Sol en quechua y solicita un prestamo D. 2000 soles para la compra D. polos turísticos.
El mayor sueño D. Valeria era conocer Tierra Santa y logro viajar hace algunos meses, ahora su sueño es viajar a México a conocer Santuario D. la Virgen D. Guadalupe.
texts.en:
Valeria is a widow and has three children who are independent. She has a store in the cultural center of San Cristóbal where she sells a variety of handicrafts. Valeria acquires her products from artisans in the region. She also places orders for polo shirts that have images of the city of Ayacucho on them. These items are very popular with tourists.

Valeria is a member of the Communal Bank “Wiracocha”, which means “Sun God” in Quechua. She is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN to buy printed polo shirts to sell to tourists. Her greatest wish was to visit the Holy Land, which she was able to accomplish a few months ago. Now she wants to travel to Mexico to see the Shine of Our Lady of Guadalupe.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase polo shirts to sell to tourists

loans.name: Sania

texts.es:
Sania es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha que significa Dios Sol en quechua.
Sania es casada, tiene 2 hijos que ya son independientes, Sania vende ropa a pedido, sus productos los ofrece a amigos, familiares, la mayor parte de sus ventas son al crédito.
Sania necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, zapatos y casacas.
El sueño de Sania es tener una tienda de radiadores.
texts.en:
Sania is a member of the Communal Bank “Wiracocha”, which means “Sun God” in Quechua. She is married and has two children who are independent.

Sania sells clothing upon request. She offers her products to friends and relatives. Most of her sales are made on credit. She needs a loan of 1500 PEN to invest in the purchase of trousers, shoes, and jackets. Her dream is to open a store where she sells radiators.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers, shoes, and jackets

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Madres Trabajadoras”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Valentina; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio de servicio de llamadas de teléfono en forma ambulatoria, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, su esposo trabaja como chofer y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener una cabina de teléfonos y quiere mejorar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar celulares y pagar las líneas de teléfono. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This bank member belongs to the community bank "Madres Trabahadoras" (working mothers). This bank is located in the Santiago district, in the province and department of Cusco. She is Sra. Valentina. She is 37 years old and is married with two children. She alternates her daily activities with her business of offering telephone calls as a walking vendor. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. Her husband works as a driver, and together they are bringing up their children. She wants to have a shop with telephone booths and wants to improve her business. She is applying for the loan to buy cellular telephones and pay for telephone lines. She is thankful to those who are helping her create her dream through this loan, and she promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cellular phones and pay for telephone lines.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 37-year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and three kids. Youssef has worked in construction since 2008 as a freelancer with 12 years of experience. 

Youssef also works in agriculture and in transporting construction materials. This is his fourth loan cycle with Al Majmou and he's the perfect man to lend money to. His first loan cycles aimed to improve his business as he intends to do now; he's intending to buy an air compressor that is necessary for his business. 

Youssef hopes to expand and improve his work as much as he can.

loans.use: To buy an air compressor that is necessary for his business

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con fundación, pues los financiamientos han sido de gran ayuda. Ella se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Ella inicio este negocio por la necesidad de adquirir un medio de ingreso para su hogar, ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy trabajadora y que además disfruta de interactuar con sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima como sabanas, toallas, cosméticos y calzado.
texts.en:
María Elena has worked with Fundación Leon 2000 for a long time and the loans have been a great help to her. She earns her living by selling general merchandise. María Elena started her business out of necessity because she needed a means of generating income for her household. She has demonstrated that she is hardworking person who enjoys interacting with her customers.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to purchase merchandise such as bedding, towels, cosmetics, and shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bedding, towels, cosmetics, and shoes

loans.name: Sikira

texts.fr: cette femme est une dame très dynamique, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d'alimentation , elle fait ce commerce depuis 2008 dans sa propre boutique. elle n'a jamais obtenu du crédit de WAGES, elle sollicite un premier crédit pour gonfler son stock avec 10 cartons de lait peak, 10 cartons de savons de Marseille, 1à cartons de savons "bel Ivoir", 5 cartons de sardines et divers.
texts.en:
This is a very energetic woman. She is married and has one child. She makes a living by selling groceries, which she has been doing out of her own store since 2008. She never had a loan from WAGES before. She is now seeking her first loan in order to enlarge her stock and buy 10 boxes of “Peak” brand milk (in cartons), 10 boxes of Marseille (olive oil) soap, 1 box of “Bel Ivoire” soap, 5 boxes of sardines, etc

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing food products

loans.name: Dicko Fall

texts.fr: Madame Dicko fall K. est une veuve de 66 ans qui habite  à Bambilor. Elle est commerçante. Elle s’adonne à  l’achat et la vente de légumes tels que choux, piments, etc depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle a choisie ce métier pour avoir des revenus qui lui permettent de  faire face aux dépenses quotidiennes car elle est soutien de famille .Elle est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis novembre 2009. Elle a déjà bénéficiée d’un  prêt au sein de l’institution. Elle sollicite un  crédit de 200 000 francs CFA dont le but est de  renforcer  son étal en légumes et mieux les diversifier en vendant de l’huile de palme, des carottes, et des navets. Ce crédit lui permettra  d’augmenter ses bénéfices  pour mieux gérer la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dicko Fall K. is a 66 year-old widow living in Bambilor. She is a merchant who has been buying and selling vegetables (such as cabbages, hot peppers, etc.) for over 20 years. She chose this business to have revenues which would allow her to face the daily expenses of her family, since she is the breadwinner. She has been a member of the Bambilor branch since November 2009, and has already been the beneficiary of one loan from this organization. She is requesting a 200,000 loan to strengthen her vegetable stand and to diversify it by selling palm oil, carrots and turnips. This loan will allow her to increase her benefits to better manage day-to-day expenses.

Translated from French by Charlotte Buecheler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in working capital

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca se dedica a la preparación y venta de tortillas, tiene 36 años de edad y reside en el Departamento de San Miguel donde vive con sus hijos de 10 y 6 años de edad; Ella tiene este negocio desde hace mucho tiempo en su casa de habitación y sus clientes son personas de la zona, ella los atiende desde las nueve de la mañana hasta las dos de la tarde.
Blanca solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima (maíz, leña, gas) y así contar con materiales suficientes en inventario para atender la demanda de los clientes, además que comprara por grandes cantidades lo que permitirá que obtenga mejores precios.
El sueño de ella es atender una pupuseria, y dar a sus hijos la educación necesaria para que estos puedan superarse y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca prepares and sells tortillas. She is 36 years old and resides in the Department of San Miguel with her children, ages 10 and 6. Blanca has operated her business out of her home for a long time and her customers are people from the area. Her business is open from 9am until 2pm.
